Raksana is 29 years old. She is married and has a nice family. She helps her old parents such as visiting them daily and preparing food for them. She is very hard-working person and loves her job.

She is a farmer and involved in daily farming activities. She has some cattle and raises small calves in her own yard. She usually fattens them and sell their meat in the local market. People in Azerbaijan prepare traditional foods mostly with meat. Since she knows that the existing demand is high she is also planning to expand.

To meet the demand she needs to have calves fatter and to buy few more cows. Currently she is planning to expand her activities. In order to expand her farming business, she needs to buy 3 more calves. For this she needs 1600 AZN. She hopes that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves to fatten and a few more cows

loans.name: Thate Che Village Group 2

texts.en:
Aye and his fellow group members raise livestock such as ducks and pigs. Their previous loan helped Thate Che Village increase their investment in expanding their livestock business. From the additional income generated from their larger businesses, members could cover their family's daily expenses without high-interest local loans.  Additionally, a few villagers are planning to use additional income to purchase solar panels.  This will improve their access to affordable, reliable electricity. 

With a new loan, the village aims to rebuild their duck farm and purchase high quality feed. The entire group wanted to thank the Kiva community for their critical, generous support.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feed and rebuild the duck shelter for 26 villagers flocks

loans.name: Mubeena

texts.en: Mubeena  is 34 years old, married woman shown in the photo with her husband. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Mubeena  has requested for a Murabaha loan of  25000 PKR. She wants  to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Glorimel

texts.en: Glorimel is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has two son; ages 14 and 6 years old. Glorimel is engaged in direct selling business where she sells beauty products, personal care products, shoes, sandals, shirts, under wears and accessories from MSE and Natasha (companies that sells dry goods mention earlier). She has been doing this for four years. Glorimel is a 33-year-old woman who dreams of a business improvement for her family. Thus, she wants to have a better means of living in the future. And that is the reason why she is asking a loan to help her enhance her livelihood. She will buy products mention earlier from the money she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, personal care products, shoes, sandals, shirts, under wears and accessories

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, bread, cooking fat, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will set up a mini supermarket. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice,  flour and other items

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari(variety) store, selling commodities ranging from coffee, seasonings, chips, fruit -flavored juices, shampoo, toothpaste  and toiletries.  She is 62-year old married woman with one dependent.  
Her husband earns a living by working in a private company. His income could be a great help to the family.

For tha past 11 years, she own a sari-sari(variety) store and wants to improve  the content of her store.

Roberta has requested a loan  is  to buy soft drinks and assorted groceries, to continue improving her business. She used the previous loan to stock her shop and wants to continue doing so.

She is thankful to KIVA for the support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and assorted groceries

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Mrs. Lien, 48 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She is married and has two children. Husbandry is main income source of her family. Additional, she is also a hired labour and earn about 120000VND/ day.

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nomenjanahary Betsison

texts.fr:
46 ans, Nomenjanahary est un père de famille responsable et attentionné. Il est marié et le couple a deux enfants de 16 et 8 ans. Ils sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée. 
Il a déjà effectué beaucoup d'activités, il était auparavant machiniste dans une entreprise franche, puis il était boucher après avoir été en chômage technique à cause de la fermeture de l'entreprise et en 2010 il démarrait son propre affaire, il s'agit d'un taxi-phone: une sorte de point d'appels téléphoniques. Il a deux points d'appel dont le deuxième est tenu par sa femme.
C'est un homme avec un esprit créatif, car un jour, il envisage ainsi de pratiquer les expériences qu'il a eu lors de son travail à la zone franche. Il voudrait instaurer un petit atelier de confection.
texts.en:
At 46 years of age, Nomenjanahary is a responsible and attentive father of a family. He is married and the couple have two children, aged 16 and 8, both attending a private school.

Nomenjanahary has already been involved in a number of businesses. He was a machinist in a duty free firm, then a butcher after being technically jobless because of the closure of his firm. In 2010 he started his own business, a taxi-phone, that is, a sort of telephone booth. He has two booths, one of which is run by his wife. He is a man with a creative spirit; one day he plans to put into practice the experience he gained during his work in the duty free zone. He would like to open a little garment factory.

loans.use: to buy telephone refills, a display case, and mobile phones.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a divorced woman and she is the mother of a son, who goes to school. Jacinta sells milk and she is living at her parents house. This house is made of adobe, so it is very fragile.

Jacinta needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Jacinta would like to have her own house in the future and to take her parents with her. She hopes you can help her, as she is experienced with the animals and she works hard.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Rosemila

texts.en:
50-year-old Rosemila owns rice paddies and engages in farming. She grows and sells rice, which serve as the main source of income for the entire family. She has six children. Of whom three of them are still attending school. She hails from the town of Taibon, Bohol.

Rosemila wants to purchase fertilizer. This is vital that could help improve bountiful harvest and generate financial gain. Slowly, she could able to roll-out her capital and invest other business ventures to become productive.

In the future, she is hoping that she could be successful in her chosen field to continue support the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en: Bienvinida runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. Bienvinida love her business, however, she hope to increase her inventory since her goods are taken on credit by her customers. She works hard to earn a living, so that she can help her husband in meeting their family needs. Bienvinida is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, candies, seasonings, and sachet items of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste. With this loan, Bienvinida believes that she can improve her business and her family's life. She has three children aged 1, 14 and 15.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, candies, seasonings, and sachet items of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste

loans.name: Honoria

texts.en: Honoria is a 57-year-old woman who sells fruits and varieties of goods in the community of Baybay, Leyte for more than 25 years. She is married and has six years old daughter. Her husband raised them financially through farming. Thus, Honoria and her husband work together to earn a living and to sustain for daily needs. In the future, she wishes to have a sustainable living and have an abundant life. To do this, she needs our help to enhance her sales by lending her the amount she is requesting. She will use the money to buy fruits and varieties of goods such as noodles, spices, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, eggs and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy fruits and varieties of goods such as noodles, spices, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, eggs and canned goods

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a farm where she grows cabbages and other crops. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs.She hopes that in the future, she will be a large scale farmer. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa lives a simple life with her family in a city of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has three children; ages 18, 14 and 12 years old. She is engaged in direct selling business where she sells beauty products, personal care products, home care products, cosmetics and apparels while her husband is working in a construction site. Thus, Ma. Teresa is asking for loan to buy beauty products, lotion, fragrances, cosmetics, shirts, shoes, sandals, under wears and other products. In addition to this, she will also use the money to buy boat materials. Perhaps, they also engaged in fishing. 45 years old Ma. Teresa dreams to have a stable business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, lotion, fragrances, cosmetics, shirts, shoes, sandals, under wears and other products

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a Kiva borrower. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to have a big salon within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is 42 years old and she lives in Stepanavan city of Lori region. Tamara lives wither daughter and her small grandchild. Tamara from Georgia brings clothes for men and women and she sells it right from her house. She has her regular customers who are her neighbors and friends. Tamara earns on her family living only through this small business and she also pays for her daughter’s tuition fee, who is a student at the Vanadzor Pedagogical Institute.

This woman does her best to have good sale and to earn more profit for her family. She mentions that she just dreams that her daughter finally will manage after her graduation to find a work of her profession and may be that time the financial state of their family will be better than now. This Kiva loan of 400.000 Armenian drams Tamara needs in order to bring new winter season clothes collection in order to have more sale and better income during winter months.

loans.use: to bring new winter season clothes collection in order to have more sale and better income during winter months

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a Kiva borrower. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows cabbages and other crops. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs.  He hopes that in the future, she will be a large scale farmer. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mehvish

texts.en:
Mehvish is 28 years old, a hardworking woman who has 3 children. She is shown in the photo with her husband. She has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Mehvish ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Mehvish has requested for a Murabaha loan of 15000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam is a hardworking woman, 41 years old. She lives with her husband and two children. Her income is mainly from husbandry and cultivation. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her children, she will be able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Ravailaan

texts.en:
Ravailaan is a 54 years old, married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been actively running a ‘Tandoor’ in his locality for many years. A tandoor (clay oven) is used for cooking chapattis and naan, especially in Pakistan. He cooks chapattis and naan with flour, salt and oil then sells them to the people of his community. He also takes orders from nearby hotels and makes enough money to have a decent life.

For the improvement of her husband's business Ravailaan has applied for a Murabaha loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more packs of flour, salt and oil along with the good quality wood for burning. She dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of flour, salt and oil along with the good quality wood for burning.

loans.name: Yavar

texts.en: Yavar is a 22-year-old IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the Bilasuvar region. He is married, and together with his wife he grows some vegetables and fruits. Yavar, with the support of his spouse, is running quite a successful farming business. He has more than 5 years of experience. He relies on his wife's support for managing the farm, and they support each other very well. Yavar is running the farm with great passion and love, because he wants to take care of his old parents, his wife, and his small child. Yavar sells the natural fruits and vegetables in the local market. In Azerbaijan there is a great demand for vegetables to make traditional foods like dolma and bozbash and fruits for after-dinner deserts. He is currently planning to expand the business. He needs 1,200 AZN to buy new fruit trees and fertilizers for his vegetables. He hopes that Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy new fruit trees and fertilizers for his vegetables.

loans.name: Tuan

texts.en: Mrs. Tuan is 44 years old, and she is a hardworking woman. There are five people in her family. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family and protect the environment. Husbandry and cultivation are the main income sources of her family, so she will be able to repay the loan monthly .

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser un medico reconocido, y por medio de su carrera poder ayudar a las personas que necesiten, comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior ha podido abonar sus cuotas, lo que le permitió poder cubrir ese gasto y estudiar tranquilo.
Él esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder cumplir su meta. Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo de vuelta en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Francisco is a person who is striving in order to be able to be a recognized physician, and through his career be able to help people in need. He states that with his previous loan he has been able to pay his fees, which allowed him to cover that expense and study without worries.

He is putting his best effort into meeting his goal. He requests this new loan to invest again in the payment of his tuition.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Молодой предприниматель и добропорядочный человек из маленького города Курган-Тюбе - Дилшод. Ему 26 лет. Он хороший сын, муж и отец. Дилшод единственный добытчик в своей семье. У него есть маленький магазин, где он продает напитки (соки, нектары, энергетические и спиртные напитки). Дилшод решил расширить увеличить ассортимент товара и привести новые виды напитков и привлечь больше клиентов. Но для реализации плана ему нужны средства. Он верит, что с кредитом от KIVA он сможет осуществить свою мечту.
texts.en:
This young entrepreneur and respectable man from the small city of Qurgan-Tube is called Dilshod. He is 26 and a good son, husband and father. He is the only breadwinner in his family. He has a small shop where he sells drinks (juices, nectars, energy drinks and spirits). 

Dilshod has decided to increase his selection of inventory and to bring in new kinds of drinks to attract more customers, but he needs money to carry out this plan. He trusts that with a loan from Kiva he will be able to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to increase his selection of inventory

loans.name: Ba

texts.en: Mrs. Ba is a hardworking woman, 52 years old. She is married and has three children. She would like to improve her standard of living. This loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, and she will be able to repay the loan from selling chickens, pigs, and vegetables.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene estudia la carrera de ingeniería en sistemas informáticos, comenta que de aquí en adelante se ve ejerciendo su profesión y ayudando a sus seres queridos.
Rene sueña con poder usar sus conocimientos para poder ser útil a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rene is studying information systems engineering, and from here on out he sees himself practicing his profession and helping his loved ones.

Rene dreams of using his knowledge to be useful to other people.

He is asking for this loan to be able to pay the fees for his degree so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Ma. Teodel

texts.en: Ma. Teodel is 45 years old and lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is a mother of four boys; ages 20, 19, 17 and 15 years old. They are the reasons why she wants to succeed in life.  She wants to give them better lives. Three years ago, she successfully runs their rice farming business with the help of her children. She works really hard with it to obtain good harvest from their farm in order for them to sustain every day. Ma. Teodel is a strong woman who always stays positive even in a bad situation. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to enhance the growth of their plants and able to give them good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La Señora Florencia es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo.  Está cursando el último   año de la carrera de Licenciatura Farmacéutica.
Comenta que con sacrifico está estudiando, ya que es muy duro trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo. Quiere ser una buena profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para cubrir los gastos de elaboración de Tesis, y así poder culminar sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Florencia is from the city of Curuguaty, she studies and works at the same time. She is attending the last year of a master's degree program in pharmacology. She explains that she is making great efforts to study, since it is very hard to work and study at the same time. She wants to become a good professional that helps other people.

She is requesting this loan to cover the expenses to write the final thesis, and therefore, to be able to finish her studies successfully.

loans.use: to pay for the expenses to write the final thesis.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna and her husband own a “tricycle” (a motorcycle with a covered sidecar that seats anywhere from one passenger to as many as the driver will allow). Tricycle is a common mode of public transportation in the Philippines. Her husband drives this every day to the city of Baybay, Leyte. They have been operating this kind of business for two years to earn a living. Edna is a 45-year-old woman and has six children. The oldest child is 21 years old while the youngest child is six years old. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for their tricycle. In the future, Edna wishes to have a stable business to enhance their earnings. With our help, she may be able to reach her goal through the money we entrust to her.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a Kiva borrower. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a farm where he grows cabbages and other crops. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will be a large scale farmer. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot hopes to receive second Kiva loan as profitable and pleasant as the first one. He lives in Artsvanik village of Syunik region. He lives here alone since he is divorced and his children are already married and they live with their families. Ashot graduated Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute and he finally managed to work of his specialty.

Now he works at the college as a teacher of engineering graphics and technical drawing. He also runs a farm which as he mentions is the main occupation that he has been engaged in with great pleasure. He has cows and chickens in his farm, cultivates vegetables and takes care of apple and pear trees.

Ashot asks this Kiva loan of 700.000 Armenian drams for his pedagogical activities; he will buy a computer and printer for development of his pedagogical activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer and printer for development of his pedagogical activities

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy is 40 years old, married and has two children. She would like to improve her family’s living standards, especially for her children, but lacks capital.

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine. She is able to repay the loan from fishing and selling chicken in her garden.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Miss Diep is a hardworking woman who is 42 years old. There are four people in her family. She has a daily income from her garden such as chickens, ducks and vegetables.

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family. She is able to repay the loan monthly with support from her husband.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Thate Che Village Group 1

texts.en:
The Kiva community's initial loan helped group members purchase high quality duck feed and rebuild their duck farms. Since duck food prices are rising, members are using loans to pre-purchase inputs, and store for use. This is extremely important for lowering expenses so that they can build sustainable small businesses. 

The upcoming loans will help 25 village members purchase not only higher-quality feed in a more timely manner, but funds will also be used to rebuild duck shelters.  Strong duck shelters are especially important for improving resilience during monsoon season. Thate Che group members are very grateful for your generosity and look forward to continuing to grow thanks to the continued support of the Kiva community.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings and rebuild the duck farms, for 25 villagers

loans.name: Kinza

texts.en:
Kinza is a 20 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work.

That is why Kinza has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. Kinza is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to customers.

loans.name: Phi

texts.en: Mrs. Phi  is 55 years old. There are four people in her family. Fishing and raising chickens and pigs are her main sources of income, and she also has a vegetable garden. She can cover her family’s daily costs and education with her income from raising pigs. With this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members, especially the kids.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Thuyet

texts.en: Mrs. Thuyet is a hardworking woman, 53 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in a small house without a hygienic latrine. This loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family's health and standard of living. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing, and she and her husband have more than 20 years experience in these businesses. With the support of her husband, she will be able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh is 42 years old. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and three children.

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine, which can contribute to improving the health of her family as well as environment protection.

Husbandry and fishing are the main income sources of her family, so she is able to pay the loan monthly from the chicken raising activity and selling fish her husband caught.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 58 years old and she lives alone in Stepanavan city of Lori region. She has higher musical education the department of kanon (Armenian national musical instrument). Now she works at the Stepanavan Art School as a teacher of the 'kanon' and here she is also the bandmaster.

Margarita also gives private courses of teaching the children to play on 'kanon' and they are going to have entrance exams. Margarita mentions with great pleasure that she does her best to pass to her pupils the knowledge and skills of playing on this magic instrument. She tells them the story of this instrument and about the musicians who became worldwide popular artists thanks to their skills of paying on 'kanon'.

This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Margarita asks as she wants to buy a computer, for having more information about musical world, and she also wants to furnish comfortably the room where she is giving her courses with her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer, for having more information about musical world and she also wants to furnish comfortably the room where she gives her courses.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en: For 12 years, Gleceria sells fruits and vegetables in the city of Baybay, Leyte to earn a living, while her husband is working hard in their farm. They are doing this to provide the needs of their children; they have two children to supports. Gleceria has been doing this fruits and vegetables selling for 12 years.  In addition to this, she also runs a sari-sari (varieties) store business. With this, she is asking a loan to buy fruits. Aside from this, she will buy varieties of goods such as canned goods, noodles, spices, salt, vinegar, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, candies, sugar and coffee. Gleceria is a 59-year-old woman and plans to improve her businesses in the future for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy fruits; canned goods, noodles, spices, salt, vinegar, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, candies, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Mrs. Yen is 44 years old. She is married and has three children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Husbandry and cultivation are the main income sources of her family.

With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family's living standard as well as protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Mrs. Lieu is a hardworking woman who is 57 years old. She is married and has one child. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and cultivation.

She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn is 34 years old. He is an internally displaced person. Huseyn lives in a Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He has a medium-sized family, consisting of a husband, wife, and 3 children. Huseyn is a very hardworking, diligent person. He is a farmer. He raises cattle and sheep. He usually fattens them and then takes them to market to sell their meat. Huseyn wakes up early every morning to feed the animals.

Huseyn's young sons are the main inspiration for him to make this business successful. He knows that with a good family income he will be able to raise his children well and give them a proper education. For this he works very hard. People in the local market like his business principles, because he is very honest and sells healthy, natural meat. Huseyn is planning to expand the business. He needs to buy 3 calves and is in great need of Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to renovate the cow shed and buy animal feeds. Her business goal is to be able to supply milk to supermarkets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will meet her family financial needs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to renovate the cow shed and buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Guerilleras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 3 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

MARLEN: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora afable y con cualidades de líder, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Desde hace 4 años luchó elabora fritos y fritanga, gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido diversificar su negocio y tener su propio tramo donde vende ropa usada. Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada mixta y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of two women and one man, all very enterprising, who organized three years ago in order to access funding to improve their small businesses by increasing their inventory, and thus also be able to improve their incomes. This in turn enables them to meet their basic household needs, ensure the education of their children, and expand their businesses.

Marlen is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is an affable woman with leadership qualities. A native of Puerto Cabezas, she is 36 years old, married with three teenage children who are in primary and secondary school. For 4 years she has striven, making an assortment of deep-fried snacks, grilled meats, etc. Thanks to loans granted earlier by Pana Pana and funded by Kiva, she has been able to diversify her business and have her own stall where she sells used clothing. She is applying for funding to buy in Managua a bundle of assorted used clothing to sell at affordable rates to her customers in Bilwi. Her dream is to improve the infrastructure of her business.

loans.use: buy in Managua a bundle of assorted used clothing.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Mrs. Quyen is a hardworking woman, 48 years old, and she lives with her family.  Her income is mainly from husbandry and fishing. She would like to borrow this loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her parents, she will be able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 47 years old and she lives with her elder son in Stepanavan city of Lori region. Her smaller son is at the army now passing his military service. Anahit graduated Vanadzor Musical College the department of piano.

She is very good musician and also perfect pedagogue and already 27 years she works at the Stepanavan Art School as a teacher of piano. She also gives paid courses of piano playing for the pupils who are going to give entrance exams for different higher musical institutions. As mentions Anahit her love towards the music passed to her elder son also who works at the city’s military unit band. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Anahit asks as she wants to buy a computer and also several pieces of musical literature to be aware of all the news and innovations in the music world.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also several pieces of musical literature to be aware of all the news and innovations in the music world.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells handbags, clothes, shoes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of handbags, shoes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of handbags, shoes.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is from Yerevan, living with his wife and son. Harutyun's son currently serves in the army. For already 10 years, he has been involved in furniture manufacturing. He receives orders and makes furniture in a rented garage.

Harutyun asks this loan to purchase materials to make furniture and cover current orders, so he will be able to gather a better income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for materials to make furniture and cover current orders, so Harutyun will be able to gather income for his family

loans.name: A Ga Lone Village Group

texts.en:
A new loan from Kiva's community will help Kay and her fellow members expand their livestock business by purchasing more ducklings.  Some members will be use the funds to purchase higher quality feed. 

Kiva's previous loan allowed featured borrower Kay’s family to generate additional income that they used to cover school fees for their son, currently in secondary school. The entire group is so thankful for your generosity.  They look forward to building sustainable and growing businesses with the continued support of the Kiva community.

loans.use: purchase ducks and buy high quality feed.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 46 years old. There are five people in her family. Cultivation and husbandry are her main source of income. She can cover the family’s daily costs and education from her pig raising income.

With this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members, especially the kids. She has a daily income from her garden from vegetables, chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Inspiracion Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente año y medio para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana. 

BERNICIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, tiene 33 años, casada, con 2 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como Albañil. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos. Inicio vendiendo ropa usada de manera ambulante, gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA y las ganancias percibidas, le han permitido diversificar sus productos. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar en Managua ropa nueva, entre otros productos. Ella sueña contener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women of the Miskito ethnic group in the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who work every day with the determination to achieve the growth of their small businesses. They organized as a solidarity group approximately a year and a half ago in order to be able to obtain loans from Pana Pana.

Bernicia is a member of the solidarity group. She is a kind woman, 33 years old, married with two teenage children who are in primary school. Her husband works as a casual bricklayer. With the purpose of having her own source of income and contributing to household expenses and to the education of their children, she began selling used clothing as a street vendor. Thanks to loans granted earlier by Pana Pana and the profits seen, she has been able to diversify her products. She is applying for a loan to buy in Managua new clothes, among other products. She dreams of having a thriving business.

loans.use: buy in Managua new clothes, among other products.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is 24 years old, married woman; the man shown in the photo is her husband who has been doing a business of crockery’s sales for many years. He offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. He makes sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income.

For the improvement of her husband's business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR. In this way he would be able to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is positive about her husband's future earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 51 years old; she is a married woman shown in the photo with her husband. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a Murabaha loan of PKR 20000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector is 70 years old and lives in La Paz. He is a retired man but he has to work as a driver, although he is a sick man. Hector is alone and he needs a lone to fix up the room where he lives as the rains are damaging the walls.

He hopes you can help him. Hector would like to be more healthy in the future

loans.use: to fix up the room where he lives

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is 31 years old. She is IDP.  Arzu lives in Bilasuvar IDP settlement. She is married and is involved in raising cattle. She owns dozens of cows. She uses them for both milk and meat purposes. Arzu is a very energetic and hard-working person. She knows that being a successful farmer in the rural area requires more dedication and expertise. For this end she does her best. At this age she works tirelessly. Her energy and dedicated approach makes her different and more preferable. She fattens the calves and sells their meat to many clients in the local bazaar. People prefer meat for the traditional foods like kebabs, kufta, etc. Currently, she is planning to expand her business. Arzu wants to buy three calves. In order to buy these calves she needs a 2000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Marialorfel

texts.en: Marialofel is a hard working woman from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She has the creativity and the skill to almost sell all things that she can get hold of. She sell curtains, dried fish, longganisa (cured, sweet pork sausage) and chorizo (spanish sausage) for an income. Marialofel is seeking for additional capital through a loan in CEVI to finance her businesss. She will use it to buy more curtain, trendy clothes, dried fish, spanish sausage and longganisa. It is her goal to see her two children finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy curtain, trendy clothes, dried fish, spanish sausage and longganisa

loans.name: Dan Asabe

texts.en: Dan Asabe is maize farmer from Tashar Bakwake village. As a member of Babban Gona, Dan Asabe is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Dan Asabe would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dan Asabe can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Dan Asabe is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 33 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work.

That is why Nida has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR for her husband to purchase new tires along with an engine for providing better services. Nida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires along with an engine for providing better services.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is a hardworking woman, 57 years old. She is a widow  and has two children. She needs loan to build a sanitary latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Her family’s income is  from husbandry, cultivation  so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 46 years old, married and has three children. She would like to improve her family’s living standards but lacks the capital.

This loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan from their husbandry and cultivation business.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty is a hardworking 62 year old woman. She lives with her family in a small house and without a hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry.

Ty would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Maiwada

texts.en:
Maiwada is maize farmer from the village of Awai Sabon Layi. He is a member of Babban Gona and is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. He has the opportunity to attain yields up to 8 metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Maiwada, he would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when prices are at their lowest. This loan and Babban Gona’s support will enable him to store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Maiwada is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community.

loans.use: to eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a maize farmer from Kofar Madaki Awai village. As a Babban Gona member, Murtala is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Murtala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Murtala will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Murtala no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Murtala hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business wit h it.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
El servir a los demás, es una de las características que tiene Diana, una joven de 32 años de edad, que decidió estudiar Enfermería, mientras trabajaba como doméstica para pagar sus estudios y cumplir con su sueño de ayudar a las personas por medio de la salud. 
El apoyo de los padres de Diana, siendo su madre costurera por muchos años y su padre como trabajador de una institución del gobierno, han servido de motivación para estar en cuarto año de la carrera, tiempo donde le es asignado muchos trabajos. Razón por la cual, solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y cancelar los últimos aranceles de la carrera. Esto le facilitará la realización de sus investigaciones. En sus planes está realizar una especialidad en cuidados críticos.
texts.en:
Serving others is the one of the characteristics of Diana. She is a 32 year old young woman who decided to study nursing while she worked as a housekeeper to pay for her studies and fulfill her dream of helping others through health. The support of Diana's parents -- her mother has been a seamstress for many years and her father works at a government institution -- has served as motivation in this fourth year of her studies, a time in which she is assigned many duties.

For this reason, she seeks a loan to buy a computer and to pay off the last fees for her degree. This will facilitate the carrying out of her research. She plans to pursue a specialization in critical care.

loans.use: to buy a computer and pay off the last fees for her degree.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona farmer. Yahaya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan Yahaya can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yahaya has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Yahaya is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to repair his house or move into a bigger home, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get university education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en:
Muhammed is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Babban Gona’s support makes Muhammed thankful that his days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields up to 8 metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Muhammed would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest in order to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Muhammed will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season. He will be able to obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

Muhammed now has the opportunity to grow his agriculture business and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to  eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en:
Abdurashid is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Abdurashid is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Abdurashid would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdurashid will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season. He can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

Abdurashid now has the opportunity to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land.

loans.use: to  eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Mustapha is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Mustapha has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mustapha would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market. With the help of this loan, Mustapha can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mustapha is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate selingl maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdulrahman is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdulrahman is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Abdulrahman would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulrahman will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/hectare, Abdulrahman now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Munkaila

texts.en:
Munkaila is a Babban Gona farmer. Munkaila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Munkaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, Munkaila can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Munkaila has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000/hectare. Munkaila is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to repair his house or move into a bigger home, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Las Fresas 1 Group

texts.en:
Ana Maria:
When her father was killed he left fourteen children. Ana Maria was eleven years old, and her father and she were traveling to another Guatemalan department when he died. They traveled because there was a fair, and they went to sell maize, salt, vegetables and other products. They carred the merchandise on horses. She and her brother tried to continue with her father's work, but the horses died, so they had to begin working cleaning and preparing fields of neighbors.

Ana Maria is forty five years old, she married at the age of twenty four years. She has eight children, seven female and one male. Two of her daughters are teachers of elementary education, two are in secondary education, and the small children are studying their primary education.

Her husband and she were talking about what to do to improve their income, one opportunity was to take a loan. They did not know about Chajulense Association of Women United for Life, until a friend told her that the loans were given without too many procedures and in a short period of time. She contacted the Association and got her first credit. This year she is getting her fifth credit and will use it to expand her tissue activity by buying thread, and buying tools and wood for her husband’s carpentry.

Ana Maria is the leader of the Group Strawberries 1. The group is composed by six women, all from the Ixil Maya ethnicity. The group will use their loans for Clothing 33%, Manufacturing 33% and Services 33%. On average each member of the group has six children, the average age of the women is 43 years old, 33% are illiterate, 17% studied until second grade of primary education, and 33% ended their primary education. The average amount of their loans is Q5,066.67

loans.use: to buy thread to expand her tissue activity.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Sovann is 20 years old, and is a single freshman. She is from Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. She is pursuing an associate degree, majoring in finance and banking at a university in the city.

Sovann's parents are rice farmers. Due to the fact that she is short of the finances needed to pay her tuition fees from first to the fourth year of school, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to earn an associate degree successfully.

In the future, Sovann is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary. She wants to build a new house, and if she has children, she wants her children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees if she can support it.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year of school.

loans.name: Phern

texts.en:
Phern is a 36-year-old married rice farmer with three children, and she resides in a village in Kampong Speu, Cambodia. She has cultivated rice since 2000. Her husband is a 45-year-old construction worker. One of her three children is a factory worker and the other two children attend school. Together, they earn approximately USD $21 each day.

Phern is requesting a loan because she wants to buy cows to fatten and breed, in order to sell their calves. With the loan, she will be able to improve the family’s finances. For her future plans, she is going to build a new proper house and help her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and breed.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
This young, hardworking entrepreneur is Erwin from Tigbauan, Iloilo. He is married to Roma, 26, and they have a young child. Erwin drives his own tricycle for income, while his wife raises hogs in their backyard. It’s impressive how they work together to support the needs of their child and how they strive to save for their future.

However, there are times when his tricycle breaks down and his income also stops. He has to buy some spare parts and pay for its repair. He implores your heartfelt generosity to lend him an amount of PHP 10,000 for this purpose. He knows that continuous income from his tricycle can help sustain their daily expenses, because their hogs are not yet ready for selling at this time.

As a young and starting couple, Erwin and his wife have a typical dream to build their own house and procure some appliances. They want to achieve it before huge educational expenses come their way.

Erwin prays for good health and a brighter future for his family. He is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tricycle and pay for its repair.

loans.name: Jemmalyn

texts.en: Jemmalyn, 31, is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for the past year. Jemmalyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Jemmalyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is widowed and works hard to support her family. For two years she has sold herbal products in the Philippines. Ana requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more herbal products to sell. In the future, Ana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more herbal products to sell

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Pedrita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store business. Pedrita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her food vending business. Pedrita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Edralin

texts.en:
Edralin is 32 years old and has two children. Edralin is married, and her two children are in school.

Edralin is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edralin has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Edralin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Abdulrashid

texts.en:
Abdulrashid is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Abdulrashid is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Abdulrashid would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulrashid will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

Abdulrashid now has the opportunity to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike for business purposes.

loans.use: to eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a maize farmer from Awai Sabon Layi village. Isah is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields up to 8 metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Isah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Isah will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Isah no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. Isah hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Francisco Alberto

texts.es:
Los negocios y las empresas, son la mayor atracción para Francisco, un joven de veinte años de edad que cursa el tercer año de Administración de Empresas, carrera muy atractiva para los jóvenes por su amplio abanico de oportunidades laborales. Él cuenta con el apoyo de su padre y de su madre, además del de su hermana, quien es doctora. 
En estos momentos Francisco se encuentra en una etapa donde estar informados es el principal objetivo de la carrera, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar libros, materiales necesarios para alimentar sus conocimientos profesionales. En un futuro sueña con realizar la licenciatura de esta misma carrera técnica.
texts.en:
Businesses and companies are the biggest attraction for Francisco, a young man of twenty who is in his third year of Business Administration, a career that is very attractive for young people due to its wide range of job opportunities. He has the support of his father and of his mother, in addition to that of his sister, who is a doctor.

Francisco right now is at a stage where being informed is the main objective of his major, for which he is requesting a loan to buy books, materials needed to feed his professional knowledge. In the future he dreams of doing a degree in this same technical career.

loans.use: buy books.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He has the opportunity to attain yields up to 8 metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market. With the help of this loan, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is thankful that he has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to eliminate  selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a maize farmer from Awai Sabon Layi village. Yusif is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Yusif would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Yusif will use this loan to store the maize he harvests,enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yusif hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Salmanu

texts.en:
Salmanu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Salmanu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Salmanu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salmanu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

Salmanu now has the opportunity to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is maize farmer from Damari village. Ayuba is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Ayuba is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike for business purposes.

loans.use: to eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Wawa Prana Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal Wawa Prana, está integrada por 10 mujeres luchadoras (Maura, Mayla Vanessa, Maurita, Victoria, Josefa, Evonicia, Delia, Ardiña, Thelma y Ellen), todas viven en la comunidad Wawa Boom, conocida por el Río Wawa que recorre 160 Km. del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, de la Costa Caribe Norte.

Son mujeres que se organizaron hace aproximadamente 4 años, con el propósito de hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de frito de pescado, pollo, cerdo, gaseosas y venta de ropa usada que ofrecen sus productos en el Lanchón, es una barcaza de hierro que sirve de puente para trasladar al otro lado a vehículos y poblacion que se dirige al municipio de Puerto Cabezas o a la Región del Pacifico de Nicaragua. Escogieron el nombre de Wawa Prana, porque en miskito significa la belleza del Rio Wawa.

Maura: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer con deseos de superación y cualidades de líder, tiene 53 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos: 2 son mayores de edad e independientes y cuatro adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y primaria. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a venta de fritos en “El Lanchón”, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar: filipitas, aceite, sal, pollo, pescado, tomate, repollo, entre otros productos para la elaboración de fritos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
The communal association Wawa Prana is made up of 10 hardworking women (Maura, Mayla Vanessa, Maurita, Victoria, Josefa, Evonicia, Delia, Ardiña, Thelma and Ellen). They all live in the Wawa Boom community, known for the Wawa river that runs 160 kilometers from the town of Puerto Cabezas on the northern caribbean coast.

These women got together approximately 4 years ago, with the goal of making their small businesses grow. They sell fried fish, chicken, pork, sodas and used clothes. They offer their products in El Lanchón, which is an iron barge that serves as a bridge to the other side for vehicles and people going to the town of Puerto Cabezas or the Pacific Region of Nicaragua. They chose the name Wawa Prana because in Miskito it means the beauty of the Wawa River.

Maura is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a woman with a desire to succeed and the qualities of a leader. She is 53 years old, and is married with 6 children. Two are older and independent and 4 are adolescents who are in elementary and middle school. For 10 years she has sold fried food in "El Lanchón". In this manner she generates her own income and contributes to the household expenses and to the schooling of her children. She is seeking financing to buy filipitas (a type of plantain), oil, salt, chicken, fish, tomato, and cabbage, among other products, to make fried food. Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy filipitas (a type of plantain), oil, salt, chicken, fish, tomato, and cabbage, among other products.

loans.name: Ratna's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote village of Koraput district of Odisha, India, Ratna had not many job options to earn some income for her family. Her husband's earnings as a daily wager were not sufficient for their family of three, and he is also growing old to work for long hours and support the family alone. Facing financial crisis, Ratna started a cow-rearing activity from an extension of her home five years ago, as she finds it cost effective.

With her family's support, she has been contributing additional income towards her family by selling cow's milk at the local market. Her experience of five years in the business of milk-selling has helped her gain enough knowledge and understanding of the same. She currently has one cow to manage with, but feels the need to scale up the activity by purchasing one more cow for the business. For buying one more cow, she needs some financial support.

Therefore, she, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. The loan amount will ultimately help her in having a continuous milk supply, which she can sell at the local market and earn some regular income for her family.

Ratna is standing to the left hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for her business.

loans.name: Kamala's Group

texts.en:
Kamala is a simple lady who hails from a very poor and low-income household in a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is a married and differently abled lady. She resides with her husband and two sons and two daughters. Her husband is the sole earner in her family and works very hard to be capable enough to let both ends meet for her family. The income earned by her husband is only hand to mouth for them.

Unfortunately, Kamala does not have an appropriate toilet facility at her home and has to walk long distances in order to relieve herself in dense bushes late at night and early in the evening. She finds this practice very dangerous, as she feels the risk of insect and animal bites, and she is vulnerable to crimes.

In order to restore her privacy and maintain proper hygiene, Kamala, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to install a latrine pan and a hand pump, and build a toilet in her house.

Kamala is standing in the middle in the photograph.

loans.use: to install a latrine pan and a hand pump, and build a toilet in her house.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She lives at her own house that is without electricity and running water.

She has operated a retail shop for four years to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation.

She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with five children, all attend school. She lives at her own house that is without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a door-to-door clothing business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase bales of clothes She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a 27-year-old married guy living in Bethlehem, Palestine. He has five children ranging in age from three to nine years old, with three of them currently attending school.

Malek has been running his fruit and vegetable stall in the local market for eight years. He sells the products to the local families. He says that lately the main challenges he faces are the weather conditions and the current competitors in the same market.

Malek has now requested this loan to buy fresh fruits and vegetables for his stall. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to improve his family's standard of living. Malek plans to improve and expand his business by increasing his business capital and managing more than one stall in the same local market.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables for his stall.

loans.name: Fetuli

texts.en:
Fetuli is a 43-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of Solomon Islands.

She owns and operate a small convenience to sell rice, noodles, biscuits, snacks, and frozen meats. She has been doing this for five years.

Fetuli requests a loan to buy chicken wings, mince meat, and sausage and pay her children's school fees. She plan to use her profits to cover her family's daily expenses and meet her children school fees.

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chicken wings, mince meat, and sausage for her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is a married woman with four children, all attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water.

She has operated a retail shop for two years to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation and theft in her business.

She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a single woman with two children, all attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not running water.

She has operated a retail shop for four years to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of late payments from clients who pay on credit.

She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Leda

texts.en:
This is Leda, 48 years old and married to Rizaldy, a taxi driver. They have six children. They live in Tigbauan, Iloilo in the Visayas region.
