The couple are experiencing different kinds of challenges in relation to raising their six children. There’s the need for daily food, school transportation and allowances, tuition fees, and so on. But the couple persist, focusing on their goal to give them a better future with a completed college education. To attain this, Leda helps her husband earn a living by raising hogs in their backyard. Simultaneously she buys and sells peanuts, which gives her additional daily income.

Due to increasing family expenses, Leda wants to increase her income from hog raising. To do this, she has to fatten more piglets that she can sell after several months. But it will also cost her a large sum for expenses and capital for feed, medicine, vitamins, and piglets. This is why she is knocking at your generous hearts to lend her PHP 13,000 additional capital. She aims to steadily improve her hog raising venture to attain her dream of owning a big piggery someday.

She shares her aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT. She’s a dedicated member of the organization, where she continually gains inspiration from Bible reflections and sharing life experiences.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, medicine, and vitamins.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with six children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 55 years old.

Elizabeth has a welding shop business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 19,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For more than five years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business.

With the KSHS 8,500, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a married woman living in Jenin, Palestine. She has two little children.

Ayat has been running her greenhouse for five years and sells its products to the local families. She says that lately the main challenges she faces are the weather conditions and the currency fluctuation.

Ayat has a successful story with ACAD, previously completing one loan. She has now requested this loan to buy needed pesticides for her greenhouse. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's standard of living.

Ayat plans to increase her business capital and invest in her business by expanding it. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy needed pesticides for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
From the province of Guimbal, Iloilo, Sarah is 42 years old and married to Sean, a tricycle driver. They have two children; one is a college student while the other one is in high school. Sarah feels the sacrifices of her husband because she knows that as a tricycle driver, he has to endure the scorching sun and the rains so as to provide for the family.

With hope to augment her family's income, Sarah ventured into the variety store business two years ago. Her daily profit adds up to her husband's income as a tricycle driver. But their tricycle has to undergo maintenance from time to time. Without this process, it will break down and will be idle for days. To ensure efficient and safe service, Sarah is humbly seeking your help in the amount of PHP 10,000 to pay for spare parts, oil, and fuel for her tricycle. A certain amount will also be allotted to buy more supplies for her inventory.

Sarah aims to acquire another tricycle to improve their income, better provide for her family's needs and save enough for the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, oil, and fuel for her tricycle

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
For 26 years Emma, aged 49, has been raising hogs in back of her house located in Guimbal, Iloilo. It’s been a helpful source of additional income that supported her older children who are already working as of now. It continuously provides for her youngest child who is in high school.

Hog raising is a promising enterprise but the return of investment takes several months. Emma plans to enhance her business with the aid of additional capital worth PHP 17,000 that she can use to buy more piglets, feed, medicine and vitamins. Additional income that will be derived from this will ease up their everyday expenses.

George, her 54-year-old husband, is a fisherman who is also working really hard for his family. Someday they want to see their children with stable jobs and enjoying better living conditions.

Emma shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, feed, medicine and vitamins.

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling roasted whole chicken in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more chickens and spices for her business. Jocel has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Jocel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and spices for her business.

loans.name: Nasambu

texts.en:
Nasambu is a single woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Nasambu operates a grocery vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KSHS 4,500 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras del Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se organizaron recientemente, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario SAN MIGUEL, en honor a la comunidad donde son originarias las 3 integrantes.

CONCEPCION: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer luchadora, con deseos de superación y cualidades de líder, madre soltera de 3 hijos: 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y un pequeño de un año de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar cerdos lechones, engordarlos y comercializarlos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of 3 women entrepreneurs of the Municipality Puerto Cabezas. They recently organized in order to access funding via loans to increase the inventory of their small businesses, with the aim of improving their income and to be able to meet their basic household needs, ensure the education of their children, and improve their homes. They decided to name the solidarity group San Miguel, in honor of the community of which the 3 members are natives.

Concepción is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a woman who strives with a desire to excel and leadership qualities. She is a single mother of 3 children: 2 teenagers who attend primary school and a little one, one year of age. In order to raise her family, she is applying for her first loan to buy piglets, fatten them and market them. She dreams of being a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: buy piglets, fatten them and market them.

loans.name: Las Fresas 3 Group

texts.en:
Tona was greatly affected by the armed conflict in Guatemala. Since then, when she hears any disorder she begins to fear that the next step will be people faced with machine guns and grenades. This is because her father participated in the Guatemalan armed conflict and when he came back from the mountains he did not want to eat, could not sleep and his nature changed completely, and also because at some moments she was in the middle of the conflict.

Tona is forty-one years old. She married at the age of sixteen and she has three children. She began seeking credit because she wanted to grow vegetables. She invested her first two credits to develop this project. Now she will invest her loan to develop a good restaurant in Chajul. Tona says that in Chajul there are no good restaurants. She will continue with her vegetables.

Tona is the leather of Strawberries 3 Group (Las Fresas 3). The group is integrated by seven women, all of whom are from the Ixil Maya ethnicity. The group will use their loans for retail 57%, clothing 14%, and food 14%. On average each member of the group has three children, their average age is 43, 43% are illiterate, 14% did not end their elementary education, 14% ended with an elementary education, 14% studied to the ninth grade and 14% graduated as secretary. The average amount of their loans is GTQ 2,743.

loans.use: to develop her restaurant in Chajul.

loans.name: Hanitra

texts.fr:
Hanitra est une femme mariée, son époux est chauffeur salarié de taxi-bus. Le couple a trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Son objectif vis à vis de ses enfants est de leurs offrir les meilleures scolarisations pour qu'ils réussissent bien dans leurs études et c'est la raison de son travail acharné.
Hanitra dirige un commerce en détail d'ustensiles de cuisines. Elle débutait cette activité en 2002 après avoir travailler dans une entreprise franche pendant trois années. Elle possède donc tant d'années d'expérience dans ce domaine, par conséquent, elle maîtrise bien comment fonctionne l'activité: les saisons et les besoins des clients.
Le rêve du couple est de pouvoir construire une maison pour éviter de toujours louer pendant long temps.
texts.en:
Hanitra is a married woman whose husband is a salaried driver of a taxi-bus. The couple have three children, of whom two are enrolled in school. Hanitra's goal, as far as the children are concerned, is to offer them the best schooling so that they can succeed in their studies. That is the reason for Hanitra's unremitting work.

Hanitra runs a business retailing kitchen utensils. She began the business in 2002 after having worked in a duty free firm for three years. For this reason, she has a number of years of experience in her field, and therefore knows how to run her business: the seasons and the needs of her clientele.

The couple's dream is to be able to build a house so that they can avoid having to pay rent for too long.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en:
Naumi is married and has four adult children. For the past 15 years, she has operated a cereals shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality and theft are her major challenges.

Naumi requested a loan from Yehu for 25,000 KES, which she will use to purchase a stock of maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food. Naumi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Savan

texts.en:
Savan is an 18-year-old single student who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in marketing. She is in her first year. Savan lives in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Savan's family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay for her tuition fees.

She is short of finances to pay her tuition fees from the first to fourth years; therefore, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to earn her bachelor’s degree successfully. In the future, Savan is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary. This will help her to build a proper house, and if she gets children she wants her children to study to pursue bachelor's or master's degrees if she can support it.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to fourth years

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 12 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PHP 50,000 which she used to buy fishing nets, floats, anchors, and coolers for her fishing business. Her fishing equipment business is doing well as she delivered most of it to her customers and set again to buy another set of bulk equipment to sell.

Julita wanted to expand again her business by adding another boat. She is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 60,000 to buy a secondhand boat to be repaired and used as an additional fishing vessel to catch fish. The loan will enable her to hire more neighbors and save money to support their needs in case of a typhoon where they can't catch fish.

Julita's dream is still having her child finish college and now she's helping her community to also reach their dreams for their families.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand boat to be repaired and used as an additional fishing vessel to catch fish.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.fr: Ernest est un brave père de famille de 36. Il est marié. Le couple a deux enfants. La famille a deux activités sources de revenu: d'abord la fabrication et vente  des yaourts assurés principalement par la femme et ensuite le commerce en détail des différents articles exercé par Ernest. Auparavant les 3 prêts déjà obtenus et remboursés sans problème étaient utilisés pour développer la première activité. Maintenant, le couple voudrait investir dans le petit commerce et le crédit va être utilisé pour acheter des sandales en plastiques spéciales pour les saisons de pluies et des casquettes. C'est un père courageux et actif qui ne cesse pas de chercher toujours des idées pour améliorer le revenu familial.
texts.en:
Ernest is an honest family man who is 36 years old. He is married. The couple has two children. The family has two sources of income: first, the production and sales of yogurt (primarily managed by the wife) and next, the retail sale of various goods (managed by Ernest).

Previously, the three loans already received (and paid back without problem) were used to expand the yogurt business. Now, the couple would like to invest in Ernest's small business, and this loan will be used to buy plastic sandals for the rainy season and baseball hats.

He is a brave and active father who is always looking for ideas to improve the family's income.

loans.use: to buy sandals and baseball hats.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is married and has one child. She operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of seasonality in her place of operation.

Mariamu requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo con 56 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 1 año de edad, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al cultivo de café, cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar.

Segundo se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cafeto, de la variedad Catimor sembrando 1 hectárea de cafeto de su propiedad,con una experiencia en el rubro hace 30 años y hace 20 años cultiva cafeto. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro.El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de su cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Segundo es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.Firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Segundo is 56 years old and lives in common law marriage with his spouse and their minor child who is 1 year old, in the district of Santo Tomas, province of Cutervo, Cajamarca,Perú.

Residents of this town work, for the most part, in coffee cultivation, the breeding and sale of small animals and growing basic food crops.

Segundo works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee trees, of the Catimor variety, having planted 1 ha of his own property.  He has 30 yeas of experience in the business and for 20 years he has cultivated coffee. Additionally, he breeds and sells small animals and cultivates basic food group products.  He has much experience in the business.

 The loan will be used  to invest in maintenance of his crops,  thus he will get good production and as such higher incomes.  He will then be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Segundo is a new member for Edpyme Alternativa.  He will sign along with his spouse.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance of his crops.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 61 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more items like detergent soap, canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cereals, and coffee to sell.

She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cereals, and coffee. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like detergent soap, canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cereals, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, está acompañada, su pareja es empleado de seguridad pública, tienen una hija de 4 años de edad que aún no asiste a la escuela.  

Ana, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también ella trabaja en la agricultura con su mamá y un hermano desde hace11 años, su mamá le ha enseñado muy bien estos trabajos para que en un futuro ella pudiera defenderse en la vida, sus cultivos están a una distancia de 10 minutos de viaja a pie y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a las 11:00 p.m. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar una parte del abono que le falta para la milpa y para el frijol que han sembrado con su mamá, ya que ella siempre ha sembrado para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyar en los gastos a su esposo.

Los sueños de Ana, tiene es que siempre Dios le de vida para seguir cultivando y que todo le salga bien a su esposo, para que juntos saquen adelante a la familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 25, studied through fifth grade, and did not have the opportunity to study further. She is married, her partner is employed by public safety, they have a daughter of 4 years old who does not yet attend school.

Ana is a homemaker, but for 11 years she has also worked in agriculture with her mother and a brother. Her mother has taught her how to do this work so that in the future she could fend for herself in life. Their crops are at a distance of 10 minutes traveling on foot and her schedule is from 6:00 am to 11:00 pm.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a portion of the fertilizer she needs for the corn and beans that they have planted with her mother, since she has always planted in order to be able to bring up her children and help her husband with expenses. Ana’s dream is that God always give her life to continue cultivating and that everything go well for her husband, so that together they might raise their family.

loans.use: buy a portion of the fertilizer she needs for the corn and beans.

loans.name: Harilala Tiana

texts.fr:
41 ans, Harilala est mariée et mère de famille de quatre enfants. Les enfants sont tous scolarisés. L'époux travaille, il est agent de sécurité dans une école primaire publique.
Elle avant tout couturière, et en cette période de rentrée scolaire, elle a beaucoup de commande d'uniformes scolaires. Et puis, elle tient aussi un commerce de friperie. La vente de friperie est depuis 2012 tandis que la couture est déjà pratiquée depuis long temps. Le prêt va financer le friperie, c'est l'activité qui a encore besoin de renforcement de fonds, à développer et à améliorer.
Elle travaille dur pour pouvoir offrir à ses enfants une meilleure qualité de vie et les meilleurs scolarisations possibles.
texts.en:
Harilala, age 41, is married with 4 children who all go to school. Her husband is a security guard in a public primary school.

Harilala is a seamstress by trade and has been practicing this work for a long time. At the start of the school year, she has a lot of school uniforms to make. As a sideline, she has also been selling second-hand clothing since 2012.

This loan will help her to finance her used clothing sales, as this is the activity that still needs to be sustained, developed and improved.

She works hard to give her children a better quality of life and the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a single mother and now has two kids to feed by herself. She is now selling vegetables and potatoes and also making cheese for sale. Her business is OK, but Herminia needs a loan to buy a milking cow.

Herminia has a small farm and she needs your help, because one of her animals was sick, so she had an emergency.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow in order to produce cheese

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married mother of one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For more than four years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 10 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Don Gilberto de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica al cultivo de loroco desde hace mas de 3 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores cosechas y asi mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Gilberto is 66 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion. He has worked raising loroco (Fernaldia pandurata) for more than 3 years. He sells his products in the different markets that are close to his house. With the profits he gets from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs like fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. In this way he can have a better harvest and better economic income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has one child. For the past two years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Halima requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly is food. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam lives in Irbid. She is 34 years old.

Maryam is a woman who likes to stand on her own and earn her ‎own income to help her family get ahead. She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells basic ‎goods, grains, deli meats, beans, ice cream, water, and other goods to meet the needs of her customers ‎who visit her store for their daily needs.

She applied for a loan to help her buy more food products to sell, to increase her income. ‎

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Mamitiana Valérie

texts.fr:
Valérie a 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Ces derniers sont scolarisés et son mari travaille dans une entreprise franche. Elle aussi, elle y travaillait auparavant, et depuis 2013, elle décidait de démissionner et exercer une activité de commerce parce que les tâches y étaient très dures or le salaire était faible. Parfois, il lui arrivait de travaillait tard le soir.
Le magasin général a encore besoin de fonds supplémentaire et le prêt va être utilisé pour acheter des produits de premières nécessités comme savons, bougies, allumettes, huiles de tables, ris, sels etc. Les étagères ne sont pas encore bien remplis de marchandises. Elle a encore besoin d'y investir davantage.
texts.en:
[Mamitiana] Valérie is a 32-year-old, married mother of two children. The children are in school, and her husband works in a free enterprise company. She previously worked there, as well. In 2013, she decided to leave the company and open her own business because the tasks there were very hard and the salary was small. Sometimes, she had to work late into the evening.

The general store still needs additional funding, and the loan will be used to buy basic goods like soaps, candles, matches, table oil, rice, salt, etc. The shelves are not yet well-stocked with merchandise. She still needs more investment.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities: rice, oil, salt, soaps, candles, matches, etc.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 15 years, Mwanakombo has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
If ambitions are not combined with willpower and persistence, they will remain unfulfilled and nothing ‎more than wishful dreams in the minds of their owners.‎

Sabreen, realized this formula that lies between ambition and willpower at an early stage and ‎sought to achieve it. She has since realized what she has always dreamed about.‎

Sabreen, 24 years old, is single and lives with her siblings in Dairalla.‎

Sabreen suffered a shock after the death of her parents. She became a young, caring sister for her siblings. When she realized that her siblings needed her more than ever, she decided to start her own business and ‎started to sell clothes and household supplies to the neighbors and families.

Sabreen is working hard to ‎provide a good life for herself and her siblings and she wants to expand her business and buy winter ‎clothes, household supplies, and more products to increase her sales and increase her profits. Then she will ‎be able to improve the standard of living of her siblings.‎

loans.use: to buy winter ‎clothes, household supplies, and more products.

loans.name: Solidarite Group

texts.fr: Alimata est âgée de 44 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis  20 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son expérience dans son activité, son dynamisme sa propriété, et le goût particulier de ses jus, ses jus sont bien glacée à tout moment ce qui plait aux clients. Elle veut acheter le sachet d'eau à 25 000 f, du sucre à 50 000, du bissap à 30 000, du mil pour du jus traditionnel à 20 000, les autres ingrédients à 75 000 f. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Alimata is a 44-year-old, married mother of four children. She has had her business for 20 years. Her business experience, energy, cleanliness, and the particular flavor of her juices make her business successful. Her juices are very cold all the time, which her customers appreciate.

She would like to buy one container of water (at 25,000 francs), sugar (at 50,000 francs), hibiscus flowers (at 30,000 francs), millet for traditional juice (at 20,000 francs), and other ingredients (at 75,000 francs). The loan will be used to purchase sufficient supplies to strengthen her business. She has already received loans many times and reimbursed them on time.

loans.use: to buy one container of water (at 25,000 francs), sugar (at 50,000 francs), hibiscus flowers (at 30,000 francs), millet for traditional juice (at 20,000 francs), other ingredients (at 75,000 francs).

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is a final year student of Regent University College of Science and Technology. He is studying Information System Science. He was using his personal savings from his salary and sometimes a loan from his bank which comes at high interest rates. He sees himself as owning an IT firm that will train people in the IT field. Albert loves working with computers and helping other professionals to solve their problems through the use of IT. Albert is inspired by great people in the IT industries like Steve Jobs, Deiter Uchdrof, and Bill Gates because they started their careers from a very non significant level and have been able to make it to the top despite their humble beginning. The loan will help him to pay his outstanding school fees before because without this loan he will not be able to graduate as scheduled since he will have to suspend his studies and work to get funds to pay for his fees.

loans.use: to pay for his tution fees.

loans.name: Maria Rubidia

texts.es:
María, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja como electricista en una empresa, tienen dos hijos, de los cuales la mayor está en kínder y la menor aún no asiste a la escuela. 

María, es una mujer emprendedora, se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y adultos, ella antes de acompañarse también vendía ropa para ayudarle a sus padres con los gastos de la casa; ahora le ayuda a su pareja con los gastos de sus hijos y aparte de los oficios domésticos también sigue vendiendo ropa en los caseríos vecinos  y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 m.d.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar 3 docenas de pantalones y 3 docenas de comisas para caballero, mujer y para niños; el préstamo le permitirá tener su propia fuente de ingresos y con esto darle apoyo económico a su pareja. 

Los sueños de María, son mantener su negocio para darles lo necesario a sus hijos, además espera que sus hijos estudien y se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old, and studied up to grade nine.  She lives common law and her partner works as an electrician in a company.  They have two children, of which the oldest is in kindergarten and the youngest does not attend school yet.

Maria is an enterprising woman.  She sells clothing for children and adults.  Before moving in with her partner, she also used to sell clothes to help her parents with household expenses.  Now, she helps her partner with the cost of raising their children and, aside from household chores, she still also sells clothes in neighboring villages.  Her working hours are from 6:00 am to 12:00 noon.

Maria needs a loan to purchase 3 dozen pairs of pants and 3 dozen shirts for men, women and children.  The loan will allow her to have her own source of income and thereby provide financial support to her partner.

Maria's dreams are to keep her business to provide her children with what they need.  In addition, she hopes that her children will be able to study and prepare academically.

loans.use: to purchase 3 dozen pairs of pants and 3 dozen shirts for men, women and children.

loans.name: Wesily

texts.en:
The person in the above photograph is Wesily. He is 28 years old.

Wesily earns a living by farming maize and potatoes. He is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training he received which equipped him with the skills to manage his business.

The high market demand has encouraged Wesley to apply for a loan to boost his potato farming by buying fertilizer and hybrid seeds. This will increase his business and also his supply.

Wesily is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and hybrid seeds that will boost farming.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios de la casa y juntos tienen 7 hijos de los cuales tres de ellos están estudiando.

Luis, tiene  6 años de dedicarse a la venta de pan, este trabajo se lo enseño un sobrino que realizaba la misma actividad y desde entonce el decidió vender pan; él se levanta a las 4:00 de la mañana para ir a la panadería y salir a vender a los cantones aledaños, la venta la realiza en dos jornadas, uno turno de las 4:30 a.m. a las 8:00 a.m. y uno en la tarde de 3:00 a 5:00 p.m.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar un repuesto para la motocicleta, porque necesita que este en buen estado, porque esa es su herramienta de trabajo para salir a vender pan.

El sueño de Luis, es tener su propia panadería, porque es un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Luis, age 32, studied until first grade. He didn't have the opportunity to continue studying. He lives with his partner, who devotes herself to the household duties. Together they have 7 children, three of whom are studying.

Luis has been selling bread for 6 years. A nephew who did the same work taught it to him, and from then on, he decided to sell bread. He gets up at 4:00 in the morning in order to go to the bakery and go out to sell in the neighboring cantons. He makes his sales in two trips: one shift is from 4:30 a.m. to 8:00 a.m. and one is in the afternoon, from 3:00 to 5:00 p.m.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of a replacement part for his motorcycle, as he needs it to be in good condition because that is what he uses for his work selling the bread.

Luis's dream is to have his own bakery, because it's a good business.

loans.use: to purchase a replacement part for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Liliane Margueritte

texts.fr:
38 ans, Liliane est mariée et son mari est déjà retraité. Le couple a deux enfants et ils sont tous scolarisés. Elle commençait à exercer l'activité de commerce en détail des ustensiles de cuisine en 2000. Elle ouvre à 7 h 30 le matin et est fermée à 18 h. Puis arrivée à la maison, elle produit des bonbons coco jusqu'à 23 h la nuit  qu'elle livre tôt le matin. C'est toujours comme ça son rythme. C'est une femme travailleuse, exemple de force et de courage. 
Son objectif est de pouvoir améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille, pouvoir bâtir son propre patrimoine, devenir autonome.
texts.en:
Liliane, aged 38, is married, and her husband is retired. The couple have two children, both in school. In 2000, she began her retail business involving kitchen utensils. It is open at 7:30 AM and closed at 6 PM. Arriving back home, she makes chocolate sweets until 11 PM and delivers them early in the morning. Her schedule is always like this. She is hard-working and an example of strength and courage.

Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions, build her own family home, and become autonomous.

loans.use: to purchase stainless steel kitchen utensils

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

Tima has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables, like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. In addition, she operates an open air food-selling business that earns her another source of income.

With the loan, Tima is requesting stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Nazma

texts.en:
Nazma is a 38 year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store for the past five years. 

Nazma's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business, but due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy these products. Therefore, Nazma has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and earn more profits in order to better manage his household and business expenses. 

Nazma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Imarika Group

texts.en:
Abdala is the father of three children; one of them is grown-up while others are still in school. For ten years now, he has been running a cafe business selling juice, milk, snacks etc. He works from 5 am to 12 midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Abdala's first loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the cafe store to meet his customer's demand. Abdala dreams of expanding his business to meet his customers' needs.

Abdala will share this loan with his loan group "Imarika," which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  restock the out-of-stock items in the cafe store to meet his customer's demand.

loans.name: Chanrith's Group

texts.en: Chanrith’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chanrith makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Veng's Group

texts.en: Veng’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Veng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and seller by selling groceries to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.fr:
Augustine est une femme agriculteur de 44 ans, travailleuse et courageuse. Elle est passionnée des activités à la campagne. Pour elle, si on veut avancer, la meilleure chose à faire est de produire.
Elle vit toujours dans la campagne depuis sa naissance, donc elle maîtrise bien les travaux et activités rurales. L'élevage et l'agriculture sont ses principales sources de revenu.
L'élevage de zébu  fait partie de ses exploitations et le prêt va être utilisé pour acheter une jeune vache. Celle-ci va reproduire et produira du lait. Le projet est d'exploiter un élevage de vache laitière.
Elle est mariée et son mari l'aide dans l'exercice de tous ces activités, le couple a quatre enfants dont 2 travaillent déjà et deux encore scolarisés.
texts.en:
Augustine is woman farmer, 44 years old, who is hard-working and courageous. She is passionate about farmwork. For her, to get ahead, the best thing to do is to be productive.

She still lives in the countryside, where she was born. So she has a real mastery of different kinds of work and rural businesses. Livestock farming and growing crops are her main income sources.

The raising of zébu [a type of cattle] is part of her operation. The loan will be used to purchase a young cow, which will have calves and produce milk. The plan is to operate a dairy farm.

She is married, and her husband helps her in all her work. The couple have four children, of whom two are already working, and two are still in school.

loans.use: to purchase a young cow

loans.name: Youth Tahidi Wanawake Women Group

texts.en:
The lady on the left hand side is Lucy, a member of Youth Tahidi Wanawake Women Group. She is 39 years old, married and has six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development, savings and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Her current economic activity is maize, dairy and bean farming. She needs a loan from Kiva to buy second hand clothes for resale. This new enterprise will enable her to increase her level of income in order to continue supporting her family by providing basic needs with ease.

Lucy is very grateful to kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes for resale to boost income thus more profits.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: In 2012, Kaneez wanted to make her dream of making education available to all, a reality. She opened a school despite the people of her community insisting that she would fail and that a school in their area would never succeed. Today, she has 139 students and works to increase enrollment every day by encouraging local parents to realize that their children need education. Kaneez borrowed PKR 75,000 because she wants to repair any damaged and worn-away facilities in the school building but more importantly to build a functioning bathroom and to purchase a computer for the students to work on. Kaneez hopes that by steadily improving her school, her community will realize the importance of education and change their minds on sending their children.

loans.use: to repair any damaged and worn-away facilities in the school building, to build a functioning bathroom, and to purchase a computer for the students to work on.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Abdullahi now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alegre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras (Eteldina, Sonia e Isolda) que se integraron hace año y medio, para gestionar  financiamiento mediante créditos con garantía solidaria, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios de venta de chiverías, mariscos y pulpería respectivamente, de esa manera poder vender más y mejorar sus ingresos. Todas ellas quieren lograr mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

ETELDINA: Es la Coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora sonriente de 50 años de edad, casada con 7 hijos: 2 son mayores de edad y 5 que estudian su carrera universitaria, secundaria y primaria. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, inicio vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogos de manera ambulante, gracias a los creditor otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido diversificas su negocio, actualmente  tiene un tramo en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, donde vende chiverías y fritos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: filipitas, aceite, sal, pollo, pescado, tomate, repollo, entre otros productos para la elaboración de fritos. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three struggling women (Eteldina, Sonia, and Isolda) who came together a year and a half ago in order to manage their finances by taking out loans, with the guarantee of their mutual support. With the loans, they can buy merchandise for their small businesses, which sell snacks, seafood, and groceries, respectively. In this way, they can sell more and improve their incomes. All three women want to be able to better their lives, cover the basic necessities, guarantee the education of their children, and improve their homes.

Eteldina is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a fifty-year-old woman who is still smiling. She has seven children: two are older, and the other five are studying in college, high school, and elementary school. With the intention of contributing to the expenses of the home and education of her children, she became a traveling saleswoman, selling beauty products through catalogues. Thanks to the loans granted by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, she has been able to diversify her business.

Currently, she has a stall in one of the markets in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas, where she sells snacks and fried food. She is asking for a loan to buy bananas, oil, salt, chicken, fish, tomatoes, and cabbage, among other products, for the production of fried food. She dreams of opening a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oil, salt, chicken, fish, tomatoes, and cabbage, among other products

loans.name: Victor Constantino

texts.es:
Victor con 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Victor cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto familiares como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Victor se dedica a la agricultura,al cultivo de maíz,cuenta con terreno propio, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar,como son yuca y menestras.Ademas cuenta con su moto carguera con la cuál brinda servicio de transporte de carga en su caserío. Solicita crédito para invertir en la compra de abonos y gastos de mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz, de esta manera obtener un mejor rendimiento de sus cultivos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Victor es socio recurrente y exclusivo para Edpyme Alternativa, este es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Victor is 40 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his spouse and their children in Cañaris district, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque department, Perú. Victor has very good work and personal references from the inhabitants of the area. The people here work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Victor works in agriculture, growing corn. He has his own land and more than ten years experience in the field. Additionally he grows food like yucca and legumes. He also has a cargo motorcycle he uses to provides cargo transportation in his village.

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of manure and maintenance costs for his corn crop. In his way he can obtain a higher yield from his crops and improve his quality of living

Victor is a repeat and exclusive member of Edpyme Alternativa. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of manure and maintenance costs for his corn crop.

loans.name: Las Fresas 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana studied for ten years at the school alongside the Chajulense Association of Women United for Life. She remembers that she was not a great student, but sometimes she presented great homeworks; she had good teachers. When she was in fourth grade her father told her that he did not have the money for her to continue studying. She stopped studying for a year, and worked at weaving. Then a year later she came back to school and paid for her studies. She studied to the ninth year; the cycle of basic education in Guatemala.

Juana is thirty-five years old and has four children. She married at the age of fifteen and worked at weaving to help with the household expenses. Five years ago her husband was searching for a job, and she was weaving, so they opened a store selling thread. Now both of them work at the store, and their fifth credit will be used for expanding the store, by buying thread. With their income they provide an education to their children, the adolescent children study in high school and the smaller children study at the elementary school.

Juana is the leader of Group Strawberries 2, the group is composed of seven women. They are all of the Ixil Maya ethnicity. The group will use their loans for retail (42%), clothing (29%), and manufacturing (29%). On average each member of the group has three children, the average age of the women is 36, 14% are illiterate, 57% did not complete their elementary education and 29% studied to the ninth grade. Their average amount of each of their loans is GTQ 3,971.

loans.use: to buy thread for expanding their thread store

loans.name: David Alexis Andrianaivo

texts.fr: David a 38 ans, il est marié. Sa femme travaille comme gens de maison et l’appuie également dans la préparation des produits de la gargote. Le couple a deux enfants (12-5 ans) tous scolarisés dans une école privée. David  a commencé l’activité de gargote en 2010, cette activité est combinée  à la vente de friperies. Au début, il vendait seulement des beignets et du café en raison de l’insuffisance des moyens financiers. Il n’a pas cessé de chercher les moyens pour développer l’activité. Les prêts obtenus lui ont permis de diversifier les produits de la gargote et de créer l’autre activité (vente de friperie). David  n’hésite jamais à saisir les opportunités qui lui sont offertes  pour améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille, notamment l’éducation de ses enfants. En raison des efforts déployés pour développer son activité, il dispose actuellement d’un point de vente à part l'emploi des six personnes pour effectuer des ventes ambulantes de collations. Il prévoit de devenir un demi-grossiste dans la vente de friperie. Le rêve est de pouvoir construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
David is 38 years old and married. His wife works as a domestic and also supports him in preparing food for the eatery. The couple have two children (aged 12 and 5), both in a private school.

David started his eatery business in 2010, and it is combined with the sale of secondhand clothing. At first, he sold only beignets and coffee due to a lack of financial means. He keeps looking for ways to develop his business. The loans obtained have enabled him to diversify his menu offerings and to establish another business, selling secondhand clothing.

David has never hesitated to seize the opportunities offered to him for improving his family's living conditions, especially his children’s education. Because of the efforts expended to develop his business, he currently has a sales outlet, aside from six employees selling snacks on the streets from place to place.

He plans on becoming a wholesaler in the area of used clothing. His dream is to be able to build a house of his own.

loans.use: to purchase flours, oils, sugar, and a bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Inocente

texts.en: Inocente is 49 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in Tambogrande, Piura, Perú, and grows organic mangoes. He feels that organic production is the future and dreams of growing the best organic mangoes ever. Inocente needs a US$ 350 loan for fertilizing his fields and increasing his organic mango production. With the additional income, he will send his children to college.

loans.use: to manure the fields and increase the organic mango production.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
SUGHRAN is the age of 45, the mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a green grocer by profession, and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables.

So, SUGHRAN asked for a loan so her son would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

SUGHRAN is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables in bulk so her son can sell them at his vegetable shop.

loans.name: Rushna Bibi

texts.en:
Rushna Bibi is 28 years old and the mother of five children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She does embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business eight years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Rushna Bibi buys materials that are required by her kind of embroidery style from the market. She herself handles her transactions with the customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business. So, Rushna Bibi requested a loan so that she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Rushna Bibi will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw material for herself.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: Luis de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el posee un taller de mecánica automotriz ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una caja de herramientas, micas y burros de motores ya que los que actualmente posee están muy deteriorados, y a si poder para seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Luis, age 31, lives in his own house with his life companion. He has had an automobile repair shop at his place of residence for 10 years, and he has many customers because of his good work. With what he earns from his work he is able to pay some of his household's expenses.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a tool kit, headlight lens covers, and motor stands, as the ones that he has currently are very worn out. In this way, he can continue working in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a tool kit, headlight lens covers, and motor stands.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Aminu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Aminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aminu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Aminu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sjida

texts.en:
Sjida is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She is a hard-working and independent mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring at her home. She has been doing it for the past 10 years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. She sews garments for the nearest factories; her husband brings cloth from the factory. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has become out of order due to continuous work. Moreover, she wants to purchase a new Juki machine that is useful for providing fast and more efficient stitching work. In addition to repaying the loan, Sjida thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new Juki machine for her tailoring services.

loans.name: Mujizat Group

texts.en:
The Mujizat group is composed of 6 women and chaired by Nelci, a 52-year-old woman who is married to Yulius, 49, a truck driver. She is a mother of 3 daughters and 3 sons. She owns a business of selling cake at home and has been engaged in this business for the last 13 years. In addition, she also sells kerosene. She is grateful for the income earned enables her to help her husband in covering their daily living.

She has planned to produce more cakes as the demand of customers has risen, however, she does not have enough money to make the plan come true. When an Account Officer introduced the group loan product to some women in the village, including Nelci, they were very interested as through the loan they have an opportunity to improve their living standards and businesses as well. Along with 5 women, Nelci formed the Mujizat Group and requested a loan of totaling IDR 18,000,000 from TLM. Nelci wants to buy more ingredients such as; sugar, wheat, cooking oil, butter, etc. and kerosene as well while other members also would like to spend their part for the businesses and other interest. Nelci and other women are appreciative of Kiva’s support through TLM that will benefit their businesses ahead.

loans.use: to buy more baking ingredients and supplies such as; sugar, wheat, cooking oil, butter, etc and kerosene

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Ángel Rafael

texts.es: Ángel es habitante de Galapa un municipio del departamento del Atlántico, y se vinculó al comercio tras recibir la propuesta de unos familiares que viajaban a distintos lugares del país a comprar prendas de vestir para posteriormente venderlas, ellos le suministraron mercancías: blusas, pantalones y camisas para que iniciara con su negocio. En la actualidad cuenta con 15 años en la actividad y ha logrado prosperar con el paso del tiempo.  Ángel de 55 años de edad es muy entregado a su trabajo y diariamente está dispuesto a promocionar las nuevas colecciones de ropa, él disfruta de su negocio y a futuro desearía tener su propio almacén. Para  aprovechar el incremento de la demanda a causa de la temporada decembrina, realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en ropa; específicamente camisas y pantalones, mercancías que exhibirá a sus clientes potenciales ofreciéndoles facilidades de pago.  Ángel se encuentra separado y es padre de un hijo de 23 años de edad y su compromiso con su el ha sido infalible.
texts.en:
Ángel is a resident of Galapa, a town in the Átlantico department, and he became involved in sales through receiving the proposition from a few relatives who were traveling to different places in the country to buy clothing to later sell. They stocked merchandise such as blouses, pants and shirts in order to start their business. They currently have 15 years in business and have achieved success with the passage of time.

Ángel is 55 years old and is very dedicated to his work, and every day he is ready to promote the new collections of clothing. In the future he would like to have his own store.

In order to make the most of the demand of the holiday season, he is requesting a loan. This is his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy clothing. He is specifically buying shirts and pants, merchandise that he will display to his potential customers, offering them credit options.

He is separated and is the father of one son, 23 years old, and his commitment to him has been unerring.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as shirts and pants for his business.

loans.name: Juan Gaspar

texts.es: El señor Juan vive junto a su familia, con mucho esfuerzo han logrado construir su vivienda, sin embargo, necesita un préstamo de $500 para la compra de material, entre estos, láminas para cielos, madera y demás materiales para realizar mejoras en el techo de su vivienda. Con esto ayudaría a aislar el calor del día, mejorando las condiciones de calidad de vida de su vivienda.
texts.en: Juan lives with his family, and with a lot of effort, has achieved building his home.  He, however, needs a loan of $500 to buy construction materials, among them being roofing sheets, wood and other materials, in order to make improvements to the roof of his house.  This would help him to insulate it from the day's heat, improving the conditions of quality of life in his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to the roof of his house.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a single woman with no children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Teresia has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, Teresia wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman. She has six children, four of whom attend school. Tabu owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Tabu has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business. Tabu wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale with the KES 30,000. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is a married woman with seven kids, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Njira operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale with the KES 30,000 loan. Njira decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a pub business for the past four years, selling in a shop to the neighbors. She mentioned competition as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of beer for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of beer for resale.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 49 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, no pudo seguir estudiando debido a los pocos recursos económicos que tenía su familia; es madre soltera, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales 3 trabajan y dos estudian y solo los dos que estudian viven con ella.

María, se dedica a la venta de plantas desde hace más de nueve años, negocio que decidió desempeñar por iniciativa propia y apoyo de amigos; pero además de eso también vende frituras como: turrones, palomitas de maíz, y otros.- Antes de colocar su negocio de plantas, ella trabajó en oficios domésticos en la capital durante 22 años, las ventas de platas las realiza en el pueblo cercano y ciudades aledañas y solo ella se dedica a la venta de plantas en ese lugar.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar plantas para el vivero como: rosas, árboles frutales, cactus y una variedad de plantas para jardín, con esto ella podrá tener mercadería para la venta y obtener ingresos los cuales le ayudaran a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Los sueños de María, son hacer crecer el negocio de plantas, que sus hijos estudien en la universidad y trabajen y mejorar la vivienda para tener mejor comodidad para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old and studied up to Grade 5. She couldn't continue her studies due to the low economic resources of her family. She is a single mother of five children. Three of them work, two study and only the two that study live with her.

María has worked selling plants for more than nine years. She started the business on her own initiative with the help of friends. She also works selling snack food like nougats, popcorn and others. Before staring her plant business she worked as a domestic in the capital for 22 years. She sells the plants in the neighboring town and near-by cities and she is the only plant vendor in this place.

María needs the loan to buy plants for her greenhouse like roses, fruit trees, cactus and a variety of garden plants. Doing this she will have merchandise to sell and obtain income which will help improve the living conditions of her family.

María's dreams are to expand her plant business, have her children study at university and work and improve her house to have more comfort for her and her children.

loans.use: to buy plants for her greenhouse like roses, fruit trees, cactus and a variety of garden plants.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo con 60 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Teofilo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Teofilo se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de cafeto, de variedad Catimor, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 30 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo. De esta manera incrementará los rendimientos de su cultivo.

Teofilo es socio recurrente para Edpyme alternativa.Ha manejado dos créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Teofilo, 60, lives with his wife and children in the Cañaris district, Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque department, in Peru. Teofilo has excellent personal and professional references from people living in the area. Most of the people there work in agriculture, commercial business, and livestock.
Teofilo works in agriculture, specifically growing the Catimor variety of coffee, he has thirty years of experience in this field. He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his crop. In this way he will improve his yield. Teofilo has been a borrower with Edpyme before. He has taken out two previous loans, both of which he paid back on time.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his crop.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen 1 hija que está estudiando kínder.

Rosa, tiene una tienda en la que vende todo lo relacionado con la cocina, también vende bebidas y golosinas, tiene un año de tener este negocio, el cual le ha permitido generar ingresos y ayudarle a su pareja con los gastos de la casa, la ubicación de su casa es idónea para la venta porque está cerca de la escuela. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mercadería para la tienda como, pan, café, bebidas, golosinas, arroz, azúcar, entre otros, ella espera comprar mercadería por mayor para reducir los gastos.

Los sueños de Rosa, es hacer crecer las ventas y tener mejores ingresos para darle mayor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 25, studied until eighth grade. She lives with her partner, who works in agriculture. They have one daughter who is studying in kindergarten.

Rosa has a store in which she sells everything related to cooking, and she also sells beverages and snacks. She has had this business for a year, and it has enabled her to generate income and help her partner with the household expenses. The location of her home is ideal for sales because it is near the school.

She needs the loan to purchase merchandise for the store, such as bread, coffee, beverages, snacks, rice, sugar, and other items. She hopes to purchase merchandise at wholesale in order to reduce the costs.

Rosa's dreams are to make sales grow and have better income in order to give her family greater stability.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the store, such as bread, coffee, beverages, snacks, rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with four children, all of whom have completed schooling. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a pub business for the past two years, selling from a shop to the neighbors and passers-by. She mentioned competition as a major challenge in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase chairs, tables and a stock of beer for resale. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables and a stock of beer for resale.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

Zena has operated a grocery vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces challenges of high cost and seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario, de 55 años de edad, no estudio debido a que el padre murió cuando él tenía 9 años y él tuvo que trabajar a temprana edad y hace un poco más de dos años falleció su esposa, tiene dos hijos propios y tres hijastros, de los cuales uno de sus hijos y dos de sus hijastros están en el extranjero, y una hija y su hijastra viven cerca de él, pero en su casa vive solo. 

Mario, tiene una venta de artesanías y juguetes en el parque de la ciudad, el cual ha administrado por más de siete años, el trabajo lo ha realizado por iniciativa propia y además trabaja como albañil desde hace 21 años y en este negocio de artesanías le ayuda a la hijastra, quien vende cuando él no puede, las ventas las realiza el fin de semana de 8:00 de la mañana a 6:00 de la tarde. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar artesanías y juguetes como: pelotas, peluches, muñecas, etc. con esta inversión su negocio mejorara y podrá vender más productos.

El sueño de Mario, es ver crecer su negocio y comprar más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Mario is 55 years old and did not go to school because his father died when he was 9 years old and he had to work from an early age. A little more than two years ago, his wife passed away. He has two children of his own and three stepchildren. Out of them, one of his children and two of his stepchildren are abroad; one daughter, and one stepdaughter live nearby, but he lives alone in his home.

He has a business selling crafts and toys in the city park, which he has run for more than 7 years. He has done this work by his own initiative and has also worked as a builder for 21 years. His stepdaughter helps him with his craft business, who sells when he is not able to. He performs his sales on the weekends from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening.

He needs the loan in order to buy crafts and toys such as balls, stuffed toys, dolls, among others. With this investment he will improve his business and will be able to sell more products. Mario's dream is to see his business grow and buy a greater variety of goods.

loans.use: to buy crafts and toys such as balls, stuffed toys, dolls and others.

loans.name: Alh. Adamu

texts.en:
Alh. Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Alh. Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Adamu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Alh. Adamu can now grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and will use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mónica Beatriz

texts.es:
Mónica es una mujer trabajadora y orgullosa madre soltera de dos pequeñas de once y seis años de edad. Estudió la licenciatura de pedagogía y actualmente vive en el Distrito Federal en donde tiene su papelería desde hace un año.
