El negocio de Mónica inició con la intención de darles a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida y la oportunidad de pasar más tiempo con ella. Actualmente solo cuenta con una sucursal pero su sueño es poder abrir una más y crear una cadena de papelerías. 
Para poder crear una cartera de clientes sólida y sacar a sus hijas adelante, Mónica solicitó un crédito el cual le ha ayudado a comprar más mercancía con el fin de incrementar sus ventas, así como a financiar un proyecto de encuadernación que la ha brindado más oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en: Monica is a proud, hard-working woman and single mother of two children, ages eleven and six. She studied pedagogy and currently lives in Mexico City where she has had her stationery shop for a year. Monica started her business with the goal of giving her daughters a better life, and to have more time to spend with them. Right now she just has one location, but her dream is to open another one, and have a chain of stores. In order to build up a solid clientele and support her children, Monica applied for a loan to help her purchase more merchandise, with the goal of increasing her sales, and to finance a book binding project which has provided her with more work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to increase her sales and to finance a book binding project.

loans.name: Mwongeli

texts.en: Mwongeli  is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase maize flour, rice and  beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice and  beans

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 25,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is a married woman and has three  children, two of whom attend school and the other one is still young. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family. For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her place of operation. With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.es: John Fredy tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero vive con sus padres que tienen edad avanzada, él es agricultor cinco años atrás todos los días a las seis de la mañana se levanta a cuidar sus plantas de papa, con las pequeñas ventas de este producto ha podido costear los gastos de alimentación y medicinas de sus padres. John Fredy necesita el dinero para comprar una bomba de fumigar facilitando y aumentando la rapidez en  su trabajo generando mayores ingresos para poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
John Fredy is 20 years old, single, and lives with his elderly parents. He has been a farmer for the past five years, waking up at six in the morning every day to care for his potato plants. With the small sales from this product he has been able to pay for food and medicine for his parents.

John Fredy needs a loan to buy a pump spray facilitating and increasing the speed in which he can fumigate and complete his work, so he can make more money to cover household needs.

loans.use: to buy a fumigation sprayer for his crops.

loans.name: Hira's Group

texts.en:
Hira hails from a low-income household from an interior, remote and tribal village of Koraput, Odisha, India. She is a married lady living with her three daughters. The lady standing to the extreme right in the photograph is Hira.

Hira has struggled a lot in her life in order to sustain herself and her family. She is a lady with sheer determination and strong willpower. Lack of financial resources had never allowed her to build a hygienic toilet at her home and get access to basic sanitary facilities. This has compelled her and her family to walk long distances in odd hours in order to defecate and urinate.

This practice is not safe and feasible enough in the long run. Therefore, Hira, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a well-equipped toilet and attach all the requisite sanitary fittings to it. The loan amount will help her in getting access to basic sanitation facilities and thereby improve the health of her family.

Hira is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting your support.

loans.use: to build a well-equipped toilet.

loans.name: Tula's Group

texts.en:
Tula, standing in the middle in the photograph, lives in a rural village of Koraput district, Odisha, India and farms a small plot of land to earn a living for her family. Tula has had it tough in life. She lost her husband ten years ago, and her heartbreak was compounded by the everyday challenges of having to raise three young boys on her own. Tula does not have access to a proper toilet at her home and walks a long distance in order to relieve herself.

Tula, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home, since what she presently has is an outhouse, and the bad smell is causing her respiratory illnesses. For this reason, she will invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, a toilet and pipes, to build a toilet and maintain her home and a sanitary community.

Tula is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help a needy woman like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet in her home.

loans.name: Prem's Group

texts.en: Prem belongs to a small hamlet in an underdeveloped block of Patnagarh district, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband and three school-going children. She, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR to purchase a sewing machine. She has been offering tailoring services for a few years, and the income from her stitching efforts supplements the agricultural income of her husband.Prem will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine, raw material and a good supply of consumables like thread spools, rolls of elastic strips, varieties of buttons and several other items in bulk. By stocking up on these items, she can cope with the demand for stitching services during the festival season. The loan amount will encourage Prem to use her skills effectively and make a living out of using them for a good purpose, so that her children can continue their studies at the local school.Prem is standing to the right-hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and a good supply of consumables like thread spools, rolls of elastic strips, varieties of buttons and several other items in bulk.

loans.name: Basanti's Group

texts.en:
Basanti is a 32-year-old mother of two teenage children. She is the one standing to the left hand side in the photograph. A weaver by profession, Basanti works nine hours on her loom to weave beautiful cotton tablecloths. Her husband left her alone three years back, and being the sole earner, she works really hard to provide for her children.

Basanti weaves cotton threads as well on her loom. She uses detergent for washing them before starching them for straightening. Once the threads are straightened, she dyes them in colours.

She, along with her group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR. Basanti will use her portion of the loan amount to buy in bulk all the raw materials, such as colours, dyes, ribbons and threads, so that she can weave a greater quantity of tablecloths. The finished products are mostly collected by hand-loom shops and wholesalers in the market at a wholesale rate. Apart from this, she also sells them to the local customers on an order basis.

Basanti hopes that, with this investment, she will be able to increase her income from the business.

loans.use: to buy in bulk all the raw materials for weaving, such as colours, dyes, ribbons, and threads.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
This is Vicente, a 43-year-old member of the CCT, Silang, Cavite branch. He is married to Lorena, a factory worker. The couple does their best to make a living and raise their three children, who are in college, high school, and elementary school respectively. Vicente has been driving his own jeepney for nine years, and his income helps fund his family's needs.

In the Philippines, jeepneys were originally used by the American military during World War II. Jeepneys are often converted into transportation vehicles; a jeepney is made two meters longer, and two long, upholstered seats are installed in its bed. Jeepneys have become the most common and cheapest form of public transportation.

Vicente needs regular and proper maintenance of his vehicle to ensure efficient performance and a steady income. He hopes to borrow a 15,000 PHP loan to pay for tune-ups, tires, fuel, and a battery for his jeepney to avoid breakdown. He values his jeepney, as it helps to support his family's daily household needs and send his children to school.

Vicente plans to sustain his transportation business and look for more ways to earn income to meet the growing needs of his family. He dreams to one day see his children become professionals.

Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tune-ups, tires, fuel, and a battery for his jeepney.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. Nyevu owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nyevu has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby for the past four years. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married mother of two children who both attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Rukia has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zareena Mai

texts.en:
Zareena Mai is 50 years old and a mother of 3 children living with her spouse and their children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is engaged in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 5 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support their family and meet other expenses.

Zareena Mai buys the required inventory for both her embroidery and machine from the market. She sells her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn a better profit for her family. She is now an expert in the embroidery business.

Therefore Zareena has requested a loan so she will be able to buy embroidery raw materials from the market.

Zareena will be thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Kunti's Group

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Kunti, standing in the middle in the photo, is a rural woman from a small village of Jeypore district in Odisha, India. She lives there with her husband and their only son. Her son is a student of class nine. Kunti’s husband is engaged in a fruit and vegetable vending business, and Kunti cuts fish in the local market to earn their livelihood.

Their monthly income is barely enough to meet all the household needs along with the education expenses of their only son. As a result, over the years they have been using a common toilet, which is too unhygienic and also far from their home. So, they have been facing a lot of discomfort. Walking to deserted areas to relieve themselves at odd hours of the day makes her feel unsafe, and this makes her more vulnerable to crimes.

Due to lack of capital, Kunti is unable to build a toilet of her own. And thus, she, along with her other group members, has applied for a loan of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. Kunti will use the loan money to purchase necessary materials such as bricks, sand, plastic sheeting, etc. for building a toilet of her own.

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials such as bricks, sand, plastic sheeting, etc. for building a toilet of her own.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Mishi has operated a motorcycle transport business. Her major challenge is lack of drivers to operate her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to increase her savings and purchase another motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to increase her savings and purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha sells fish to earn her living. She has operated her business for five years, selling fish from her home to restaurant operators and other members of her community. She cites seasonality and perishability as her primary challenges, which can lead to losses.

She and her husband have been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. The family lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
 
With her Kshs 20,000 loan funds, Mwanaisha intends to purchase bundles of fish to offer for sale. 

She dreams of expanding her business, and also hopes to establish another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married mother of five children four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Mwanarusi has owned a food stall business, selling to neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water .Her greatest monthly expense is food .

Zawadi has operated a pub business for the past two years selling to neighbors. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, Mwanamisi wants to purchase chairs, tables, glasses, and beer (two crates each of Tusker and Pilsner) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, glasses, and beer (two crates each of Tusker and Pilsner) for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaali

texts.en:
Mwanaali is married and has five school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a business selling khanga (women's wrap cloth). She sells from her home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. In addition, she also sells coconuts.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanamisi operates a business selling cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Mwashasha

texts.en:
Mwashasha is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For more than nine years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Caleb Gustavo

texts.es:
Caleb es un hombre joven de 20 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y estudia ingeniería comercial.
Él es inteligente, soñador y muy estudioso. Sus estudios los realiza en una universidad privada situada en el centro de la ciudad.
Caleb es moreno, de cabello corto y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymará que ya no habla, habla español y estudia inglés. Su vida la realiza en casa de su madre que trabaja y con su hermana que estudia en colegio, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Él estudia ingeniería comercial, es hábil y diestro para razonar, su vocación es de liderazgo y capacidad de mando, “estudio y trabajo como músico en varios grupos de cumbia…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios él trabaja como músico tocando el bajo en varios grupos de música, generalmente los fines de semana trabaja. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios de trabajo y estudio no se cruzan, la desventaja es la falta de una computadora portátil para estudiar. Su sueño es salir profesional y ser un buen aporte para la sociedad, el desea comprar una computadora portátil y una impresora para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que estudia y trabaja.
Es por esos motivos que Caleb solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil y una impresora para estudiar ingeniería comercial.
texts.en:
Caleb is a 20-year-old young man. He is single and has no children. He studies commercial engineering.

He is intelligent, a visionary, and very studious. His studies are carried out at a private university located in the city centre.

Caleb is dark, with short hair and a slim physique. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he no longer speaks. He speaks Spanish and studies English. He lives in his mother's house with his sister. His mother works and his sister is studying in high school. They live in a rented house constructed of brick that has water, electricity, and a sewer system. Caleb is studying commercial engineering. He is skillful and clear-thinking. His calling is leadership. "I study and work as a musician in various cumbia groups," he says. At the same time as his studies, he works as a musician playing base in several bands, usually during the weekends. The advantage of his activities is that his hours of work and study do not overlap. The disadvantage is that he has no laptop to study with. His dream is to go professional and be a good contributor to society. He wants to buy a laptop and a printer to continue with his studies. This is the first sequence of loans with this institution in one year of studying and working.

It is for these reasons that Caleb requests this loan to buy a laptop and a printer, so he can study commercial engineering.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and a printer to study commercial engineering.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married and has eight children. They live in their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a business selling khanga (women's wrap cloth). She sells from her home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Wendy Paola

texts.es: Wendy es una joven de 19 años de edad que habita en un barrio con cercanía al mar ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla en compañía de sus padres.  Se inició en el comercio incitada por la propuesta que recibió de una amiga quien le comentó acerca de las ventajas y beneficios que podría adquirir si se incorporaba a una empresa de multinivel y comercializaba distintos productos a través de la oferta del catálogo, a lo que Wendy acepto con mucha expectativa y motivación.  Hoy en día lleva un año en esta actividad proveyendo a vecinos y amigos una amplia gama de productos y marcas reconocidas de prendas de vestir, cosméticos y perfumes, los cuales pueden cancelar en cuotas o de inmediato.  Esta joven empresaria independiente tiene metas claras para su futuro entre ellas contempla tener una casa propia y abrir un almacén misceláneo. En la actualidad ha contado con buenos resultados y desea realizar una inversión para aprovechar el incremento de la demanda a causa de la temporada decembrina, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en ropa; pantalones y camisas y también en cosméticos; productos que garantizan una venta rápida por lo que esta será una inversión de éxito.
texts.en:
Wendy is a young woman, age 19, who lives with her parents in the municipality of Barranquilla, in a neighborhood near the sea. She got started in the business at the urging of a girlfriend who told her about the advantages and benefits that she could achieve if she set up a multi-level enterprise, and sold different products offered through catalogs. Wendy agreed, with high hope and motivation.

She has been doing this work for a year now, providing her neighbors and friends with a wide range of products and well-known brands of clothing, cosmetics, and perfumes, which can be paid for in installments or all at once. This young and independent businesswoman has clear goals for her future, among which are having her own house and opening a general store.

At present, she has had good results, and she wants to make an investment in order to make the most of the increase in demand caused by the holiday season. That is why she requested a loan, her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in clothing such as pants and shirts, and also, in cosmetics. These are products that guarantee a quick sale, so this will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to invest in clothing such as pants and shirts, and also, in cosmetics.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando es un empresario independiente de 63 años que reside en compañía de su cónyuge en Soledad y es padre de tres hijos mayores de edad.  Su taller de Ebanistería está ubicado en esta misma localidad y se vinculó en esta actividad después de realizar capacitaciones en este arte, promovidas por el SENA una institución que ofrece capacitaciones a cero costo. Su negocio es muy tradicional y conocido por los soledeños quienes solicitan de sus servicios de fabricación de puestas, ventanas, alcobas, juego de comedor, multimuebles y estructuras en madera de diferentes clases. Aunque su producción es diaria sus entregas y ventas las realiza cada tres días.   En la actualidad cuenta veintitrés  años de funcionamiento y su propósito es continuar creciendo en su negocio e incluso su meta a futuro es conseguir compradores en el exterior, para ello debe mejorar sus estándares de calidad, y para acercarse un poco este sueño de prosperidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en activo fijo: maquina industrial para cortar madera y materia prima.  Esta inversión pretende mejorar los tiempos de entrega, la capacidad de producción y mejores acabados en los productos. Su meta personal es continuar apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hernando is an independent entrepreneur who is 63 years old, lives with his spouse in Soledad, and is the father of three adult children. His carpentry workshop is located in this same location, and he started this business after completing training in the art, promoted by SENA, an institution that offers training at no cost.

Hernando's business is very traditional and is well known amongst soledeños who contract him for services to make windows, bedrooms, dining sets, room furniture and wooden structures of different kinds. Although he produces his products every day, his deliveries and sales are carried out every three days. He has been running his business for twenty-three years, and his goal is to increase his business growth and even get clients abroad.

To achieve these goals Hernando must improve his quality standards, which he plans on doing through his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which he will use to invest in fixed assets: an industrial machine for cutting wood and raw materials. This investment aims to improve delivery times, production capacity and better finished products. His personal goal is to continue supporting his children.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets: an industrial machine for cutting wood, and raw materials

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married and has two children, who attend school. She operates a vegetables stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.


Mwanaisha requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.ru:
Нафиса красивая и  молодая женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей.  Она работает поваром в столовой более 5 лет. Она очень трудолюбивая, доброжелательная женщина.  Она с детства интересуется кулинарией и  любит готовить разные блюда и салаты. Несмотря на свою молодость она стала профессионалом в своем деле. Для своей семьи делает всё возможное, чтобы они жили в достатке и ни в чём не нуждались. Её муж находится в миграции. 
Нафиса вот уже с 2014 года сотрудничает с Арванд. Она впервые брала кредит на потребительские нужды. 
 Сейчас Нафиса обустраивает свой дом, в котором они живут, чтобы её детям было комфортно там жить. Она хочет закупить комфортную мебель в дом. Но у неё сейчас не достаточно средств. Поэтому Нафиса обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку мебели. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Nafisa is a beautiful and young woman. She is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. She has worked as a cook at a cafeteria for more than five years. She is a very hardworking and friendly woman. She has been interested in cooking since her childhood and loves to prepare different meals and salads. Despite her youth, she became already became a professional cook. She does everything possible to ensure her family lives in abundance and that they are not in need of anything. Her husband is a migrant worker.

Since 2014 Nafisa has worked with "MDO Arvand". She took her first loan for persona use. Currently she is equipping her home, in order for her children to live comfortably there. She would like to purchase comfortable furniture for the house. However she does currently not have enough money. Therefore she turned to Arvand and would like to get a loan to purchase furniture. She thanks "MDO Arvand" in advance for the support and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Izzatulo

texts.ru: Изатулло настоящий пример отцовства. Он пятерых детей. Изатуло мастер на все руки. В свое время он не смог получить образование и теперь работает разнорабочим. Изатуло не позволяет своим детям совершить ошибку, которую когда то сам допустил. Он всегда следит за тем, чтобы его дети делали домашнее задание и учились на отлично. Сейчас его сын учится в университете. У него хорошая успеваемость. Обучения является платной и Изатуло обратился за кредитом, чтобы оплатить учебный год. Изатуло верит, что кредиторы KIVA внесут свой вклад с будущее его ребенка и выражает благодарность.
texts.en:
Izzatulo is a true example of fatherhood. He has five children. Izzatulo is a jack of all trades. He was not able to get an education and currently he works as a handyman. Izzatulo does not allow his children to make the same mistakes as himself. He always makes sure that his children do their homework and study well.

Currently Izzatulo's son studies at the university. He shows great progress. The tuition needs to be paid, and Izzatulo applied for a loan to pay for the school year. Izzatulo believes that Kiva's lenders will contribute to the future of his son, and he extends his gratitude.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education

loans.name: Olima

texts.ru: Ее зовут Олима. Ей 46 лет. Олима очень добрая женщина. Она уже 26 лет работает в детском садике воспитательницей. Она любит детей. Ее муж преподаватель. Олима в браке имеет двоих детей. Младшей дочке 20 лет. Она учится в Университете. Дочка одна из лучших учениц. Олима гордится своей дочерью. Скоро она должна оплатить очередной год обучения дочки, но семейный бюджет не позволяет это сделать. Олима и ее муж не допустят, чтобы их дочь бросила учебу и Олима обращается за кредитом и уверена, что это выход из ситуации.
texts.en:
This is Olima. She is 46 years old. She is a good woman. Olima has worked as a kindergarten teacher for 26 years already. She loves children. Her husband is a teacher.

Olima is married with two children. The youngest daughter is 20 years old. She goes to university, and is one of the best students. Olima is very proud of her daughter. Soon she needs to pay the coming year's tuition, however the family budget does not allow her to do so.

Olima and her husband does not allow their daughter to drop out of university, and Olima applied for a loan. She believes that this is the right way to get out of a difficult situation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university education

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia con 55 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en un zona rural. Sofia cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Sofía se dedica a las actividad de venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el rubro, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio.Solicita préstamo para surtir su negocio y de esta manera diversificar los productos que vende,con lo cuál tendrá mayores ventas y mayores ganancias.

Sofía es socia recurrente para Epyme Alternativa. Ha manejado un crédito de S/.100.00, el cuál lo canceló de manera puntual. Desde que es socio de Edpyme Alternativa su negocio ha mejorado y de igual forma su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sofia, age 55, lives with her husband and her children in the rural area of the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru. Sofia has very good personal and professional references from the area inhabitants. The majority of inhabitants of this location work on agricultural, commerce or livestock.

Sofia sells groceries and basic needs products. She has been on the business for more than 20 years and her local is located at her own house. She requests a loan to supply her business in order to diversify the products she sells and therefore she will have bigger sales and bigger earnings.

Sofia is a recurrent member of . She has managed a 1,000 soles loan, that she canceled occasionally. Since she is member of Epyme Alternativa, her business has improved so did her standard of living.

loans.use: to stock her business and in this way diversify the products she sells.

loans.name: Ener Miguel

texts.es:
Ener, es una persona que nació y se crío en el campo, un hombre responsable, trabajador que se adapta rápidamente a los cambios sociales a sus 33 años se dedica a tender un negocio de sala de internet y aunque, un negocio que ha estado cogiendo fama puesto que es el único que hay en el sector, ofreciéndole a los niños y jóvenes de los alrededores la posibilidad de conectarse a internet y poder desarrollar sus tareas, jugar, chatear, escuchar música.
Montó este negocio porque encontró en su zona una gran oportunidad, ya que las los habitantes de los alrededores, no todos pero si un considerable número no cuentan con el servicio de internet o un pc en su hogar.
Ener pensando en aumentar su cobertura de clientes, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 3 computadores, modernos con los cuales espera ofrecer un excelente servicio.
texts.en:
Ener was born and grew up on the countryside. He is a responsible, hardworking man who adapts quickly to social changes.  At 33 years of age, he makes a living running an internet parlor; a business that has been gaining a reputation given it's the only one in the area, offering children and young adults of the surrounding areas the possibility to connect to internet, do homework, play, chat and listen to music. 

He started this business because he found a great opportunity in his area given that the inhabitants of the vicinity, not all but a substantial number of them, don't have internet service or a pc in their home.  

Ener, thinking about increasing his customer base, would like to request a loan to buy three modern computers with which he hopes to offer an excellent service.

loans.use: to buy 3 computers

loans.name: Maria Bertila

texts.es: Bertila de 51 años de edad, está casada su esposo se dedica a labrar la tierra viven con su hijo Carlos de 18 años de edad al momento no está estudiando  por la falta de recursos, ayuda a sus padres, Bertila tiene una vaca  todos los días se levanta muy temprano a sacar la leche y luego espera al comprador, este pequeño negocio ayuda a cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, ella necesita el dinero para comprar una vaca con el propósito de obtener un ingreso adicional para poder cubrir los principales gastos de su familia.
texts.en: Bertila is 51 years old. She is married and her spouse works as a field labourer. They live with their son Carlos (18 years old) who is not studying at the moment because of the lack of resources. He helps his parents. Bertila has a cow that she gets up to milk very early each day, and then waits for the buyer. This small business helps meet the needs of their household. She needs money to buy a cow for the purpose of obtaining more income to cover the primary expenses of her family.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Santos Joel

texts.es:
Santos, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, dejo estudiar porque falleció su papá y él tuvo que trabajar para sostener su casa, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en la panadería, es padre de un hijo.

Santos, desde la edad de 12 años se dedica hacer pan, este oficio se lo aprendió a su papá, pero por situaciones económica cerraron la panadería y decidieron dedicarse a la agricultura, pero desde hace 6 meses solicitaron un crédito para reactivar la panadería y logro reactivarla, ahora trabaja su pareja y una hermana en la panadería y su día comienza a las 3:00 a.m. para hacer el pan.  

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar harina, azúcar, jalea, manteca y otros insumos para elaborar pan. 

Santos, sueña con mejorar su vivienda y poder construir un local para la panadería y poder ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos, 25 years old, attended school up to the first year of high school; he left school because his father passed away and he had to work to support his home. He is married and his partner helps him in the bakery. He is the father of a son.

Santos since the age of 12 has worked making bread; he learned this trade fron his father. But due to economic circumstances they closed the bakery and decided to work in agriculture. But 6 months ago they requested a loan to reactivate the bakery and he succeeded in reactivating it. Now he works with his wife and a sister at the bakery and their day begins at 3:00 am to make bread.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy flour, sugar, jelly, butter and other ingredients to make bread. Santos dreams of improving their housing and of being able to build a place for the bakery and be able to further expand their business.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, jelly, butter and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida, age 36, makes and sells ladies' clothing items from her home to earn an income. She buys the cloth at the market at a low cost, then sews the clothing and sells it at a profit. She has gained a strong clientele among the ladies of her community, who appreciate her clothing selection and quality.

At present, there is a great demand for her clothing items, as the winter weather has begun and people need warmer clothes. She has therefore requested a loan, so that she can provide a greater variety of garments to meet demand.

Abida's husband is a welder, offering welding services in the local community, and he supports his wife and six children with his wage. The family lives in Lahore. They are able to build savings thanks to Abida's earnings.

Abida dreams of a bright future for her children and is determined to provide them with a better education. She is very thankful to her Kiva lenders and to Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of garments to offer for sale, in order to fulfill customer demand

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза молодая девушка из города Душанбе. Ей 19 года. Она талантливая девушка. Наргиза работает портнихой в одном из торговых центров города. Наргиза счастливая девушка, она скоро выходит замуж. Она готовится к своей свадьбе и уже шьет свои свадебные наряды. Наргиза обратилась за кредитом, чтобы покрыть свадебные расходы. Наргиза очень сильно ждет своей свадьбы и надеется, что Вы тоже поделитесь ее радостью.
texts.en:
Nargiza is a young woman from the Dushanbe region. She is 19 years old. She is a talented girl. She works as a seamstress at one of the shopping centers in the city.

Nargiza is happy because she is soon getting married. She is preparing for her wedding and has already sewn her wedding dress. Nargiza applied for a loan in order to cover her wedding expenses. She eagerly awaits her wedding and hopes that you will also share her happiness.

loans.use: to cover her wedding expenses

loans.name: Fatima Emerlinda

texts.es: Fátima es una joven que a sus 20 años de edad ha logrado comprar una vivienda propia en la que vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 2 años de edad a la que siempre busca brindar lo mejor. Fátima se dedica a la venta de tortas, hamburguesas, hot dog y licuados desde hace 3 años, y es gracias a ello y a la gran cantidad de clientes con que cuenta que logra sacar adelante a su familia. Fátima desea realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre eléctrico, caja térmica, toma corriente, entre otros materiales para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Fátima is a young woman, 20 years old, who has managed to buy her own home where she lives with her life partner and her 2-year-old daughter, who Fátima is always looking to give the best. Fátima has made a living selling cakes, hamburgers, hot dogs and smoothies for 3 years. It is thanks to this and the large number of customers that she has been able to raise her family. Fátima wants to install electricity in her house which is why she is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in: electrical wiring, thermal box, outlets, and other materials to install electricity in her house and offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to invest in: electrical wire, thermal box, outlets, and other materials to install electricity in her home

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Шахло доброжелательная и трудолюбивая  женщина 47 лет. У неё двое детей. Она вдова. Её муж умер несколько лет тому назад. Она по профессии медицинская сестра. Она работает в местной больнице. Несмотря на трудности в жизни она старается преодолеть их. Её старший сын помогает ей в хозяйстве. Он работает кассиром. 
 Шахло вот уже несколько лет сотрудничает с Арванд. Она получала кредит на потребительские нужды, а также на развитие своего бизнеса. Шахло говорит, что после того, как она начала сотрудничать с Арванд, качество её жизни стало постепенно улучшаться. В данное время Шахло хочет отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у неё недостаточно. Для этого Шахло обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Shahlo is a friendly and hardworking woman of the age of 47. She is a widow has two children. Her husband died a few years ago. She is a medical nurse by education. She works at the local hospital. She strives to overcome the difficulties in her life. Her eldest son helps her with the household. He works as a cashier.

Shahlo has worked with "MDO Arvand" for some years already. She received a loan for personal purchases and also for developing her business. Shahlo says that after she started working with "MDO Arvand", the quality of her lives increased step by step.

Currently Shahlo would like to renovate the house they live in, in order to improve their living conditions. However her own savings is not enough. Due to this, Shahlo turned to "MDO Arvand" and would like to receive a loan to purchase building materials for renovating her house. She hopes for a positive result and thanks "MDO Arvand" in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Maria Anselma

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, ella habita en condiciones muy humildes y trabaja muy duro para ganarse el pan de cada día y mantener la economía del hogar. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas tortillas. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de maiz por quintales y cal para aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Maria, age 35, lives in her own hown with her wife. She lives under very humble conditions and work very hard to makes a living every day and to maintain the household economy. She makes and sell tasty tortillas. This business is her main source of income. She have decide to request a loan to Integral to invest on the purchase corn by the quintal and lime powder in order to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase corn by the quintal and lime powder

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is widowed and has five children. For the past 10 years, she has owned a food stall, selling to neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

Bintihamisi requested a loan from Yehu for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has four children, who attend school. She operates a vegetables stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Mwanasiti requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Sanabel

texts.en: Sanabel is 30 years old and married. A very responsible woman, she always works ‎hard for the well-being of her and her husband. With an empty room in her home, Sanabel has been busy selling a variety of household supplies. She wants to ‎increase her assortment of goods and is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more household supplies for the new season.

loans.use: to purchase more household supplies.

loans.name: Adono

texts.fr: Adono est une veuve femme avec quatre enfants à charge. Adono est âgée de 48 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée faite à base du maïs appelée « Kom ». Adono achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et vend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile. Adono demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et des paniers de petits poissons à frire en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices afin de subvenir à ses besoins et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adono is a widow with four children in her care. Adono is 48 years old and lives in Tokoin, where she prepares and sells a corn meal mash called Kom. Adono buys the necessary ingredients twice a month at the market and sells her product in front of her home. Adono is asking for this loan to order sacks of corn and baskets of small fish to fry to be able to sell more and earn more profits in order to meet the needs and improve the daily living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of corn and 2 baskets of small fish.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old, married and has three children. She is managing a store, selling grocery items to the people in her village. She has been in her business for about 10 years. She would like to continue improving her business but has insufficient funds to buy more goods to sell. With this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, bread, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.

Marilou wants to achieve a profitable business someday and she promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bread, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatly monthly expenses.

Mwanalima has operated a beauty salon business for the past six years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating her hairdressing skills in the future.

With the KES 30,000 Mwanalima wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Jeanne  Ayawavi

texts.fr: Jeanne est une dynamique femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec quatre enfants à charge. Jeanne est âgée de 40 ans et s’active énormément pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Jeanne est une revendeuse de tissus coupons qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis dans les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Jeanne sollicite ce prêt pour commander des mètres de tissus pagnes en vue de bien revendre et de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients puis avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Jeanne is an energetic married woman living in Tokoin with four children in her care. Jeanne is 40 years old and works hard to have a good financial situation. Jeanne sells cut cloth, which she gets twice a month at the market, and sells it from home, as well in surrounding neighborhoods. In order to meet her goals, Jeanne is asking for this loan to order meters of pagne cloth in order to sell and favorably meet the needs of her customers and thus be financially autonomous to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy 98 meters of pagne material.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha, age 30, opened a fitness club to help her husband cover the household expenses for themselves and their two children. He was unable to support the family sufficiently with his wage, so Nuha decided to see what she could do to supplement the family income. She is an ambitious young woman with considerable drive and willpower, and her new business is a success. Thanks to her income, she is able to cover her children's educational expenses, which she considers her top priority.

Nuha wants to expand and develop her business in order to increase her income, so that she can reliably cover her children's ongoing ‎school fees. She is therefore applying for a loan, which she will use to buy a new treadmill for her fitness club, as well as to purchase tools for maintenance of her gym.‎ This will keep her business running smoothly and will bring her an increased income.

In the future, Nuha wishes to be able to open another branch of her fitness club.

She is grateful for your ‎support in helping her to achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: to buy a new treadmill and new tools for her gym.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 46-year-old woman who lives with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a driver who provides transportation services using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw.

With the help of savings, Rani's son purchased a used auto rickshaw; the engine quality is good, but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient funds to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving, but is looking for a lump sum to buy the body, so Rani requested a loan for her son so he could buy a new body and drive his rickshaw smoothly.

Rani hopes that her son will now be able to earn more income. She is very happy after taking out this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body and seat covers for her son's rickshaw transportation service.

loans.name: Manguiline Santhiaba Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce et remboursent leurs prêts sans difficultés. Madame Patricia qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 52 ans et mère trois enfants dont deux garçons. Depuis plusieurs années elle s'active dans la vente poissons frais. Femme très courageuse et très engagée. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en: This group is made up of women active in business, who repay their loans without any difficulty. Mrs. Patricia, standing on the right side of the photo with her arm raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 52 years old and the mother of three children, to of whom are boys. For the past several years she has been selling fresh fish. She is a brave and committed woman. The earnings will be used to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Rafi

texts.fr: Rafi est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Rafi est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires qu’elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois  au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Rafi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de biscuits et de bonbons. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Rafi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider son mari à couvrir certaines dépenses quotidiennes de la famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Rafi is a 33-year-old married woman living in Tokoin.  A mother of two, Rafi sells food products, which she gets three times a month at the market and sells in front of her home. Rafi is seeking this loan to order boxes of cookies and candy. With the profits from her sales, Rafi plans to improve her sales and help her husband cover certain of the family’s daily expenses so that her children can thrive and get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 13 boxes of cookies and 13 boxes of candy.

loans.name: Djaliatou

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Djaliatou est une femme âgée de 42 ans résidant à Tokoin. Djaliatou est une marchande  de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Djaliatou  demande ce prêt pour commander des bidons d’huile et des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre et augmenter son stock puis maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari à promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en: A married mother of two, Djaliatou is a 42-year-old resident of Tokoin. Djaliatou is a seller of general food products who stocks up four times a month at the market and sells under a shed in front of her home. Djaliatou is asking for this loan to be able to order canisters of oil and bags of charcoal to be able to sell more and augment her stock and maximize her profits in order to help her husband advance her children’s education and to meet the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 canisters of oil and 5 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Kayi est une femme âgée de 38 ans résidant à Tokoin. Kayi est une marchande des fournitures de bureau et des insecticides qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis en se promenant dans les quartiers environnant. Kayi  sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons des insecticides pour les mouches, cafards et autres en vue  de bien revendre et d’avoir un stock important puis maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par son foyer.
texts.en: A married mother of three, Kayi is a 38-year-old woman who lives in Tokoin. Kayi sells office supplies and insecticide and stocks up once a month at the market and sells from home and in the surrounding neighborhoods. Kayi is seeking this loan to order boxes of insecticide for flies, cockroaches, and others in order to sell and have a substantial stock in order to maximize her profits and help her husband to pay for their children’s education and meet the daily needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy 83 boxes of insecticide for flies, cockroaches, and others.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Mariam has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit.

Mariam is requesting a loan to purchase stocks of sugar, maize flour and detergents for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, maize flour and detergents to resell.

loans.name: Ameeneh

texts.en:
Ameeneh is a 32-year-old married mother of five; she is a hardworking woman who puts a great deal of effort into ‎supporting her husband in earning their living.
‎
Ameeneh is well-known in her region; two years ago, with her good reputation, she started working from her house, selling household supplies. She runs her business from her house, but is seeking to expand ‎her working area to increase her sales and income at the same time.
‎
Thus, she is obtaining a loan to buy more products to develop her business and to promote her business to reach nearby villages and thus increase her sales income.
‎
She hopes that one day she'll be able to open a shop of her own and display specially released home products, ‎attracting everyone.‎

loans.use: to buy more products to develop her business and to promote her business to reach nearby villages.

loans.name: Marie Clémentine

texts.fr: Marie clémentine vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit. Avec lequel, elle a pu renforcer et augmenter son fonds de roulement (grosse balle de friperie). Actuellement , elle commence à faire des ventes en demi-gros aux revendeurs qui n'ont pas assez de fonds pour acheter une balle. La lutte n'est pas encore fini, et l'objectif n'est pas encore atteint,le chemin est encore loin, c'est pourquoi, elle vous demande encore de l'accorder un autre prêt qu'elle va encore utiliser pour acheter d'autres balles (robes, pantalons, shorts, etc..).
texts.en: Marie Clémentine offers a big thank you for the loan she received, with which she was able to increase her working capital (a large bale of second-hand clothing). She is currently beginning to make semi-wholesale sales to sellers who lack the capital to buy a bale. The job is not yet done, the goal is not yet accomplished and the road is still long, which is why she is applying for another loan in order to buy additional bales of used clothes (dresses, trousers, shorts, etc..).

loans.use: buy a large bale of used clothing (robes).

loans.name: Rodolfo Ernesto

texts.es: Rodolfo es un hombre trabajador de que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de seguridad, además buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos vende huevos en su vivienda, por mayor y al detalle, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Él habita en casa de su propiedad desde hace 8 años en compañía de su hijo de 22 años de edad al que logro sacar adelante. Rodolfo desea invertir en su negocio de huevos, ya que el cada día cuenta con más clientes, por lo que no logra cumplir con todos los pedidos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en huevos por mayoreo y de esta manera cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is a hardworking man who works in security. Searching for a way to increase his income, he also sells eggs at his home, wholesale and retail. This allows him to move his family forward. For 8 years he has lived in a home he owns with his 22 year old son, whom he's helped get ahead.

Rodolfo wants to invest in his egg business, since every day he has new customers, and therefore cannot fill all the orders. For that reason he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in eggs wholesale, in order to fill all his orders.

loans.use: to invest in eggs wholesale in order to fill his orders.

loans.name: Carmen Tulia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Carmen, quien con su credikiva pudo realizar una excelente producción de chaquetas en diversos materiales que le generó excelentes utilidades y bienestar para su familia, sin embargo esta emprendedora en compañía de su cónyuge encontraron una propuesta de negocio que le ofrecía mayores ingresos y decidió apostarle a esa nueva oportunidad de negocio “una distribuidora de productos de belleza y medicina natural”. Ella alterna su rol de madre y cónyuge, que encaja perfectamente con su labor comercial, puesto que maneja su tiempo y lo distribuye entre todas sus obligaciones, y de la mano de su cónyuge se encargan de realizar las labores de preventa y entrega de pedidos a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son almacenes expendedores de productos de belleza y consultorios homeopáticos y naturistas.  Ellos manejan una variada gama de productos de distintas marcas entre ellos tónicos faciales, cremas limpiadoras, gafas terapéuticas, cojines y sillas masajeadoras, tés, vitaminas y compuestos naturales, que son ofertados a sus clientes con pagos contra entrega e incluso con facilidad de pago. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Gracias por el apoyo brindado, este ha permitido el crecimiento sostenido de mi microempresa, generando nuevas líneas de negocio y a su vez la estabilidad económica ha hecho que mi familia crezca, ya que acabo de ser madre por tercera vez”. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, con el cual invertirá en lienzos para depilación, productos de limpieza facial y el acondicionamiento de poltronas masajeadoras que simultáneamente ofrecen los siguientes beneficios: mejoramiento de circulación de cabeza, ojos sanos, paranasales afectados por sinusitis, cefaleas y migrañas. Su meta a futuro es ampliar sus instalaciones y fortalecer la cadena comercial, en lo personal desean adquirir casa propia y construir en el lote de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Carmen, whom with her credikiva was able to make an excellent production of jackets in different materials and generated excellent profits and welfare for the family. However this entrepreneur with the company of her husband found a business proposal that offered them a bigger income and decided to bet on this business opportunity. The business is a "distribution of beauty products and natural medicine".

She alternates her role as mother and wife, that suits perfectly with her commercial labor, as she manages and distribute her time within all her duties. By the hand of her husband, they carry out the pre-sales tasks and the delivery to her clients, which on their majority are vending department stores of beauty products and homeopathic and naturists stores.

They managed a wide range of products from different brands, among facial tonics, cleaning lotions, therapeutic glasses, massaging cushion and chairs, teas, vitamins and natural compound. They are offered to their clients with cash on delivery payments and even credit terms. She says to her Kiva investors: "Thank you for the given support. It has permitted the sustained growth of my micro-business, generating new business lines. In turn the financial stability has made my family to grow, as I have been mother for third time". 

Currently she is applying for a new financing, which the one she will invest in hair removal canvas, facial cleaning products and the improvement of the massaging chairs, that would simultaneously offer the following benefits: improvement of the head blood circulation, healthy eyes, paranasals affected by sinusitis, cephaleas and migraines. Her goal in the future in to enlarge her installations and to strength the commercial chain. On their personal side, they want to purchase their own house and to build on their property land

loans.use: To invest in hair removal canvas, facial cleaning products, hair products and massaging chairs

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a mat-weaving business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and to passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge for her.

With the loan Mwanasha is requesting, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For more than a year, Fatuma has operated an open-air food-sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge in her place of business.

With the loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), Fatuma wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Protasia

texts.en:
Protasia is married and has six children, who attend school. She has operated a retail shop for the past five years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Protasia is requesting a loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has one child. She operates a vegetables stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of seasonality in her place of operation.


Mwanamisi requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 48 year-old woman, who is married and has five children. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business earning a regular income for the family.

Shamim's husband is involved in manufacturing and selling wooden furniture such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business over fifteen years ago. Her husband had previously obtained loans for his business; he took two previous loans for his business of making furniture. Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to cope with the increasing demand.

Therefore, Shamim came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan to buy raw materials for making furniture. Shamim hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for her husband's business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's furniture-making business.

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es: Rosalva es una mujer de 58 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, actividad que realiza en su vivienda desde hace varios años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes, además cuenta con una venta de tortillas, lo cual le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Rosalva vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 24 y 15 años de edad. Rosalva desea invertir en su venta de productos básicos, buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos, para lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, lácteos, pan dulce, detergente, entre otros, además invertirá en maíz por mayor para su venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Rosalva is a 58-year-old woman who makes a living selling basic products, an occupation that she has carried out in her home for many years. She therefore has many customers. She also has the tortilla sales, which allow her to obtain a better income. Rosalva lives with her life partner and their two children, who are 24 and 15 years old. 

Rosalva wants to invest in her basic products sales as a way to obtain a better income, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in candies, dairy products, sweet baked goods and detergent, among others, and furthermore to invest in wholesale corn for the sale of tortillas.

loans.use: to invest in: candies, dairy products, sweet baked goods and detergent, among others, and furthermore to invest in wholesale corn for the sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is a married woman with four children, none of whom attends school because they are grown-ups. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

Tito has operated a retail-shop business for the past 15 years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Seasonality is a major challenge for her.

Tito is requesting a loan to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Verónica Raquel

texts.es:
Verónica, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a cultivar la tierra y a trabajar con ganado, sus hijos son pequeños y viven con ellos.

Verónica, se dedica al comercio de granos básicos, este negocio lo aprendió con su pareja, además de trabajar con ganado siembran granos básicos para comprar ganados, estas actividades las hacen en la zona donde viven.

Verónica, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado para engordarlos y después venderlos.

Verónica, siempre ha soñado hacer su propia casa, porque donde vive es de la mamá.
texts.en:
Verónica is 30 years old and studied up to the fifth grade. She is in a relationship, her partner makes a living from farming the land and working with livestock. They have two young children that live with them.

Verónica makes a living from growing beans, a business she has learned with her partner. In addition to working with livestock they sow beans so they can buy animals, they do this in the area where they live.

Verónica needs the loan to buy livestock to fatten up for sale.

Verónica who lives in her mothers house has always dreamed of having her own home.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten up and then sell.

loans.name: Jose Obdulio

texts.es:
José, de 59 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de bachillerato, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y su único hijo lastimosamente fue asesinado por la delincuencia hace 3 meses.

José, se dedica a vender tacos y agua de coco en la zona, pero además de realizar esa actividad siembra granos básicos y en tiempo de guerra fue soldado.

José, necesita el préstamo para mejorar su carro para poder ofrecer mejor su producto.

José, sueña con terminar de hacer su casa, porque tiene 2 años de haber parado la construcción por falta de dinero.
texts.en:
José is 59 years old, studied until his second year of high school, and is in a long-term relationship. His partner takes care of the household chores. Unfortunately his only child was murdered due to criminal violence three months ago.

José works selling tacos and coconut water in the local area, but he also cultivates basic grains, and during the war he was a soldier.

José needs the loan to improve his cart, in order to better sell his product. His dream is to finish building his house, since construction has been stopped for two years due to lack of capital.

loans.use: to improve his cart in order to better sell his products.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.es: Don Melvin es un señor muy trabajador que tiene amplia experiencia en el cultivo de piña, actividad que se ha convertido en su sustento familiar. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), dinero que utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes agrícolas necesarios para el buen crecimiento y desarrollo de su cultivo.
texts.en: Melvin is a very hard working man who has in-depth experience of pineapple farming which has become his means of supporting his family. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 colones to buy the fertilizers necessary for the healthy growth and development of his crop.

loans.use: buy fertilizers to grow pineapples.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús con 53 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al cultivo de arroz,siendo este el de mayor producción,así como al comercio en general,etc.

Jesús se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz.Actualmente se encuentra cultivando arroz,de variedad Linea Ideal, el cuál se encuentra en instalación de su almacigo, con más de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se desempeña como peón agrícola en las labores de cultivo de arroz.Solicita préstamo para invertir en los gastos de siembra , abono y mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz.De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida de el y la de su familia.

Jesús es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jesús is 53 years old and he lives in a common-law partnership. He lives together with his partner and two children in the Pucará district, Jaén province, which is located in the Cajamarca department, in the country of Perú. The majority of the inhabitants in this village make a living with the production of rice, which is the one most commonly produced, and also with general trading, etc. 

Jesús makes a living in agriculture, specifically with rice farming. Nowadays he is cultivating the rice variety Linea Ideal, and he is preparing the seedling, with more than 15 years experience in this line of work. Moreover, he also works as a day labourer in tasks related with rice production. He is requesting a loan to invest in the expenditures related to sowing, fertilising and maintaining his rice field. In this way, he will be able to earn an acceptable profit to improve his family and his own quality of life.

Jesús is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in the expenditures needed for sowing, fertilizing and maintaining his rice field.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera vive con su hija Verónica de 21 años y su pequeña nieta Jimena de 3 años,    en el campo el lugar donde habitan carece de algunos servicios básicos,   hace 25 años atrás se dedica a criar  chanchos este negocio le ayuda a pagar  gastos básicos de este humilde hogar, para alimentar a los cerdos se va a recabar papas en los potreros  cercanos. Rosa necesita el  dinero para comprar tres chanchos y vitaminas, incrementaría sus ventas logrando obtener  mayores ingresos para cubrir la necesidades , de su hija que le ayuda a cuidar los chanchos y su nieta que viven con ella.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old. She is a single mother that lives on the field with Veronica, her 21 years-old daughter, and Jimena her 3 years-old grand daughter. The place where they live lacks some basic services. Since 25 years ago she makes a living breeding pigs. This business help her to pay the basic expenses on his humble home. To feed the pigs she recollects potatoes from the close pastures.

Rosa needs the money to buy three pigs and vitamins. The money will increase her sales, achieving her a better income to cover the needs of her daughter (that helps her to look after the pigs) and her gran-daughter that lives with them.

loans.use: To buy three pigs

loans.name: Empresarios De Los Olivos Group

texts.es: Santiago es padre de cinco hijos mayores de edad, Es chófer de colectivo donde se dedica diez horas diarias,el préstamo que solicitó lo invertirá en el alquiler de un stand en un mercado y en la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar,aceite,leche y mas para abrir un negocio de venta de abarrotes,así podrá trabajar de día en el negocio y por la tarde dedicarse al transporte. se siente feliz de poder contar con gente que lo apoya mucho como son los inversionistas Kiva a quien agradece por la ayuda recibida ya que podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santiago is the father of five adult children. He is a bus driver, where he works ten hours a day. The loan that he has requested will be used to rent a stand in a market and for the purchase of goods, such as rice, sugar, oil, milk and more to open a business selling groceries. This way, he can work during the day in his business and in the afternoon in transportation. 

He feels glad that there are people like the Kiva investors, who support him so much. He thanks them for the help he has received so that he will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries to open a business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a widowed woman with three children, none of whom attends school because they are grown-ups. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

Regina has operated a retail-shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Transportation is a major challenge for her business.

Regina is requesting a loan to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
