Cecilia is a widowed mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, Cecilia has operated a clothing-sales business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. The high cost of seasonality is a major challenge in her business.

Cecilia wants to use the loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) that she is requesting to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio con 29 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo,en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al cultivo de café, cría y venta de ganado vacuno, cría y venta de animales menores y hortalizas.

Herminio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de cafeto, de la variedad Catimor sembrando 1 hectárea de cafeto de su propiedad,su predio se ubica en el Caserio el pueblo lo hizo del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, se dedica a la agricultura hace 11 años y hace 4 años cultiva cafeto, cría y venta de ganado vacuno. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro.El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Herminio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Herminio firmará con aval.
texts.en:
Herminio, age 29, with a living-in-partner status, lives with her partner and their younger children at the Santo Tomas district, in the Cutervo province, at the Cajamarca department of Peru. The inhabitants of this location works on their majority to the coffee cultivation, breeding and selling of cattle-stock, breeding and selling of small animals and vegetable cultivation. 

Herminio works on agriculture. He makes a living with the cultivation of the Catimor variety of coffee. He sow 1 hectare of coffee of his property. His property is located at the Caserio. The village is at the Santo Tomas district of Cutervo.

Herminio makes a living with agriculture since 11 years ago and he cultivates coffee, breed and sell of cattle stock since 4 years ago. Additionally, he breeds and sells small animal and cultivates products for agricultural staple products. He counts with a lot of experience on the business. The destiny of the loan will be for the maintenance of the cultivation. With the loan he will obtain a good yield and a better income to, therefore, be able to increase his and his family standard of living.

Herminio is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. Herminio will sign with a guarantee.

loans.use: To maintain the cultivation

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en:
Ndunge is a single woman with no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a cosmetic shop business; her customer-base consists of town-dwellers and neighbors, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 37 años de edad que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan francés y pan dulce, actividad que lleva realizando 8 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este beneficio. Ella vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su padre y su madre a los que apoya con los gastos económicos de su hogar. Rosa desea invertir en productos para su panadería, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harina, azúcar, levadura, leche, entre otros productos para su panadería.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 37-year-old woman who is producing and selling french bread and sweet bread. She has been doing this business for 8 years now. As such, she is happy that she can rely on this benefit. She is living in her own house together with her father and her mother, whom she supports with the household expenses. 

Rosa wants to invest in products for her bakery. That's why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: flour, sugar, yeast, and milk among other products for her bakery.

loans.use: to invest in: flour, sugar, yeast, and milk among other products for her bakery

loans.name: Papo

texts.en:
Papo is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door, to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the 20,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with three, school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Virginia is requesting a Kiva loan to start a retail shop in the nearby town, selling at the market to neighbors and passersby.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero is a married mother of six children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. 

With the 30,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Marquez Group

texts.es: Tessy tiene 23 años de edad,es madre soltera de una pequeña de tres años por quien sale adelante todos los días,tiene un salón de belleza al cual se dedica de nueve a diez horas diarias le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que mantiene contacto con sus clientes que la buscan por los buenos cortes y peinados que hace,el préstamo que solicitó lo utilizará para ampliar su salón de belleza en la compra de secadoras,rizadoras champú,cremas,peines y mas. Su sueño es poder abrir un local mas y así formar una cadena de salones de belleza y darle mejor calidad de vida a su hijita, Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el gran apoyo y piden que sigan apoyando a gente que desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Tessy is 23 years old. She is a single mother of a 3-year-old little girl who she strives forward for every day. She has a beauty salon where she works nine to ten hours a day. She likes her work a lot since she keeps in touch with her customers who come to her because of the good cuts and hair-styles she does. She will use the loan she requested to expand her beauty salon by purchasing hair-dryers, curling irons, shampoo, creams, combs and more.

Her dream is to be able to open another shop and thus build a chain of beauty salons to give her little daughter a better quality of life. She is grateful to the Kiva investors for their great support and asks them to continue supporting people who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase dryers, curling irons, combs, and shampoo.

loans.name: Mawena

texts.fr: Mawena est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans qui vit avec quatre enfants à charge. Mawena est une revendeuse des légumineuses résidant à Tokoin. Mawena achète ses marchandises une fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Mawena sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de carottes, d’oignons et de pommes de terre en vue de bien revendre et avoir un bénéfice pour aider son mari à l’organisation de l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mawena is a married, 43-year-old woman who lives with her four children. Mawena lives in Tokoin and resells vegetables. Mawena purchases her merchandise once a month at the market and then resells it from her home and also while circulating in the nearby neighborhoods.

Mawena is asking for this loan to order bags of carrots, onions, and potatoes with the goal of reselling them to have profits to help her husband with covering her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy two bags of potatoes, two bags of onions, and one bag of carrots.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Akouvi est une femme âgée de 35 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Akouvi est une couturière qui expose des pagnes dans son atelier de couture sise à son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire, Akouvi se rend deux fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes et du fil en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner un gain et pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a married, 35-year-old woman with three children who lives in Tokoin. Akouvi is a seamstress who displays pagnes in her sewing shop located in her home. To obtain the necessary supplies, Akouvi goes to the market twice a month and is asking for this loan to order pieces of pagne fabric and thread.

Her goal is to have good sales in order to make more money and be able to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 12 pieces of pagne (traditional cloth).

loans.name: Estarlin

texts.es: Estarlin de 33 años, es habitante de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar e inició su negocio al palpar la necesidad en algunos sectores del municipio que aún no cuentan con alcantarillado y sus habitantes requieren del servicio de limpieza de pozas sépticas para evitar la propagación de enfermedades y epidemias entre la comunidad. Estarlin ofrece un servició muy artesanal puesto que no cuenta con un equipo que le permita realizar esta labor técnicamente, él posee tanques, mangueras, una turbina y una carretilla, indumentaria con la que absorbe estos residuos  y evita que el lodo acumulado disminuya la capacidad. Diariamente él realiza esta labor y sus principales clientes son vecinos y conocidos quienes le solicitan el servicio y es cancelado de inmediato.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para adquirir una motobomba y más tanques de almacenamiento, así  su trabajo sería mucho más ágil y mejor. Estarlin se encuentra comprometido y su meta de negocio es tener un carro tanque.
texts.en:
Estarlin is 33 and resides in San Jacinto In the department of Bolívar. He started his business after seeing a need in some areas that still lack a sewer system for residents who need to have their septic tanks pumped out to avoid the spread of diseases within the community.

Estarlin offers a very basic service as he does not have specialized equipment to do the work. He has tanks, hoses, a turbine and a wheelbarrow, and cloths to soak up residues to keep built up sludge from reducing capacity . He does this work everyday and his main clients are neighbors and acquaintances who request his services and pay immediately.

He is currently applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo In order to buy a motorized pump and storage tanks so he can respond faster and do a better job.

Estarlin is currently engaged and his business goal is to get a tank truck.

loans.use: to buy a motorized pump and more storage tanks.

loans.name: Inoussa

texts.fr: Inoussa est marié et père de quatre enfants, Inoussa est un homme âgé de 44 ans résidant à Tokoin. Inoussa est un marchand qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché des mèches et les revendent dans le salon de coiffure de sa femme à ses clients. Inoussa nécessite ce crédit pour commander des unités de mèches en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Inoussa is married and the father of four children. He is a 44-year-old man who lives in Tokoin. Inoussa is a merchant who purchases hair extensions twice a month at the market and then resells them to customers from his wife's salon. Inoussa needs this loan to order packages of hair extensions, with the goal of having good sales. He wants to make a profit to be able to meet his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 110 packages of hair extensions.

loans.name: Rubidia Nohemi

texts.es:
Rubidia, de 28 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer año de bachiller, está casada, su esposo se dedica a vender en una tienda de celulares en la ciudad y tienen dos hijos.

Rubidia, se dedica a la venta de ropa y también a la sastrería; se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace más de 10 años, pues ese trabajo fue el que aprendió con su hermana mayor, quien fue la que la indujo a estos oficios y se decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque es una fuente de ingreso que le genera ganancias y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 de la tarde.
 
Rubidia, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa para salir a vender.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y aumentar más el negocio.
texts.en:
Rubidia, 28 years of age, only studied to the third year of high school. She is married and her husband sells cell phones in a store in the city. They have two children.

Rubidia sells clothing and is also a seamstress. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, because this is what she learned, along with her older sister who introduced her to these skills. Rubidia decided to dedicate herself to the business because it is a source of income that generates earnings. Her work schedule is from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm in the afternoon.

Rubidia needs the loan to purchase additional clothing to go out and sell.

Her dream is that her children may become professionals and, also, that she might expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to go out and sell.

loans.name: Sunamani's Group

texts.en:
Sunamani is a 54-year-old married woman, standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from a small, remote village in Koraput district of Odisha state, India.

Sunamani lives in a home with no access to a toilet, forcing the family members to go outdoors for defecation. They have to travel long distances at odd hours of the night sometimes. Building a private toilet in her house will help prevent diseases that are caused from open defecation and promote a healthier lifestyle.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. Sunamani will use her portion of the loan amount to construct a toilet in her home. This loan will help improve access to a better, safer, healthier quality of life.

Sunamani is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to construct a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Sasarita's Group

texts.en:
Sasarita, standing to the extreme left in the photograph, is 31 years old. She belongs to a rural and interior village in a place in Koraput district of Odisha, India.

With a family of seven, it is important for Sasarita to provide safe sanitation for her family. When there is no safe sanitation option, there are high chances of catching diseases, and women are more prone to these diseases. Having a toilet in their home would make their life easier and safer. This would not only save Sasarita time, but also give her family a safe sanitation option.

Therefore, Sasarita, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a safe and clean toilet at her place and enjoy good health in a hygienic atmosphere.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to build a safe and clean toilet at her place.

loans.name: Niriana Harimanana

texts.fr:
Niriana a 49 ans. Elle est mariée, son mari l’appuie  dans cette activité. Le couple a 3 enfants 
( 25-23-19 ans) tous étudiants à l’université. C’est une femme créative et animée d’une bonne volonté dans tout ce qu’elle entreprend.  
Niriana  gère avec son mari une activité de menuiserie depuis 1995.  Avant, la capacité de production est de "un salon par semaine", elle n'avait qu'un ouvrier. Actuellement, l’effectif  est de deux. Le prêt sert à acheter du bois en palissandre pour son activité de menuiserie (fabricant de salons) et de vente (fournisseur de matières premières aux autres menuiseries).
La construction d’une maison et la réussite de l’étude de leurs 3 enfants constituent leur priorité.
texts.en:
Niriana is 49-years-old. She is married and her husband supports her in her business. The couple has three children (25, 23, and 19 years old), all in college. She is a creative and animated woman demonstrating good will in everything that she undertakes.

Since 1995, Niriana has been managing a woodworking shop with her husband. Previously, the production capacity was "one piece of furniture per week." She only had one employee. Currently, there are two. This loan will be used to purchase rosewood for the woodworking business (making furniture) and sales (supplying raw materials to other woodworking shops).

The couple's priorities are to build a house and for their three children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy beams and rosewood boards.

loans.name: Chebet

texts.en:
Chebet is a single mother of one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital in her business.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache Group

texts.es: Rosmery tiene 25 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en horas de la noche. Ella se dedica a dicha actividad hace varios años. Su mayor deseo es implementar su restaurant. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas insumos arroz azúcar aceite al por mayor. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosmery es la segunda persona sentada del lado izquierdo viste chompa color mostaza. En la parte superior izquierda se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Andrea que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
Rosemery is 25 years old, is single, and has one dependent son.  She makes a living selling food at nighttime.  She has had this occupation for several years.  Her greatest wish is to implement her restaurant.  She will use the loan to invest in purchasing more wholesale supplies like rice, sugar, and oil.  

The group thanks KIVA investors for the loan given.  Rosmery is the second person seated on the left side wearing the mustard-colored sweater.  In the upper lefthand corner is a photo of Andrea who could not attend the meeting for work purposes.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a food vendor. She cooks and sells food items in front of her home, offering her prepared dishes to her neighbors and members of her community. She cites seasonality as her primary business challenge.

Saumu is the widowed mother of two children, both of whom attend school. The family lives in a house that has electricity but no piped water. Saumu's greatest monthly expenses are her children's school fees and food for the household.

Saumu decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business. With her Kshs 50,000 loan, she will purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a married woman with one child who attends school, rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Jane operates a vegetable stall at the market, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. The high cost of transportation to her place of operation is her major challenge.

With this Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Bamba's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place en Juillet 2002, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’élevage.

Madame Bamba, âgée de 42ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de jus de fruits et de glace au niveau du marché local. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter divers fruits (oranges mangues « made » fruits local), 02 sacs de 50kg de sucre et d’autres condiments pour la préparation de son jus et des sachets pour sa vente de glace.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte consolider son activité
texts.en:
Established in July 2002, this Banc Villageois is made up of women who have experience in the program of Bancs Villageois. They share strong ties of solidarity and help each other. Their main businesses are small-scale commerce and livestock raising.

Madame Bamba, aged 42, is seated on the far right with one hand raised. She is the featured borrower for the group. She is married and the mother of three children. She sells fruit juice and ice at the local market.

With her new loan, she intends to buy various sorts of fruit (oranges, mangoes, other local fruit), two sacks of 50 kg each of sugar, other condiments for the preparation of her juice, and plastic bags for her sale of ice.

With her profits, she intends to consolidate her business activity.

loans.use: to buy various sorts of fruit (oranges, mangoes, other local fruit), two sacks of 50 kg each of sugar, and other condiments.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman and owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Esther has operated a tailoring business for the past year. She makes women's and men's suits. . She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Hend

texts.en:
Hend, 59, is a widow whose husband has been dead for many years. She her ‎four small children to raise alone.

Herid is engaged in sewing clothes in her home as her only source of income.
‎
Hend needs the loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She has a great number of customers who purchase ‎her clothes because of good prices and high quality. She dreams of having a fixed location from where to sell her clothes and ‎increase her earnings.‎

Hend is a very ambitious and determined woman who wants to provide a good life and good education for ‎her children. She is awaiting your support to achieve her dreams. ‎

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a single woman with one kid who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Dorcas operates a grocery vegetables selling stall at the market where she sells to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yousra is a small entrepreneur living and working in Zarqaa She sells home products and kitchen supplies. ‎She has been working in this business for many years. Yousra is 62 years old; widowed and the ‎mother of two children.
‎
Yousra is seeking a loan to buy new quality products and a variety of inventory items to offer to ‎her customers.
‎
She is an experienced businesswoman, running this enterprise for many years. She knows what sells and ‎what does not, which is why this investment of funds will definitely be efficient and reasonable.‎

loans.use: to increase her sales inventory.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 11 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner.  She has made a living selling personal use products for the past 11 years.  Her business is located in her home and she also sells her products as a street vendor in other neighborhoods.  With what she earns from her sales she is able to cover some of her household expenses.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc., all at wholesale, so she can continue her work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc., at wholesale.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a divorced woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married mother of two children, all in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and she has three children, all of whom attend school. Christine rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Christine operates a charcoal sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her business faces stiff competition from other firewood operators. Christine wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is married with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman living with her husband and three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital in her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a stock of firewood for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of firewood for resale

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is the 37 years old and lives with her five children and husband in the main city of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and has been providing transportation services in the main city.

He has been driving over local and unpaved roads; damaging the rickshaw body and engine. His ugly looking vehicle rattles during driving, hurting business. He wants to maintain his rickshaw but does not have enough cash in hand.

This is the reason Sakina has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband could buy a new rickshaw body, which is made of polyester, and maintain its engine. She hopes after fixing the vehicle; her husband can drive His rickshaw smoothly.

Sakina praises Kiva's system and its supporting lenders.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body and maintain its engine to support her husband.

loans.name: Transito Adan

texts.es:
Transito, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, su familia era de escasos económico por eso no pudo terminar sus estudios, está casado, su esposa solamente se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, tiene tres hijos.

Transito, es agricultor desde muy pequeño, aprendió esta labor para que fuera su sustento familiar, ahora en día sus hijos mayores le ayudan a trabajar todas las mañanas en sus cultivos.

Transito, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para su milpa, porque tiene plaga y no quiere perder sus cultivo.

Transito, sueña con poder cosechar 20 sacos de maíz y que su hija menor pueda continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Transito, 52 years old, studied until third grade. His family was of limited economic means, and therefore he was unable to finish his studies. He is married, his wife works only on domestic household chores, and he has three children.

Transito has been a farmer since he was very young. He learned this work so that he could support his family. These days, his older children help him work every morning on his crops.

Transito needs the loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his cornfield, because it has an infestation and he does not want to lose his crops.

Transito dreams of being able to harvest 20 bags of corn and that his younger daughter can continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his cornfield.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Zainab operates a grocery vegetables selling stall at the market, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis es un hombre trabajador que a sus 37 años de edad se dedica a prestar sus servicios de albañil independiente, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia desde hace 25 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz. Él habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y su hija de 15 años de edad a la que siempre trata de brindar lo mejor. Luis desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este presenta deterioro, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Luis is a hard-working man who, at 37 years old, works by lending his services as an independent construction worker. This occupation has allowed him to provide of his family for 25 years, which makes him very happy.

He lives in his own house along with his spouse and 15-year-old daughter, to whom he always tries to provide the best. Luis wants to improve the roof of his home, now that it is presenting deterioration. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to improve the roof of his home, as soon as possible.

loans.use: to improve the roof of his home, as soon as possible.

loans.name: Bukhete

texts.en:
Bukhete is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, selling to neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman and owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mariam has operated a tailoring business, making men's and women's suits. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With this Kshs 20,000 loan, Mariam wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Gladys Beatriz

texts.es:
Gladys, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada, su esposo trabaja en la pesca artesanal desde hace varios años y juntos tiene una niña que está estudiando.

Gladys, se dedica a la venta de ropa en la playa desde hace 20 años, su esposo le ayuda económicamente pero ella es una mujer muy trabajadora e independiente y le gusta la comercialización de ropa.

Gladys, necesita el financiamiento para comprar ropa, porque se acercan temporadas donde las ventas son buenas y ella espera tener más variedad de ropa, para que sus ventas aumenten.

El sueño de Gladys, es poder tener una casa propia y fortalecer aún más el negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys, 39 years old, studied until second grade. She lives with her common-law spouse, and her spouse has worked in traditional fishing for several years. They both have a daughter who is studying.

Gladys has worked selling clothing on the beach for 20 years. Her spouse helps her economically, but she is a very hard-working and independent woman, and she likes the commercialization of clothing.

Gladys needs the funding to buy clothing, because the seasons when the sales are good are approaching, and she hopes to have more variety so that her sales increase.

Gladys's dream is to have her own house and to strengthen her business even more.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mwanazia

texts.en:
Mwanazia is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Mwanazia has owned a food stall business, selling to neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Mwanazia wants to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sejahtera Group

texts.en:
The Sejahtera group is made up of 5 women and is led by Lintje, a 55-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 2 children, namely: Jimy, married, and Wesly, 2 years old.

Lintje’s husband, Hengki, 54, is a hardworking man. As the breadwinner, Hengki works as a mechanic. In addition, Lintje and Hengki also have a family business which is a bemo (a kind of public transport) and a mini truck.

Lintje is responsible to run the business when her husband leaves for work. Lintje is a good and proactive mother who always spends her time with positive activities. She also produces and sells cakes at home, however she only produce cakes in a small quantity as her capital is limited.

She is very diligent and serious in running this business and, moreover, she has regular customers. She has planned to produce more cakes but she needs more ingredients such as sugar, wheat, cooking oil, butter, etc. Therefore she looks for a loan to make her dream come true.

Lintje and other women heard about the group loan product from a TLM Loan Officer. They were very interested in the loan product. When other women agreed, Linda then formed the Sejahtera group and applied for a loan totaling 15,000,000 IDR. The other members would like to invest their parts for different businesses and other interests. They wish that the loan provided by Kiva through TLM will help them to have better lives.

loans.use: to purchase more baking ingredients such as sugar, wheat, cooking oil, butter, etc.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a married woman and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. She and her husband live at their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. She has been in business selling fish for more than ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses. With her KES 20,000 loan, she wants to buy bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and of establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is a married woman who has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She and her husband live in their own house, which has electricity and piped water. She has been in business selling fish for more than seven years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability,  leading to losses. With her KES 25,000 loan, she wants to buy bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and of establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Robbi

texts.en:
Robbi is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who has been helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home for the past ten years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Robbi has been running the tailoring business at home for many years with the help of her daughters. She wants to buy two additional sewing machines for her daughters, but she does not have enough cash on hand. Therefore, Robbi has requested a loan for her tailoring business so that she can easily buy the machines for her daughters. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

Robbi thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines for her daughters so they can contribute to the monthly income.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven  soltera tiene 27 años de edad, ella trabaja como secretaria en un agencia aduanal. Desde los once años empezó a tener problemas visuales como poder ver con claridad los objetos cercanos por lo que depende de sus anteojos. Constantemente tiene que hacer cambios de sus anteojos, el deseo de ella es poder operarse y ver bien.
texts.en: She is 27 years old and single.  She works as a secretary at a customs agency.  When she was 11 years old she started having visual problems like not being able to clearly see things up close.  Therefore, she depends on her glasses.  She constantly has to make changes to her glasses.  She wishes to be able to have an operation and to see well.

loans.use: to pay for opthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven de 27 años divorciada tiene dos hijos un hombre y una mujer. Trabaja como vendedora después de que se separo de su esposo. Nació con una afección hereditaria por lo que casi toda su vida ha visto imágenes distorsionadas si no usa sus anteojos. La cirugía láser es la única opción para corregir el astigmatismo que padece. El costo de la cirugía resulta mas  económico ya que cada 6 u 8 meses debe cambiar sus anteojos.
texts.en:
She is 27 years old and divorced. She has two children, a boy and a girl. She has been working as a salesperson after she separated from her husband.

She was born with an hereditary condition that has caused her, almost her entire life, to see distorted images if she does not use her glasses.

Laser surgery is the only option to correct the astigmatism that she has. The cost of the surgery will be more economical because she needs to change her glasses every six to eight months.

loans.use: to pay for opthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi  is a married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for food. For the past three years, she has operated a business selling clothes from door to door, and to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. With the loan that she is applying for, of KES 20,000, she wants to buy bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity  nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for school fees and food. For over five years, she has sold food from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With her KES 30,000 loan, she wants to buy wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat, for her home-based business.

loans.name: Cristian Antonio

texts.es: Cristian tiene 32 años de edad y se dedica a prestar sus servicios de maestro de obra, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, además cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos, la cual administra su compañera de vida. Él habita en casa propia, junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad. Cristian desea invertir en la tienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía cuenta con pocos productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lácteos, golosinas, embutidos, verduras, entre otros productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Cristian is 32 years old and he makes a living as a master builder, an occupation which allows him to take care of the needs of his family. 

He also has a store of basic products which his life partner manages. He lives in his own house with his life partner and his 2 children who are 9 and 3 years old.

Cristian would like to invest in the store given that, as it can be observed in the photo, it has few products, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: dairy, sweets, cold cuts, vegetables and other products to stock his store.

loans.use: to invest in: dairy, sweets, cold cuts, vegetables and other products to stock his store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un hombre casado tiene 47 años de edad. Trabaja para una empresa de transportes como auxiliar administrativo, hace seis meses le detectaron que padece una enfermedad en la retina que le provoco un sagrado, requiere un tratamiento con láser para poder detener el sangrado que hay en sus ojos.
El puede sufrir un daño mayor e irreversible, de momento lo que lo ha detenido es la falta de recursos.
texts.en:
He is 47 years old and married. He works for a transport company as an administrative assistant.

Six months ago he was diagnosed with a retinal disease that caused bleeding. He needs a laser treatment to be able to stop the bleeding in his eyes. He could suffer from greater and irreversible damange. What is stopping him is the lack of resources.

loans.use: to pay for opthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz es una mujer trabajadora de 38 años de edad que además es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad a las que siempre se esfuerza por sacar adelante. Ella se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos desde hace 4 años, y es gracias a ello que lleva el sustento a su familia, además cuenta con una pequeña granja de pollos y cerdos, lo cual le permite mejorar sus ingresos. Luz desea invertir en su granja, ya que se acerca la mejor época para la venta de pollo, por lo que ella desea tener la cantidad suficiente para atender los pedidos, por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, cerdos, concentrado y vitaminas para su granja.
texts.en:
Luz is a 38-year-old hard-working woman who, in addition, is a single mother of two children ages 7 and 4, for whom she always tries to provide. 

She has earned a living lending her domestic services for 4 years, and thanks to that, she brought sustenance to her family. In addition, she relies on a small farm of chicken and pigs, which has enabled her to improve her income. 

Luz wants to invest in her farm, now that the best time for chicken sales is approaching. Therefore, she wants to have a sufficient amount to attend to the orders. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: chickens, pigs, feed, and vitamins for her farm.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, pigs, feed, and vitamins for her farm.

loans.name: Ambica's Group

texts.en:
Ambica is a humble and simple lady standing on the extreme left in the photograph who hails from a low income household in a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is a married lady and resides with her husband and two daughters. Her husband is the sole earner in her family and works very hard to be capable enough to make both the ends meet for her family. The income earned by her husband is only hand to mouth for them.

Unfortunately, Ambica does not have an appropriate toilet facility at her home and has to walk long distances in order to relieve herself in dense bushes late at night and early in the evening. She finds this practice very dangerous as she feels the risk of insect and animal bites and she is vulnerable to crimes.

In order to restore her privacy and maintain proper hygiene, Ambica, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to install a latrine pan and build a toilet in her house.

Your loan will help Ambica to enjoy a healthy and disease-free life.

loans.use: to install a latrine pan and build a toilet in her house

loans.name: Binti

texts.en: Binti is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. For the past three years, Binti has owned a food stall, where she serves her neighbors and other town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of her clients, which can lead to a loss of perishable goods. With her KES 20,000 loan, she wants to buy inventory goods, such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory, such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Manima's Group

texts.en:
Manima is a simple and an industrious lady standing in the middle in the photograph in a yellow saree. She hails from an interior village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. Unfortunately, Manima does not have an appropriate toilet facility at her home and has to walk long distances in order to relieve herself in dense bushes late at night and early in the evening. She finds this practice very dangerous as she feels the risk of insect and animal bites and she is vulnerable to crimes. These unsanitary practices can also land her in danger of being affected by infectious and harmful diseases.

In order to restore her privacy and maintain proper hygiene and health, Manima, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to install a commode, a shower and other requisite sanitary fittings and build a toilet in her house.

Your loan will help Manima to enjoy a healthy and disease-free life.

loans.use: to install a commode, a shower and other requisite sanitary fittings and build a toilet in her house

loans.name: Irshad Bibi

texts.en:
Irshad is 39 years old and a responsible mother of three children living in the area of Multan, Pakistan.

Her daughter runs a small beauty salon. She contributes her full income for household expenses as well. She always tries to establish her businesses through offering the latest cosmetics services. Nowadays the latest cosmetics products introduced in the market are very demanding and expensive as well.

Irshad bibi requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her daughter; she will use the full amount for her daughter's business so that she can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kit, lipstick, nail polish, etc. She hopes that through this amount her daughter would be empowered to enhance the business.

Irshad bibi is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy cosmetics materials for her daughter's salon.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water bills.

For the past five years, she has operated a timber-selling business from home, selling to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a poultry business.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase timber for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish-selling business for over nine years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school and the other is still too young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Gayatri's Group

texts.en:
Gayatri, standing on the extreme left, is a differently abled lady. She hails from a humble background and a rural household in Koraput district, Odisha, India. Gayatri lost her eyes three years back in an accident. She is a married lady and is a blessed mother of a toddler. She does not have an appropriate toilet facility at her home and has to walk long distances in order to relieve herself in dense bushes late at night and early in the evening. She finds this practice very dangerous as she feels the risk of insect and animal bites and she is vulnerable to crimes and molestations.

In order to restore her privacy and prevent herself from exploitation, Gayatri, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to install a latrine pan, a hand pump to facilitate water supply and build a toilet in her house.

Gayatri is in dire need of your kind help and support.

loans.use: to install a latrine pan, a hand pump to facilitate water supply and build a toilet in her house

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina and her family live at Afusing Daga. She is managing a repair shop for income. Rosalina is now 46 years old and has four children. Rosalina and her husband manage a shop offering vehicle repairs. Rosalina would like to improve their services, which is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy a welding rod to use in the repair shop. She hopes to earn a good profits to use for education expenses. Rosalina and her husband promise to pay back the loan in full and keep extending good services to all the customers.

loans.use: to buy a welding rod to use in her repair shop.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio con 62 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y tres hijos a su cargo de (20, 16 y 12 años de edad), el primero ya terminó sus estudios secundarios no sigue estudios superiores, el mismo que ayuda a realizar trabajos de campo ,el segundo estudia en colegio secundario de C.P.M. Tambillo, el tercero estudia en escuela primaria respectivamente, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural.Julio cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,ganadería, al cultivo de productos de pan llevar y a la cría de animales menores.

Julio se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 02 hectáreas de variedad Catimor, plantación tiene 3-4 años de edad estando en segundo año de producción. Julio cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro ya que anteriormente a cultivada café tradicional variedad nacional; Ahora por cuestiones de enfermedades y plagas han renovado plantación variedad catimor que es mucho más resistente a enfermedades .Su cultivo de café lo realiza en terreno propio,cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en este rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca). Siendo estos para su consumo.El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de café de las 2 hectáreas, con las que cuenta en producción, asegurando campaña agrícola 2016 con una mayor producción, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Julio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Julio firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Julio is 62 years old, in a common law marriage. He lives in a house he owns, made of rustic material, with his wife and three children under his care (12, 16 and 20 years old). The oldest already finished middle school and is not in high school. He helps with jobs in the fields. The middle child is in middle school at C.P.M. Tambillo. The youngest is in elementary school. They live in a rural area in the Santo Tomás district, in the province of Cutervo, in the department of Cajamarca, Perú.

Julio has very good business and personal references from the inhabitants of the area. The residents of that area work primarily in agriculture, cattle raising, growing staple crops, and breeding small animals.

Julio works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. Currently he has two hectares of the catimor variety. His plantation is 3-4 years old and is in the second year of production. Julio has a good deal of experience in the field, as he previously grew traditional coffee of a national variety. Now, due to diseases and pests, they have renovated the plantation to the catimor variety, as it is much more resistant to diseases. He plants his coffee in fields he owns. He has more than 20 years experience in this work. He also works breeding small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs, among others), and growing staple crops (yucca, banana and taro) for his own consumption.

The purpose of the loan will be for the maintenance of 1 of his 2 hectares of coffee that he has in production, ensuring greater production for his 2016 agricultural year, reflected in a greater volume of sales so that he will obtain increased earnings. In this way he will better his quality of life and that of his family.

Julio is a recurring borrower with Edpyme Alternative. Julio signed with his partner.

loans.use: to maintain 1 of 2 hectares of coffee that he has in production, to ensure greater production for his 2016 agricultural year.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, neither of attend school because they are still young. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. In addition, she also operates a cosmetics-selling business selling at the market. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children, all of whom attend school . She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetics shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Cristobalina

texts.es:
Cristobalina es una mujer casada de 38 años de edad, con una linda familia de 4 hijos de las edades entre 5 y 15 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Panajchel.
Cristobalina para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, este negocio se ubica en una de las calles principales de su comunidad.
Ella ama mucho a su familia y con el afán de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: block, arena y piedrín para empezar la remodelación de su vivienda, pues se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y su familia no se merece esta comodidad de hogar. Sus aspiraciones en la vida son: fortalecer su negocio, mejorar la vivienda y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cristobalina is a married woman who is 38 years old, with a beautiful family of four children between the ages of 5 and 15. This humble family lives in a community in Panajchel.

Cristobalina, in order to earn an income and take care of the needs of her family, has been making a living for the past 20 years buying and selling traditional clothing. This business is located in one of the main streets of her community.

She loves her family very much and, in her eagerness to improve their quality of life, she has decided to request a loan to buy construction materials such as: block, sand and gravel to begin remodeling her home, given it is in bad condition and her family doesn't deserve this home. 

Her aspirations in life are: to strengthen her business, improve the home and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as block, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a widow from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol.  She is a mother with  three dependents aged 14, 16 and 19. It has never been easy for her to support her children after she became a widow.  She resorted to raising hogs,  selling prepaid electronic top-up for mobile users, and selling direct products from Avon company such as air freshener, cosmetics and toilet cleaners. She is asking a loan to buy more cosmetics, lotion, perfume, toilet cleaners, air freshener and electronic top up load wallet. As a mother she only hope that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, lotion, perfume, toilet cleaners, air freshener and electronic top up load wallet

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Jonathan has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Jonathan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Jonathan can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Jonathan will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Thouk's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Battambang province, Thouk is 61 years old. Her main incomes which she can support on her living condition are from rice growing and goat-raising. She has involved her businesses for 12 and it earned her about 7 USD per day. The insects have destroyed her farm, so her rice did not grow well.

For Thouk, this is not her first time with VisionFund and she has paid back her past loan on time. Her living condition has improved by her previous loan. In a group of two, she is the group leader. Thouk will use her entire loan portion to purchase more fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to improve her farmland to get more yields. She also will use a part of her loan to buy fishing instruments to support on her new business (fishing). She hopes that she can earn more income to upgrade her lifestyle get better in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia lives with her two little children She makes and sells cheese, as she was trained by her mother since she was a child. Alicia needs a loan to buy a milking cow, because she wants to have more milk .

Alicia would like to have a grocery store in the future, where she will offer her cheeses. She wants to give her children a better life, so she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow to be able to make more cheese

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Her most major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is  a married woman with four children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nut business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby for over seven years now. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.  

With a loan of KES 40,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. 

She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Kimberly Xiomara

texts.es: Kimberly es una mujer de 20 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de tortillas, lo cual le permite salir adelante y sostener a su familia, además por las tardes vende pastelitos de carne. Ella vive junto a su grupo familiar desde hace 11 años, por lo que se siente feliz de tener un lugar donde vivir y tener su negocio. Kimberly desea aumentar sus ventas, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI el cual invertirá en: maíz por mayoreo, carne, verduras, repollo, etc., para sus ventas de pasteles y tortillas.
texts.en: Kimberly is a 20 year old woman. She works selling tortillas which allows her to get ahead and to sustain her family. Also in the evenings she sells meat pastries. She has lived together with her family unit for 11 years and it makes her feel happy to have a place to live and run her business. Kimberly wants to increase her sales so she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI. She will invest it in corn, wholesale, meat, vegetables, cabbage, etc. for her sales of pastries and tortillas.

loans.use: to invest in corn wholesale, meat, vegetables, cabbage, etc. for her sales of pastries and tortillas.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a high cost of competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Francisca operates a grocery vegetable selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur is 31 years old and he is refugee from Bilasuvar region. He is married and has a large family. He is the only one working in the family and is a hard working man. He is trying to earn enough income by being a farmer who raises cattle and sheep. This way he takes care of family's needs. He is very energetic and passionate about his job.

Seymur is a well known farmer who does a great job in meeting customers' needs. He has a small shop where he brings natural meat to sell in the market. In the local market there aren't many people who can provide the real natural meat. That's why people like buying from Seymur.

Due to growing demand in the market because of peoples' preference to traditional food like kufta, bozbash which consist of mutton, beef, Seymur is planning to expand. Currently he needs 1200 AZN loan to buy 3 calves. He hopes Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla  is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenges of competition and seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business. Her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbors, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 39 years old and from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have three children who are still dependent and are ages 3, 13 and 16.  Rosalinda sells rice and raise hogs for a living. She started this business just a year ago.  She is asking for a loan to buy rice and quality feed for her hogs. In the future, she plans to open a aari-sari store to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married with six children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby for the past four years . She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Mai is a hardworking woman, 40 years old. She is married and has three children . Her family’s income is mainly from cultivation and husbandry. She would like to take the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. Her husband is a driver  With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married with three school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to- door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas to sell.

loans.name: Swafia

texts.en:
Swafia is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married mother of six children, two of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, Lydia has operated an open air food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business.

Lydia wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, Shamim has operated a motorcycle business at the market . Her major business challenge is competition. Shamim wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa, 54, runs a sari-sari (general store) business to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past fifteen years. She lives in San Miguel, Bohol. Felipa is requesting a loan in order to buy canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, match, biscuits, soft drinks and liquor. This will help her to gain more profit.

With the help of this loan, she can offer a greater variety of items to her customers. In the future, Felipa hopes to expand her business and make it more reliable in terms of profitability.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar,  match,  biscuits, soft drinks and liquor

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling soap, sugar, salt and milk. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

Frida decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, soap and milk for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, soap and milk for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothing sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and competition in her place of operation.

Beatrice decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 30,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
