Mgeni is a married woman living with her husband and six children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past six years, she has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of competition in her business. 

In addition, she also operates a juice and coconut selling business that is another source of income.

With the loan for KES 20,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of firewood for resale. 

She decided to join to Yehu to gain access to loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of firewood  for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Veronica has operated a stall at the market, selling vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces challenges of high transportation costs and competition in her place of operation.

Veronica wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married mother of five children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over nine years, Mwanasha has operated an open air food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business.

Mwanasha wants to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es madre de familia de 46 años, vive y se esfuerza para darles lo necesario a sus tres hijos de las edades entre 10 y 20 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Panimaché.
Isabel se dedica a la producción de banano desde hace 20 años, ella comenzó con esta actividad porque esta labor lo realizaba su familia, pero para obtener mejores ingresos se dedica a la producción de café, afortunadamente la zona donde ella vive es muy productivo.  Isabel desde hace algún tiempo a  considerado necesario la compra de una terreno para poder ampliar su cultivo, pero su mayor dificultad ha sido que no tiene el dinero necesario por esa razón a decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una cuerda de terreno para cultivo. Su esperanza de vida es mejora los ingresos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 46-year-old mother of a family, and she makes an effort to give what is necessary to her three children between 10 and 20 years of age. This family lives in a community of the small town Panimache. 

Isabel has worked in the production of banana plants for 20 years. She started this occupation because her family did this work, but to obtain better earnings, she worked in the production of coffee beans. Fortunately, the zone in which she lives is very fruitful. 

For some time, Isabel has considered the purchase of a pice of land necessary to be able to expand her crops. However, her major difficulty has been that she does not have the necessary money. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan for the purchase of a piece of land for farming. 

Her hope is to improve the economic earnings of her family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Mrs. Suong is a hardworking woman, 43 years old . She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from farming and salary. She would like to borrow  he loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has seven children, all of whom attend school. Lucy owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Lucy has operated a fuel selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her business.
 
With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase a stock of fuel for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of fuel for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single mother of one child, who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation and competition in her business.

Elizabeth decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat to sell.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Nadzuwa has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business. Nadzuwa is requesting a loan to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer de 47 años de edad, con una linda familia con la que vive en una comunidad de la aldea Chuisanto Tomas.
Paula cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior pudo comprar su terreno  donde ahora se encuentra cultivando, con esta inversión su vida ha cambiado mucho pues sus ingresos mejoraron y ropa de sus hijos pudo comprar, Paula con el afán de seguir incrementando su cultivo ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de otro terreno con cultivo de café. Ella espera conseguir el crédito y muy pronto instalar un negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en: Paula is a 47 year old woman with a beautiful family. She lives in a community in the city of Chuisanto Tomas. Paula reports that thanks to her previous loan she was able to purchase a plot of land that she is now farming. Her life has changed drastically with this investment because her earnings have improved. She is now able to purchase clothing for her children. With the hope of continuing to expand her crops, Paula has decided to seek a new loan to purchase another plot of land to grow coffee on. She hopes to receive this loan and eventually open up her own grocery store.

loans.use: purchase a plot of land to grow coffee

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Saidi has operated a butcher shop business for the past three years, selling goat meat . She faces major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business. Saidi is requesting a loan to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a single woman with no children. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with seven children; all attend school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expense is food.

She has been operating a food cafe for the past five years, selling at the market. Her major challenge is seasonality only at the location of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of food commodities, such as sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She joined Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of food such as sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four kids, the eldest of whom is 13 years old and the youngest 10 years old; all of them attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and clothing.

Margaret sells vegetables door to door to the villagers. She faces challenges of seasonality and high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables for resale. She dreams of opening a kiosk in the future and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Karla Estela

texts.es: Karla de 25 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, actividad que le permite salir adelante, con los gastos de su familia. Ella vive en casa de su propiedad junto a sus 3 hijas de 11, 7 y 4 años de edad a las que está sacando adelante como madre soltera. Karla desea invertir en materiales para aumentar sus ventas, además del área donde realiza su trabajo, por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en maíz por mayor, lámina y clavos para mejorar sus ventas y el área de trabajo.
texts.en:
Karla, 25 years old, works in the production and sale of tortillas, an occupation that has allowed her to get ahead with the expenses of her family. She lives in her own house along with her three daughters, ages 11, 7, and 4 years old. She is providing for them as a single mother.

Karla wants to invest in materials to increase her sales, as well as the area where she carries out her work. For this reason, she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in wholesale corn, sheet metal, and nails to improve her sales and the work area.

loans.use: to invest in wholesale corn, sheet metal, and nails to improve her sales and the work area.

loans.name: Mkadi

texts.en:
Mkadi is a married mother of two children, one of whom attends school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothing sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

Mkadi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 30,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Grupo Patzaj Group

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 47 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de 7 hijos de las edades entre 10 y 27 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del caserío Patzaj.
Juan (el primero del lado derecho en la fotografía) para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos desde hace 20 años se dedica a la producción de café, afortunadamente él vive en un zona muy fértil. Juan con el gran sueño de superación ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas y pago de mano de obra para su cultivo de café, pues es muy necesario que el cultivo obtenga su mantenimiento lo más pronto posible para obtener  una buena cosecha.  Su esperanza de vida es mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a 47 year old man. He is married and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 27. This humble family lives in a neighborhood of Patzaj. Juan (the first one on the right in the photograph) works producing coffee, which he has done for 20 years, in order to earn a living and provide for his family. Fortunately, he lives in a very fertile region.

With a dream of getting ahead, Juan decided to seek a loan to purchase agricultural supplies and pay for labor so that his crops can get much needed care as soon as possible in order to produce a good harvest. His goal is to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Grupo Pochol 2 Group

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre optimista, trabaja de sol a sol para darle a su familia lo necesario, él tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero con una familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 8 y 14 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del Caserío Pochol.
Miguel (el primero del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) con el afán de obtener mejores ingresos se dedica a la producción de café, con esta actividad el lleva 20 años de realizarlo, pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a la venta de banano. Miguel con deseo de obtener al final del año una buena cosecha de café ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas y pago de mano de obra, el acude a este préstamo porque en este momento no cuenta con el efectivo necesario. Miguel tiene la esperanza de mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is an optimistic man who work day to day to provide his family with their needs. He is 41 years old, single, and has four children between the ages of 8 and 14. This humble family lives in the town of Pochol. Miguel (the first one on the left in the photograph) works growing coffee, which he has done for 20 years, in order to make a living. However, in order to supplement his earnings, he also sells bananas. 

With the hope of producing a good coffee harvest this year, he has decided to seek a loan to purchase agricultural supplies and pay for labor. He is seeking this loan because he does not currently have the capital needed for these expenses.  Miguel hopes to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married mother of two children, who both attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Margaret has operated a charcoal sales business, selling from home to her villages for the past two years. She faces major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

Margaret decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards. With the loan of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and to pay for transport.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married mother of three children, who all attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Margaret operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her villages. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards. With the loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase  sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio con 29 años de edad,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus seis hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Artemio cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Artemio realiza la actividad de la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor,contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea,plantación tiene 4 años de edad estando en segundo año de producción.cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro ya que anteriormente cultivaba café tradicional de variedad nacional.Ahora por cuestiones de enfermedades y plagas han renovado plantación variedad catimor que es mucho más resistente a enfermedades.Su cultivo de café lo realiza en terreno propio 1 hectárea ubicada en el caserío Palma Central comprensión del Distrito Santo Tomas. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca). Siendo estos para su consumo.El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de café que tiene en producción, asegurando campaña agrícola 2016 con una mayor producción, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Artemio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. .
texts.en: Artemio is 29 years old. He lives in his own house made of rustic material with his wife and their six children in the district of Santo Tomas, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca in Peru. Artemio has good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The inhabitants of this town work mainly in agriculture and animal husbandry. Artemio works in agriculture, specially cultivating coffee of the Catimor variety, and he has now a hectare. His crops are 4 years old and they are in their second year of production. He has ample experience in the business, because he used to cultivate traditional coffee of the Nacional variety. Now, because of matters of diseases and plagues, he has renewed cultivating the Catimor variety, which is more resistant to diseases. He cultivates his coffee in his own land of one hectare, located in the village of Palma Central, part of the district of Santo Tomas. Additionally, he works raising small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and cultivating basic staple products (cassava, bananas, vituca), being these for his own consumption. This loan will be used to maintain one hectare of coffee that he has in production, assuring his 2016 agricultural campaign with more production, reflected in a higher volume of sales, and therefore, in  more income to improve his quality of life and that of his family. Artemio is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to maintain the coffee hectare he has in production, assuring the 2016 agricultural campaign with more production.

loans.name: La Patience Group

texts.fr: Maganga est une entrepreneuse qui commerce des habits pour bébés dans un magasin de la ville, membre du groupe de crédits «La Patience», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 47 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants scolarisés. Elle va s’approvisionner en robes, tricots, chemises, pampers. Il y a 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité, avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Maganga is an entrepreneur who sells clothes for babies in a stores in the city. She is a member of the loan group "La Patience" (Patience), a client of the IMF Hekima. Maganga is 47 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children who go to school. She is going to stock up on dresses, sweaters, shirts, and diapers. She has practiced this profession for 15 years, with the initial capital received from her husband. She hopes to build a home and school and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the help brought to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on dresses, sweaters, shirts, and diapers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay her for goods taken on credit.

Gloria decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married with two school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a business selling khangas (women's wrap cloths), selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. In addition, she also operates a vegetable selling business that earns her another source of income.

Mwanamisi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women's wrap cloths) for resale.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel es un padre de familia que ama y protege a sus hijos, cuenta que gracias a su crédito pudo comprar su terreno donde actualmente se encuentra cultivando, ahora su cultivo ha incrementado y con ello sus ingresos mejoraron. Miguel con el afán se seguir prosperando ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de dos cuerdas de terreno para tener más lugares donde cultivar. Sus gran anhelo es sembrara cinco cuerdas de maxan por lo que le es muy importante conseguir el crédito para la compra de su terreno.
texts.en: Miguel is the father of a family that he loves and protects. Thanks to a previous loan, Miguel was able to purchase the land that he currently farms. Now, his crops have expanded and his earnings have improved. Miguel has decided to request a new loan to purchase two acres of land to expand his farming area, with the goal of continuing to prosper. His greatest desire is to plant five acres of maxan (leaves to wrap tamales), which is why this loan is important.

loans.use: purchase two acres of land.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a divorced woman with two children, both attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Mary faces the major challenges of clients taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit and seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Carmen Yanira

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer trabajadora e independiente de 43 años de edad. Es madre de una niña de 16 años, quién depende económicamente de ella. Actualmente vive en Guadalajara en donde tiene su negocio de elaboración de cerveza artesanal desde hace siete años. Ella al conocer este sector, se interesó de inmediato y comenzó a tomar pláticas y cursos que la animaron a iniciar su negocio. 
Tras este tiempo, ha tenido la oportunidad de asistir a festivales nacionales para dar a conocer su producto con el fin de crear una cartera de clientes más amplia. Dese hace dos años, se ha dedicado a producir cerveza para marcas específicas quienes se encargan de comercializarla.
Con el sueño de expandirse y crear su propia marca para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, Carmen pidió un crédito el cual le ha ayudado a comprar botellas para poder envasar más producto e incrementar sus ventas. De esta manera, podrá importar más materia prima para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking and independent 43 year old woman. She is the mother of a 16 year old daughter who depends on her financially. Carmen currently lives in Guadalajara, where she has a business making craft beer, which she has owned for seven years. Upon learning about this field, she became immediately interested and began to attend courses and seminars that led her start her own business. Throughout this time, she has had the opportunity to attend national festivals to exhibit her product with the goal of expanding her customer base. Two years ago, she began to develop beer for specific brands that take care of selling them.

With the dream of expanding her business and creating her own brand so that she can give her daughter a better quality of life, Carmen has requested a loan to purchase bottles in order to bottle more of her product and increase her sales. This way, she will be able to import more raw materials and expand he business.

loans.use: purchase more bottles to bottle her product and increase her sales.

loans.name: Yaseen

texts.en:
Yaseen is a young man who lives in Rafah, in the Gaza strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to open a new business. His business idea was to transport goods and inventory between traders by rickshaw.

A few years ago Yaseen bought a new rickshaw and become famous. He also has loyal customers. Know that Yaseen took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do some maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Yaseen can work more efficiently and increase his sales and also his profit.


Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to do some maintenance on his rickshaw.

loans.name: Rael Group

texts.fr: Shabani est commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «Rael», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 27 ans, mère de 4 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des oignons et ail dans un dépôt du centre commercial depuis 4 ans. Elle va acheter 4 sacs d’oignons et 4 sacs ails. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari, qui est chauffeur. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Shabani is a storekeeper, a member of the small borrowing group "Rael", and a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. She is married, 27 years old, and the mother of 4 children who go to school. She has been a vendor of onions and garlic in a kiosk in the shopping center for 4 years. She is going to buy 4 bags of onions and 4 bags of garlic. She began her business with funds received from her husband, who is a chauffeur. She hopes to grow her business and send her children to school. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the help brought to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of onions and 4 bags of garlic.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “LAS ROSAS” conformada por 05 socias. Este es el caso de CARMEN de 33 años de edad soltera con 5 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al servicio de manualidades donde elabora todo de bisutería como pulseras collares y muchos artículos más para una fábrica. Su mayor deseo es de poder terminar de construir su casita es por ello que Solicito el crédito para la compra de cemento. El grupo “las ROSAS” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Carmen es la segunda del lado derecho viste chompa color negro.
texts.en:
This is the new group "Las Rosas" [The Roses] made up of 5 members. This is the case of Carmen, 33-years-old, single with 5 dependent children. She works in the service of handicrafts, where she produces all costume jewelry, such as bracelets, necklaces, and many other things for factory. 

Her greatest desire is to be able to finish constructing her small house. It is for this reason that she is requesting the loan to be able to buy cement.

The group "Las Rosas" is thankful for the people of Kiva that have made this loan possible, since it has allowed them to continue improving. 

Carmen is the second from the right side dressed in a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy cement.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has been operating a butcher shop business for the past four years, selling goat meat to the neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business.

With this loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Seerenah

texts.en:
Sereenah wanted to start a new chapter in her life after her marital relationship ended. She ‎decided to complete her higher education and get a masters degree.
‎
Sereenah is 38 years old and lives with her mother in Irbid. She is divorced and has no children. Sereenah ‎applied for a loan to help her cover her semester fees and achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: To pay for her university fees

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 30-year-old single man who left school at the secondary level to help in covering the needs and ‎expenses of his siblings. He started 10 years ago to work in selling hot and cold drinks with a friend, where ‎he gained a wide experience in this domain. He decided three years ago to start working in his own ‎kiosk to sell hot and cold drinks and other products.
  
Hassan is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is well-known in his region. Now he is requesting a loan ‎to expand his kiosk with new coffee machine and add food supplies to attract more customers and ‎satisfy all demands.
  
Hassan hopes to expand his business more in the future through opening his own coffee shop to increase ‎his income and improve his living conditions.‎

loans.use: ‎to expand his kiosk with new coffee machine and add food supplies.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children.

Shamim requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy gents shoes for his shoe store. He has been selling shoes for many years. He has been selling ladies' fancy and casual shoes in his hometown. Most of his customers demand gents shoes as well, but due to the lack of fund availability, he cannot purchase gents shoes.

Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan so her husband can buy a variety of gents shoes for reselling purposes. In this way, he can easily cope with the demand and abstain from customers' disappointments.

His shop is situated in the shoe market and a lot of other shoe stores are available there, which becomes the cause of tough competition. He dreams of moving his shop to another place to abstain from the competitors.

Through the investment of current loan, her husband can easily establish his shoe store and enhance his savings so his dream can come true.

loans.use: to buy variety of gents shoes for her husband's shoe selling store.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 22-year-old single woman who lives with her parents and two siblings.  She provides the main income source for the family.  In order to satisfy the needs of her family, she works as a nurse at a local hospital, and also as a private nurse at her client's request.  

Currently, Fatmeh is asking to borrow a loan from a Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to buy nursing tools.  She said that this loan will help her increase her revenue by a good percentage, and open up areas for progress.

loans.use: to buy nursing tools.

loans.name: Nagham

texts.en:
Nagham is a 38-year-old divorced woman living alone. She has been working since 2014 as a housekeeper at a local school, and works in parallel at cleaning houses as clients' requests. 

Nagham is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to buy a new living room. She said that she is very happy and this is her first loan. And for sure in the future, she is eager to benefits from more kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy a new living room.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years Kanze has operated a door-to-door motorcycle transport business. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Kanze decided to join Kiva's field partner Yehu to access its loans. She has applied for a 30,000 KES to buy another motorcycle for her business. With her increased profits she wants to build up her business, add to her savings and and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for her door-to-door transport business.

loans.name: Acerdieu

texts.fr: Acerdieu, 37 ans, vit en union libre. Il habite à Bon Repos avec sa compagne et leur enfant. Il a une boutique de produits alimentaires  qu’il a mis sur pied depuis déjà cinq ans. Il a beaucoup de clients et fait régulièrement face à des ruptures de stock. Il demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock afin de bien profiter de cette opportunité dans la zone.
texts.en: Acerdieu is 37 years old and cohabitates. He lives in Bon Repos with his partner and their child. He has a boutique of food products that he established 5 years ago. He has many customers and confronts stock shortages regularly.  He asks for this loan to increase his stock in order to profit a lot from this opportunity in the area.

loans.use: to increase his stock of spaghetti.

loans.name: Elvis Esteban

texts.es: Elvis de 29 años es un empresario independiente que reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla en compañía de su cónyuge y su hijo de ocho años de edad, aunque labora en una constructora hace cuatro años, decidió incrementar su ingreso al emprender su propia idea de negocio “rentar habitaciones”; como sus conocimientos en albañilería están muy fundamentados, pues a diario es lo que hace, en su vivienda cuenta con metros cuadrados extras que adecuó en habitaciones confortables y cuyo canon le permite ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.  En la actualidad proyecta realizar adecuaciones para que los arrendatarios tengan unas mejores condiciones de habitabilidad, es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar pisos cerámicos y realizar arreglo al techo.  Esta inversión permitirá que las habitaciones sean mucho más comerciales y que sus ingresos sean mejores.  Su meta a futuro es continuar mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda y costearle los estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Elvis is 29 years old and lives in a neighborhood of Barranquilla together with his common-law wife and their eight-year-old son. Although he has been working for a construction company for four years, he decided to increase his income by starting his own business renting rooms and has become an independent entrepreneur.

He has a solid knowledge of bricklaying since this is what he does every day, and he used his knowledge to turn some extra square footage in his house into comfortable rooms. The rent they generate provides a better standard of living for his family.

Currently he plans to make some improvements so that his tenants have better living conditions, and this is why he is asking for his first loan from Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy ceramic flooring and to make repairs to the roof. This investment will make the rooms much more commercial and will improve his income.

His future goal is to continue improving the infrastructure of his house and to pay for his son's education.

loans.use: to buy ceramic flooring and to fix the roof.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband works tirelessly to be able to enhance their way of living. Her husband works as an employee. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay for her children's education fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children's education fees.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMISTAD” iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angelica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido y venta de frazadas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, tejido y venta de mantas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angelica es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una prima que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tejido y venta de frazadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando con su tía y hace más de quince años que decidió emprender su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializara en las comunidades de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amistad" will begin its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Panamericana. It is composed of eight members and is directed by a board of directors of which Angelica is the president. The businesses that the members of the association have are various among which are weaving and sales of blankets; food sales; neighborhood store; and weaving and sales of shawls.

The loan they will get will benefit the microenterprises of which Angelica is a part. She indicates the she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, coming in at the invitation of a cousin who is a customer of the institution. Nowadays, she has a business weaving and selling blankets. She wants it known that this is a business that she learned working with an aunt and it's been more than 15 years since she decided to start her own business.

The loan which she will now take out will be for an increase in capital (to buy wool wholesale) which she gets for the saleswomen in the city of El Alto and after the manufacture she will sell in the communities of La Paz. This kind of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family economically, since she is married and has five children.

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Adolfo Martin

texts.es: Adolfo de 44 años es un empresario independiente que encontró en el expendió de medicamentos la oportunidad de dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  Este emprendedor inició su proyecto de negocio en el año 2013, una droguería que entregó para su administración a una  persona con amplia experiencia en medicamentos y productos de aseo personal, contando con óptimos resultados.  Alternamente a su negocio,  es empleado en una empresa privada y maneja turnos que le permiten estar al tanto de la droguería sin perder detalles.  En la actualidad desea invertir en un mayor surtido de medicamentos de alta rotación, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en medicinas al por mayor entre ellas acetaminofén, antibióticos de amplio espectro, antiácidos y demás.  Adolfo es padre de un hijo de trece años y vive con su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, su meta a futuro es incrementar las ventas y el capital de trabajo, para así lograr comprar su casa y ofrecerle una mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en: Adolfo, 44 years old, is an independent businessman who found that the business of selling medicines was a good opportunity to give his family a better quality of life. This entrepreneur started his business project in 2013, a drugstore he passed on the management position to a person with broad experience in medicines and products of personal hygiene, which had optimal results. Besides his business, he is employed at a private company and he works shifts that allow him to keep an eye on his drugstore. Currently, he wants to invest in a larger assortment of medicines of high demand. For this he is applying to his first Credikiva through la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that he will invest in medicines at wholesale prices, among them acetaminofen, wide spectrum antibiotics, antacids and more. Adolfo is the father of a thirteen year old son and lives with his wife in a neighborhood of a municipality of Soledad. His goal in the future is to increase sales and work capital so he can be able to buy a house and give his son a better education.

loans.use: to invest in medicines at wholesale prices, among them acetaminofen, wide spectrum antibiotics, antacids and more.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of business.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water .Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a business selling milk for the past two years, selling from home to the neighbors. She mentioned transportation and seasonality in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of milk for resale. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  a stock of milk for resale

loans.name: Mkaratusi Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her mid-50's, is married. She has five children, three of whom are grown-up and two of whom are still in school. She has been running a restaurant for five years now. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's twelfth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to restock the out-of-stock items in her restaurant and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She used her profits to pay school fees, repay the loan, pay rent, and cover household expenses. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva lenders for their support. Rehema will use this loan to increase her restaurant stock with items like soda, snacks, and milk to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of expanding her business.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group "Mkaratusi," which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her restaurant stock with items like soda and snacks meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Falak

texts.en:
Falak is a 44-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and five young children. Her husband provides the family's main income to fulfill the necessities of life and Falak sells clothes from home.

Currently, Falak is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register them for the coming school year, which makes her very optimistic and willing to take additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Gs Las Delicias I Group

texts.es:
La señora Marisel tiene  30 años, de edad se dedica desde hace 5 años, al negocio de elaboración y venta de pan y refresco,  la mayoría de sus clientes son personas que venden pan en las pulperías en motocicletas  bicicletas y carros  
La señora Marisel con el crédito que nos está solicitando espera comprar,  harina azúcar leña. Espera que su negocio crezca y tener más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes, es su séptimo crédito con Prisma, espera seguir contando con el apoyo para hacer crecer su negocio. Esta solicitando el crédito de forma grupal sus integrantes son: 
La señora  Ana se dedica al negocio de la venta de pan. 
El señor Juan se dedica al negocio de la venta de pan y huevos.

Su sueño es poder salir adelante con su familia.
	
Choluteca, Honduras –  Septiembre  del 2015
texts.en:
Marisel is 30 years old. She has made a living for 5 years from the business of producing and selling bread and soft drinks. The majority of her customers are people who sell bread to the grocery stores on motorcycle, bicycle, and car.

With the loan that she is requesting from us, Marisel hopes to purchase flour, sugar, and firewood. She hopes that her business grows and to have more products to offer to her customers. It is her seventh loan with Prisma. She hopes to continue counting on the support to make her business grow. She is requesting the loan as part of a group. The members are:

Ana, who makes a living from selling bread.
Juan, who makes a living from the business of selling bread and eggs.

Her dream is to be able to get ahead with her family.

Choluteca, Honduras- September of 2015

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, sugar and butter for her business.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Cristina is 54 years old and all of her children are in school.

Maria Cristina has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products from Avon like lipstick, shoes, bags, deodorant, body spray, etc. to sell.

Maria Cristina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Maria Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon like lipstick, shoes, bags, deodorant, and body spray to sell

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, a 45-year-old mother of three, lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is retired, while Azra sews clothes along with her two daughters and a son at home to generate income for the entire family. She has two sewing machines operated by her daughters, and her son deals with customers, takes orders, and sews clothes to order.

To maximize profits, Azra wants to sell her clothes directly in the market, but she does not have sufficient capital to buy the required raw materials. She has, therefore, requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy materials such as cloth, laces, zippers and spools. Azra thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her family's tailoring business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene 29 años de edad, tiene una hija de dos meses, la pequeña Carla, Juan  es de estado civil soltero, es un padre muy dedicado y responsable pues trabaja muy duro para darle lo necesario a su niña. Se dedica a la agricultura hace diez años, solicita el crédito para la siembra y cultivo de papa y así obtener ganancias para seguir cumpliendo con su responsabilidad de padre.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 29. He has a two-month-old daughter, little Carla. Juan is single. He is a very dedicated and responsible father who works very hard to give his daughter the things she needs. He has been working in agriculture for ten years.

He is requesting this loan in order to plant and grow potatoes. The profits will allow him to continue fulfilling his responsibilities as a father.

loans.use: to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Bushara

texts.en:
Bushara, a housewife, is in need of a loan for her husband so that he can refurbish and expand his restaurant.

Bushara is blessed with four children, and she aims to get them educated with the funds generated from this restaurant.

The items required include furniture, such as tables and chairs, groceries, such as vegetables and meat, plus a new gas cylinder.

Hence, this loan is pivotal for Bushara as it would help her enhance her husband's earnings with the expansion of his restaurant, simultaneously fulfilling her aim of getting a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy furniture and groceries for her husband, so he can refurbish his restaurant.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a youth living in Rafah in the Gaza strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to open a new business. His business idea is to transport goods and inventory between traders in his rickshaw.

A few years ago, Murad bought a new rickshaw, become famous and has loyal customers. Now Murad has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do some maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Murad can work more efficiently and increase his sales and his profit.


Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to the efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to do some maintenance on his rickshaw.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife. He works as a cleaner and he is doing well so far.

Currently, Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his nephew’s educational fees. He says that this loan will help him to ensure a good education for his nephew this school year.

loans.use: to pay his nephew’s educational fees.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis con 42 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos de 14, 6 y 2 años de edad respectivamente,en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Luis cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura cultivo de café, cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar.

Luis se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra y cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea variedad Catimor, el cuál es resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación esta en su segundo año de producción,su cultivo de café lo realiza en el Caserío de Miraflores,en distrito de Santo Tomas, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 20 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, cerdo) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca) y además trabaja como peón agrícola.El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas, por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida de él y de su familia.

Luis es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa. Luis firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Luis, 42, is in a common-law marriage. He lives in his own house of rustic materials together with his wife and his three minor children, 14, 6 and 2 respectively, in the district of Santo Tomas, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, in Peru. Luis has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the zone. The majority of the local inhabitants make a living from agriculture: growing coffee; raising and selling small livestock; and growing basic foodstuffs.

Luis makes a living from agriculture, specifically the planting and cultivating coffee, now having one hectare with the Catimor variety, which is resistant to diseases and blight. The plantation is in the second year of production. He produces the coffee in the hamlet of Miraflores, in the Santo Tomas district with his twenty years of experience in this line of work. Additionally, he makes a living raising small livestock (chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs) and growing basic foodstuffs (cassava, bananas, and taro) and in addition he works as an agricultural day-laborer.

The loan will be used to invest in the maintenance and care of one hectare of coffee in production, assuring a good production for the 2016 campaign reflected in a greater volume of sales, and thereby he will obtain greater income in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Luis is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. Luis signs with his wife.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance and care of one hectare of coffee in production.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 48-year-old poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good and their living standards seem not fit for human beings. She wants to establish her house and improve her family's living standards. Her whole family depends upon a single earner - her husband, who drives an auto rickshaw.

Akhtar wants to buy an additional rickshaw for her son as well. He wants to assemble a new auto rickshaw from a maker. He has collected almost the full amount but is short of the total. Therefore, Akhtar wants a loan for her son so he can buy his own auto rickshaw. In this way she will encourage her son so that he can drive his new rickshaw and generate income for her family.

Akhtar hopes that her son will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assemble a new rickshaw for her son to earn a living.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a young man living in Rafah, in the Gaza Strip. He works in the public sector, where his salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to open a new business. His business idea was to transport goods and inventory among traders in a rickshaw. A few years ago, Jalal bought a new rickshaw and became well-known so he has loyal customers.

Jalal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to perform some maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Jalal can work more efficiently and increase his sales and his profits.

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to perform some maintenance on his rickshaw.

loans.name: Lory May

texts.en: Lory May is 41 years old, married and has four children. She has been managing a store for income for about two years now.  She wants to continue selling more merchandise to attain good profits in her business. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to increase her merchandise. She will buy soft drinks, breads, soap, shampoo, and biscuits to sell. She will also keep extending good services to all her customers. Lory May will invest additional revenue for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, soap, shampoo, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Francisca requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Francisca has been in this business for 21 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Francisca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is 34 years old and married with two children. With both of her children currently in school, Bernadith works very hard to provide for them.

Bernadith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Bernadith has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, cereals, biscuits, sugar, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Bernadith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a 34-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ginalyn has a bag making business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 13 years.

Ginalyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric and thread for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric and threads for her bag making business.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwaka has had a business selling fish for over ten years. She sells from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es: Rosa de 35 años de edad, habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos en vivienda propia por lo que se siente feliz de poder brindar un lugar en el cual habitar. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de minutas y licuados, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Rosa desea invertir en su negocio y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: jarabes, hielo, azúcar, tamarindo, fruta, etc., para ofrecer mayor variedad de licuados y minutas. Con el crédito anterior Rosa logro construir el pasamano y mejorar el corredor, lugar donde realiza su negocio, por lo que se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en:
35-year-old Rosa lives with her life partner and 4 children in a house they own. She is happy to be able to provide them a place to live.

She is a very hard-working woman who has always been known for being enterprising. She works selling shaved ice and smoothies, a job that enables her to provide for her family.

Rosa wants to invest in her business, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest it in syrups, ice, sugar, tamarind, fruit, etc. in order to offer a greater variety of smoothies and shaved ice.

With the previous loan, Rosa was able to build the banister and improve the hallway, where she carries out her business. She is very thankful for this.

loans.use: to buy syrup, ice, sugar, tamarind, fruit, etc. in order to offer a greater variety of smoothies and shaved ice

loans.name: Lelan

texts.es:
Lelan continúa estudiando administración de empresas, y trabajando como cerrajero. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprarse una computadora portátil, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo trabajar con normalidad. Actualmente trabaja como cerrajero en un taller, realiza puertas metálicas, rejas, portones y otros, “trabajo de día y estudio en la noche…” comenta. la ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de equipo para estudiar. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y ejercer su carrera, el desea comprar una impresora multifunción, un scanner y una computadora de escritorio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Lelan solicita un préstamo para comprar una impresora multifunción, un scanner y una computadora de escritorio.
texts.en:
Lelan continues studying business administration and working as a locksmith. He used the loan that he obtained to buy himself laptop. The payment of his fees were punctual because he was able to work as normal. 

Presently, he works as a locksmith in a shop, making metallic doors, bars, gates, and others. "I work by day and study at night," he comments. The advantage of his occupations is that the schedules never run into each other. The disadvantage is the lack of equipment to study. 

His dream is to finish his studies and practice his career. He wants to buy a multifunction printer, a scanner, and a desktop computer.

This is the second loan sequence with the institution in 7 years that is dedicated to professional study.

It is for these reasons that Lelan is requesting a loan to buy a multifunction printer, a scanner, and a desktop computer.

loans.use: to buy a multifunction printer, a scanner, and desktop computer.

loans.name: Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Mandiri is a group that consists of five women. All the members live close to one another.

This group is led by Yosefina, a 42-year-old woman. She is married to Fransiskus, who is a 51-year-old bricklayer. They have been blessed with five children - two boys and three girls.
As a wife, Yosefina really wants to support her husband to fulfill their family's needs. She never wants her husband to work alone. That is why about three years ago she began a business as a pig farmer by buying a piglet with her savings of IDR 1,000,000. Currently, Yosefina has 11 piglets.

Yosefina is really interested in running another business from her house by selling kerosene. She wants to run this business because she thinks that it has good prospects. To achieve what she wants, Yosefina needs a loan to purchase jerry cans and kerosene. Therefore, when she got the information from the TLM staff about their Sesama product, she started to invite her neighbors who also needed loans for their businesses to join with her to form a group and apply for a loan of IDR 1,750,000 per person. The group members hope that, with this loan, all that they need to expand their businesses will materialize.

loans.use: to purchase jerry cans and kerosene.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 56-year-old divorced mother of three children. Eight years ago, she started selling detergents, candies, canned food, etc.. to cover the needs and expenses of her children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is well-known in her region.

Hala is working hard to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' requests.

Hala hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and provide her children with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her merchandise with new items and products

loans.name: Salmaan

texts.en:
Salmaan is a young man living in Rafah in the Gaza Strip. He works in the public sector, where his salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, Salmaan decided to open a new business. His business idea was to transport goods and inventory among traders in his rickshaw. A few years ago, Salmaan bought a new rickshaw and become well-known, so he has loyal customers.

Salmaan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to perform some maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Salmaan can work more efficiently and increase his sales and his profits.

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to perform some maintenance on his rickshaw.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 39 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se dedica desde hace 6 años a cuidar de sus cultivos de loroco, papaya y chile, dichos productos los vende por mayor en su vivienda, ya que sus productos son muy solicitados. Él se siente feliz de poder contar con su negocio en su vivienda, ya que esto le permite estar más cerca de su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad con los que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 39 años. Manuel desea mejorar su siembra de plátanos, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: fertilizantes, abono, etc., para mejorar su plantación de plátanos. Manuel se siente agradecido ya que con el crédito anterior logro construir su la pila y el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Manuel at 39 years of age is a hard-working man. He has spent 6 years caring for his loroco, papaya and chili crops. He sells these products wholesale at his house as his products have high demand. He feels happy to be able to have his business at his house as his allows him to be closer to his life companion and their two children aged 2 and 4 years old. He has lived in his house for 39 years.

Manuel wants to improve his plantain crops. So he has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in fertilizer, manure, etc. to improve his plantain plantation. Manuel feels very grateful as with his previous loan he managed to build the washstand/water storage and toilet for his house.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer, manure, etc. to improve his plantain plantation.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson is 57 years old and does dairy farming. He is married and blessed with four adult children. He has been in the dairy farming business for 20 years and it has been profitable. Besides dairy farming as his primary activity, he also sells clothes.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and he will use the loan to buy another dairy cow and hopes this will enable him to get more stock of milk to sell to provide for the needs of his family. He will use the genarated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to add more dairy cows and become a successful dairy farmer.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow and hopes this will enable him to get more stock of milk to sell to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.name: Juana Cristobalina

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad, es casada con una familia de 4 hijos de las edades entre 16 y 22 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomas La Unión.
Juana todos los días busca la forma de poder prosperar y así ofrecerle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida, ella trabaja como ama de casa en diferentes hogares de su comunidad, con esta actividad ella lleva 10 años de realizarlo.
Juana con el afán de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de instalar un negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes, pero su mayor dificultad es no contar con el dinero suficiente para adquirir sus productos, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos tales como: golosinas, gaseosas, fideos, azúcar y arroz.
Sus aspiraciones en la vida son: tener su propio negocio, mejorar su vivienda  y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a 43-year-old mother. She is married, with a family of 4 children between the ages of 16 and 22. This beautiful family lives in the community of Santo Tomas La Unión.

Every day, Juana searches out the way to be successful and give her children the best living situation. She works as domestic help in various homes in her community. She has been doing this job for 10 years.

Wanting to improve her living conditions, Juana has decided to start a business buying and selling groceries. But her biggest difficulty is that she doesn't have enough money to acquire her products. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy products such as sweets, soda, noodles, sugar, and rice.

Her life goals are to have her own business, to improve her home, and to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy groceries, such as sweets, soda, noodles, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a careful mother of five children. She is a conservative woman and asked her son Ahmad to take ‎her place in the photo. She is a kind and hardworking woman.‎ Ibtesam's husband works and earns a low income, so he cannot cover his son's education expenses on top of the family's household expenses.‎

Now Ahmad, who appears in the photo, is a student in his second year and he is doing well. Ibtesam always ‎tries to provide a good quality education to her children, so she asked for a loan to pay for her son's university tuition. She awaits your mercy.‎

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Yadira Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yadira de 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo, Luis de 8 años de edad, su hijo estudia en una institución de la localidad, ella es una mujer que trabaja en la agricultura, sin horario alguno, ella se dedica a este trabajo muy duro que requiere de mucha dedicación y esfuerzo hace 15 años atrás. El dinero que genera esta actividad es su único ingreso.
Doña Yadira solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, así sus sembríos no se dañaran y podrá sacarlos al mercado.
texts.en:
Yadira, 38 years old and married, lives with her husband and son, Luis, who is 8 years old. Her son studies in the local school. She is a mother who works in agriculture, without a particular schedule. She has done this very hard work, which requires a lot of dedication and effort, for 15 years. The money she earns through this work is her only income.

Doña Yadira is requesting this loan for the purchase of fertilizer, so her fields don't become damaged, allowing her to bring her product to market.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Katiba

texts.en:
Katiba is a divorced woman with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Katiba operates a grocery vegetable-selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Shanaz's Group

texts.en:
Shanaz is 46 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small shop in which he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income for household expenses. He always tries to improve his business by offering the latest cosmetic products. Nowadays, the latest cosmetic products on the market are expensive and in very high demand.

Shanaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will give the full amount to her husband so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial creams, hair colors, makeover kits, lipstick, nail polish, etc. She hopes that, with this loan, he will be able to enhance his business.

Shanaz is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy the latest cosmetic goods for her husband's cosmetics store.

loans.name: Niftulla

texts.en:
Niftulla is 45 years old, married and has two children. He lives in Baku City with his children and wife. His wife is a nurse. His children are 14 and 17 years old. One of the children studies in high school and the other plays football. Niftulla's salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses.

Niftulla has applied to Komak company. Today he needs his first loan in the amount of 1800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) because his car is broken and he can't work, so with this amount he is planning to buy a new engine motor for his car and increase his monthly income. He is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help. In the future Niftulla wants to give a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy a new engine motor for his car and increase his monthly income.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 58 years old, married and involved in a food-selling business as a source of her income. She cooks lumpia (spring rolls) and sells them. She had been in her business over two years now. She would like to continue sell delicious foods; that is why she needs additional revolving capital in her business. She is now asking for a loan of P13,000 to buy ingredients, meat and wrappers used in her food-selling business.

In the future, Evelyn hopes to save funds for her family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, meat and food wrappers to use in her food-selling business.

loans.name: Huseen

texts.en:
Hussen lives in Rafah in the Gaza Strip. In the past he worked in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to start his own business using a tuk-tuk, or rickshaw, to transport goods and inventory among companies. He subsequently accrued many loyal customers.

A few years ago Hussen bought a new tuk-tuk. He has now applied for a 2,000 USD loan through Kiva's field partner FATEN to do some maintenance on it. With his tuk-tuk up to speed Hussen will be able to work more efficiently and increase his profits.

loans.use: to do some maintenance on his tuk-tuk, or rickshaw.

loans.name: Unión Ninfas-Joyitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN NINFAS-JOYITAS” iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Irma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de chuño, tienda de barrio, tienda de abarrotes, venta de salchipapas (comida rápida tradicional), venta de coca, venta de helados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Irma es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una sobrina que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio cuando se retiró de su empleo hace seis años y lo emprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de gaseosas, detergente por mayor) que adquirirá de los proveedores que van a ofrecer estos productos a su tienda y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la otorgación de los créditos que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Unión Ninfas-Joyitas" is starting its 18th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela focal center. It is made up of 8 members and is run by a directive board, of which Irma is the president.
