The communal bank members run various businesses, including cheese sales, freeze-dried potato sales, a neighborhood store, a grocery store, salchipapa sales (a traditional fast food), coca leaf sales, and ice cream sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, including Irma. She says that 8 years ago, she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of her niece, who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a neighborhood grocery store business. She says that she started this business when she retired from her job six years ago, and she started it of her own initiative.

She is taking out the current loan to increase her capital (to buy soda and detergent wholesale). She buys from the suppliers that come to offer these products to her store, and later sells them at her place of business. This work enables her to generate resources to support her family economically. She is married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy soda and detergent wholesale

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es: Odilia de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 16 años vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene es como lgra sacar a delante a sus hijos, por esa razon esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos para una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Odilia, 38, lives in her own house with her five children. She has been making a living selling fruits and vegetables for sixteen years. She sells itinerantly in the different neighborhoods near her house. With the earnings she makes, she is able to raise her children.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale and thus be able to have better economic income for better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Klodian

texts.en: Klodian is in the photograph with his wife, Sonila, and their little bundle, in front of their house. The reason for this loan is to stock up on winter inventory of second-hand clothes that they will resell.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, ella se dedica a la venta de pescaditas fritas su negocio esta ubicado en la playa que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, inicio con ese negocio despues de terminar sus estudios de bechillerato y por la falta de empleo, pero con sus ventas obtiene buenas ganancias y es asi como puede salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de pescaditas por mayor y continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: This young woman has her face blurred in the above photo because she is 26-years old and lives in a dangerous area.  She makes her living selling small fried fish.  Her busienss is located near the beach, which is close to her home.  She started the business after finishing high school, as there was a lack of job opportunities.  However, she earns a good income from her sales and as such is able to get ahead.  She lives in her own home with her husband and their two children.  She is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale small fish so she can continue with her sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale small fish.

loans.name: Maura Cecilia

texts.es: Maura de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermana, ella se dedica a la venta de verdura picada desde hace 8 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de verduras por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Maura is 49-years old.  She lives in her own home with her sister.  Maura has been making her living selling diced vegetables for the last eight years.  Her business is located in the municipal market and she has a lot of customers.  With her earnings, Maura is able to meet some of her household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale vegetables so she can keep up with her sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Betel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BETEL” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medicina natural, venta de huminta (masa de maíz y queso), venta de ropa, venta de calzado, venta de electrodoméstico, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de medicina natural; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con su mamá hace veinte años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de hierbas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto, esta compra le ayudara a preparar las medicinas naturales para posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Betel" will begin the the ninth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Santiago Il. It is composed of eight members and is directed by a board of directors in which Justina is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank pursue are varied. Among them include: natural medicine sales, huminta (corn and cheese dough) sales, clothing sales, shoe sales, electrical appliance sales, and transportation services.

The loan that they will receive will benefit small micro business owners in which Justina is a member. She points out that 5 years ago when she joined Pro Mujer, she came by the invitation of a friend who is a customer of the institution. Presently, she has a business selling natural medicine. She announced that she started this business with her mother twenty years ago.

The loan that she will now receive will be to increase capital (the purchase of wholesale herbs) that she will acquire from the major merchants in the city of El Alto. This purchase will help her prepare her natural medicines to subsequently sell them in her sale space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, now that she is married and has three children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale herbs.

loans.name: La Colmena Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LA  COLMENA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Micaela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de máquinas para costura, venta de accesorios para celulares, venta de frutas, venta de jugos de frutas, venta de comida. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Micaela es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y hace varios años decidió emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. "La Colmena" which will begin its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Santiago II, is composed of ten members, and is managed by a board of directors, where Mrs. Micaela is the president. The businesses that the members of the comunal association run are varied, and among them are the sale of clothing, sewing machines, cell phone accessories, fruit, fruit juice, and food.

The loan taken out benefits small micro-businesses where Mrs. Micaela is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago through an invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food, which, she wants it to be known, she learned from her mother. Many years ago, she decided to launch her own business.

The loan that she will take out now will be for the growth of capital (the purchase of wholesale potatoes and freeze-dried potatoes) which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, and afterwards for manufacure and sale in her retail space. This form of work allows Mrs. Micaela to generate resources for economically supporting her family, given that she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mrs. Micaela responded that she likes the health area and training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and chuño [freeze dried potatoes] at wholesale.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 52-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children, who are still studying. Her husband is the main income provider; he works as a farmer and Souad works from home as a tailor.

Currently, with the aim to pay her children's study fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She is a permanent customer and she insists that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her children - this is their only target.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees.

loans.name: Norma Beatriz

texts.es: Norma es una mujer emprendedora de 24 años de edad que vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 2 años de edad a la que siempre busca la manera de brindar lo mejor. Norma se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos, con lo cual logra cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Norma desea ampliar su vivienda, por lo que ha decidido cerrar la galera que se observa en la fotografía para ampliar la vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para ampliar su vivienda cerrando la galera.
texts.en: Norma is an enterprising 24-year old woman who lives with her husband and their 2-year old daughter.  Norma is always looking for a way to give her daughter the best.  Norma makes her living as a domestic worker, through which she is able to cover her household's basic necessities.  She wants to add on to her home, so she has decided to close in her storeroom, which can be see in the above photograph.  Norma is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal, wood, nails and wire so she can add on to her home by closing in her storeroom.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to add on to her house by  closing in her storeroom.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es: Rosa de 49 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su sus dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños de forma ambulante desde hace 15 años. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar, la clienta desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para lo cual solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa como: faldas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, ropa interior, etc. y de esta forma espera mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. She has made a living selling clothing for women, men, and children by foot for the past 15 years. In this way she earns a living and supports the home.

She wants to invest in her business with the purchase of large quantities of merchandise. She is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing such as skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, undergarments, etc. In this way she wants to improve her sales and income in order to improve the quality of life for her and her children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing such as skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, undergarments, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres La Esperanza De Paculam Group

texts.es:
Antonieta es una mujer de 31 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de la aldea Guineales.
Antonieta (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella lleva 2 años de realizar esta actividad. Antonieta tiene todos los deseos de superarse por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes, con el crédito ella comprara güipiles, fajas y cortes.Su gran sueño es seguir fortaleciendo sus negocio.
texts.en:
Antonieta is a 31-year old woman. She is single and lives with her parents and siblings in a Guineales neighborhood.

Antonieta (first from the left in the above photograph) earns her income and helps her parents with the household expenses by buying and selling traditional clothing. She has been in the business for two years. Antonieta is very motivated to improve her situation, and that is why she is requesting a loan. She wants to purchase more merchandise and better meet her customers' demand. With the loan, Antonieta will purchase traditional blouses, sashes and Mayan skirts. Her greatest dream is to continue strengthening her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing, such as  Mayan skirts, sashes and traditional blouses.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a conservative woman, so she asked her daughter Leena to take her place in the photo.‎

Nisreen is a 42-year-old married mother of four children. One of them is Leena, who appears in ‎the photo: she is studying to get her bachelor's degree in English language. She was lucky to be able to study ‎because she is the only family member that did, and now Nisreen is applying for the loan to help Leena pay ‎for her semester fees. Leena's ambition is to find work in her field so her mom can rest and help her siblings ‎in their education.‎

loans.use: to help her daughter pay ‎for her semester fees.

loans.name: Doumou

texts.en: Doumou is a 24-year-old married woman living with her husband and only child. She is a housewife and her husband is responsible for satisfying the family's needs and being able to live in a good lifestyle. Today, in order to pay her child’s end-of-school-year fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay the school fees and ensure appropriate education for him.

loans.use: to pay her child’s end-of-school-year fees.

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es: Rosa de 49 es una empresaria independiente que habita en Barranquilla en compañía de su cónyuge, ella se inició en el comercio de mercancía por la propuesta que recibió de una amiga que por años ha comercializado artículos y maquillajes, de este modo su amiga logró incorporarla a una empresa de multinivel que promueve distintos productos a través de la oferta del catálogo.  Hoy en día cuenta con dos años que decidió hacer parte de esta forma masiva de comercialización mostrando óptimos resultados, con los que ha favorecido la economía de la familia y en la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en mercancía; cremas para el cuidado facial, perfumes, productos capilares, entre otros productos que planea promocionar entre su clientela en este  último trimestre del año y garantizar que su clientela se mantenga surtida de los productos que acostumbra a utilizar.  Su meta a futuro es abrir un local y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 49-years old, is an independent business woman who lives in Barranquilla with her husband. She started selling merchandise at the suggestion of a friend who, for years, has sold make-up and various items. Rosa's friend brought her into a multi-level business that sells various catalog products. It has been two years since Rosa decided to take part in this huge commercialization effort. She has had optimal results, which has been favorable for her family's finances.

Rosa is currently requesting a loan, her first Credikiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so she can invest in merchandise. She will purchase facial lotions, perfumes, hair products and other items that she plans to promote to her clientele in this final trimester of the year. This will guarantee that her clientele will be well-stocked with the products they are used to using.

Rosa's future goals are to open a store and to remodel her home.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise: facial lotions, perfumes, hair products and other items.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
SHAHIDA is a 42-year-old married and responsible person. She is living in a populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her children are growing and their needs are growing as well. She wants to educate them in higher colleges after their school period; to meet their educational expenses in the future, she wants to increase her husband's daily sales and savings as well.

Her husband is a goods distributor by profession; he purchases goods of various brands related to general store items, such as laundry and other kinds of soaps, and sells them to the retailers. He wants to increase his distribution on a daily basis, and excess goods are required for that as well. The major problem is the lack of availability of funds. He hopes that with the help of the loan amount, he can fill his shop with fresh stock. In this way he can easily cope with the increasing demand of retailers and can generate additional income with which to cherish his family.

Therefore, SHAHIDA has requested a Kiva loan through Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan her husband can easily purchase his desired inventory. He wishes to move his shop in a nearby market to enhance his daily sales. For this purpose he will ensure some savings through the additional generated income.

SHAHIDA is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy general store items, such as laundry and other kinds of soaps, for her husband's goods distributing business.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen, a 26-year old single lady, is one of four family members. She was a victim of her parents' divorce. ‎Haneen has delayed the completion of her education because of the financial difficulties, and she had to work to ‎help her mother with household expenses. She has to work in gold manufacturing for three days a week, and ‎the other three days she goes to her collage. Haneen is studying fashion, and she chose this major because she has a talent for sewing and design.‎

Due to the high cost of living Haneen wants to apply for a loan to help her cover her semester fees and ‎achieve her dreams. She wants proof for the world that girls can defy the ‎obstacles without ‎help from anyone.‎

loans.use: to help her cover her semester fees and ‎achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de frutas, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este negocio que le permite salir adelante. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace varios años, sus hijos ya hicieron sus propios hogares pero no se olvidan de su madre y le brindan su apoyo económico. María siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer tenaz que siempre busca las mejoras y es por ello que desea invertir en mayor cantidad de frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: mango, jícamas, papaya, sandia, etc., para mejorar sus negocios. Con el crédito anterior María encemento una parte de su corredor, pero con la otra parte del crédito inicio su venta de frutas.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old.  She is a hardworking woman who makes a living selling a variety of fruits.  For that she feels happy to be able to count on this business that allows her to get ahead.  She has lived in her own house for many years.  Her children have already formed their own households, but they do not forget about their mother and provide her with financial support.  María has always been known for being a tenacious woman who always seeks improvement.

That is why she wants to invest in a larger quantity of fruits to offer to her customers.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in mango, jicama, papaya, watermelon, etc., to improve her business.  With the previous loan, María cemented her veranda, but with the other part of the loan she started her fruit sales.

loans.use: To invest in mango jicama, papaya, watermelon, etc, to improve her sales.

loans.name: Mercedes De Jesus

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 30 años de edad que vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 10 y 8 años de edad a las que apoya para que estudien. Ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa, la cual realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo el mercado municipal, lo que le permite cubrir los gastos económicos de su familia. Mercedes desea reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para reparar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta forma proteger a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 30 years old.  She lives with her life partner and her two children ages 10 and 8, whom she supports so that they can go to school.  She makes a living selling clothing, which she does as a street vendor going to the municipal markets.  This allows her to cover the economic costs of her family.

Mercedes wants to repair the roof of her house, since as you can see in the photograph, it is deteriorated.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheets, poles, and pins to repair the roof of her house as soon as possible and in this way protect her children.

loans.use: To invest in galvanized sheets, poles, and pins to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña libreria ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años y posee muchos clientes por la variedad de productos, cn lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive con su esposo y su hija, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, pegamentos, papel, bond, utiles escolres, entre otras cosas todo por mayor y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been pixelated for being 27 years old and living in a high risk area, owns a small bookstore that has been located in her home for five years.  She has a lot of customers for the variety of products.  With what she earns in sales, she is able to meet some of the costs of her home.  The young woman lives with her husband and her daughter.

She is requesting a loan to buy notebooks, pens, glue, paper, bond, and school supplies among other things, all wholesale, and thus have better economic income.

loans.use: To buy wholesale notebooks, pens, glue, paper, bond, and school supplies among other things.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is married and has nine kids, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle spare parts business from home. Her potential customers are motorcycle operators. Her major challenge is high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanamkasi operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Los Agricultores De Panimache Quinto Alto Group

texts.es:
Diego es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de 4 hijos de las edades entre 5 y 10 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad  de Chichicastenango.
Diego (el que se encuentra en medio de los tres) para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 20 años, él tiene la fortuna de contar con el apoyo de su esposa quien trabaja vendiendo güipiles. A Diego le preocupa mucho que su familia no cuente con energía eléctrica pues sus hijos estudian y la situación es incómoda para ellos. Diego con el afán de darle a su familia un mejor bienestar solicita un préstamo para la instalación de energía eléctrica para su hogar.
Su gran sueño es terminar la construcción de su casa, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is the father of family.  He is 30 years old.  He is married with a beautiful family of four children between the ages of 5 and 10.  This humble family lives in a community of Chichicastenango.  

Diego, (the one in the middle of the three) in order to obtain his income and to get his family ahead, has worked in masonry for 20 years.  He is fortunate to have the support of his wife who works selling huipiles (traditional woven blouses).  Diego worries a lot that his family does not have electricity since his children study and the situation is uncomfortable for them.

Diego, in an effort to give his family the best welfare, is requesting a loan to install electricity in his home.  His grand dream is to finish building his house and to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: To install electricity.

loans.name: Aysha's Group

texts.en:
AYSHA is 31, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store; he speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his good behavior, he has built up very good relations among his customers. Due to good relationships his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.

Therefore, AYSHA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and assures that she will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Lorena Yamilet

texts.es: Lorena es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 35 años de edad habita en vivienda propia y humilde al lado de su compañero de vida y su hijo de 1 año y 9 meses de edad. Lorena se gana la vida, promoviendo salud, ya que labora para una institución de salud de la zona, lo cual le ha permitido salir adelante desde hace 9 años. Lorena desea cambiar las láminas de paredes y techo de su vivienda, ya que estas se encuentran deterioradas y ella teme por la seguridad de su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, alambre y clavos para cambiar las láminas de paredes y techo.
texts.en:
Lorena is a hardworking woman who, at 35 years old, lives in her own humble house with her life partner and her son who is 1 year 9 months old.  Lorena makes a living by promoting health and works for a health institution in the area, which has allowed her to get ahead for the past nine years.

Lorena wants to change the sheets of the walls and the roof of her house since these are damaged and she fears for the security of her family.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheets, wood, wires, and nails to change the sheets of the walls and roof.

loans.use: To invest in sheets, wood, wire, and nails to change the sheets of the walls and roof.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with nine kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kwekwe operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa works a lot, as she sells fish at the market almost every day. Felipa lives with her daughter and is divorced. She is the owner of the house where she lives.

Felipa needs a loan to buy fish for her business. In the picture, Felipa is with her co workers. She is the woman on the right. Felipa needs your help because as you can see, she has a lot of competition.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 36 year old married woman living with her husband and mother of three children. Her husband is the main income source in the family, He owns a grocery store in his town. With the aim to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay their school educational fees. Her only dream is to ensure them a heavy life and helped them to achieve high educational levels and being always able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to pay their school educational fees

loans.name: Maria Pilar

texts.en:
Maria Pilar lives in Badian, Cebu. She is a mother to four children ages one to eleven. She has been in the hog raising business for twelve years now. She also sell purified water in her neighborhood. Recently, she earned PH6000 per month from her business.

Maria Pilar is asking a loan to buy more piglets. With the loan, she will be able to grow more pigs thus giving her more opportunity of higher revenue. She wants to develop and improve her business to better provide for her children. She believes in the power of hard work. Her earnings will be for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more piglets
